loans.name: Geneviève

texts.fr: Dame T. Geneviève âgée de 48 ans est née à Porto Novo au sud est du Bénin. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, Tobi âgé de 20 ans, Cedric âgé de 16 ans et Rose âgée de 10 ans, tous scolarisés. Elle achète des tissus au marché et des chiffons auprès des grossistes, puis revient coudre elle-même ses coussins qu'elle vend au marché. Vu l'ampleur que prend son activité, elle veut acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre pour être plus rapide et satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle à temps.
texts.en:
Mrs. Geneviève T. is 48 years old and was born in Porto Novo south east of Benin. She is married and the mother of three (3) children who have attended school; Tobi age 20, Cedric age 16 and Rose age 10. She buys fabric at the marketplace and cloth filler from wholesalers, then at home, sews the cushions herself to sell at the marketplace. In order to increase her business she would like to purchase a newer sewing machine that would service her customers more quickly.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 35 años es soltera e independiente.  Se dedica a trabajar en su botica, a la cual le dedica casi todo el día, vive sola, lo cual hace que se distraiga en su trabajo y no sienta la soledad, eso es lo que le gusta de su trabajo.  Por otro lado, es muy cansado tener que atender todo el día en su farmacia, pero para ella eso se le hace mínimo, lo más importante es que con su farmacia puede ayudar a mucha gente que se siente mal y aliviar su dolor.  Con el dinero del préstamo seguirá trabajando duro en su farmacia, comprando más medicinas para que su negocio esté mejor implementado para las necesidades de sus clientes y en el fututo ser una gran empresa.
texts.en:
Eva is 35 years old; she is single and independent. She makes a living working at her pharmacy, where she spends most of her day. She lives alone, so her job keeps her entertained and keeps her from feeling lonely, which is why she likes her work. On the other hand, it is very tiring to have to work all day at the pharmacy. Nonetheless, to her it is a minor concern; the most important thing is that her pharmacy can help many ill people to feel better. With the loan money, she will continue to work hard at her pharmacy, purchasing more medicines so that her business is better serves the needs of her customers, and in the future, be a great business.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more medicines for her pharmacy

loans.name: Djahid

texts.en:
Djahid (his father is pictured) is married and has 3 children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli town and lives in the Fuzuli region's Bala Bahmanli village.
He was born in 1958. Djahid and his father have run the butcher business for 5 years. Now they need a loan of 800 AZN to  buy meat to improve their business.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Normie

texts.en:
Normie lives in Barangay Lullutan Ilagan, Isabela, where the Lullutan River is located and where ferry boats are the only way to get to the other side of the river. Their village is small and the people’s primary source of income is rice and corn farming. She is married to a tricycle driver and blessed with three children. They hope that someday, through God’s grace, they will able to send their children to school and finish college.

They own one unit of a passenger tricycle, which provides the financial resources to cope with their growing needs. Her husband operates their passenger tricycle. To help him provide for the family, Normie is planning to open her own community-based village store, but she doesn't have enough money. Moreover, the tricycle needs an overhaul (repair) because it is old and earning less for the family. In order to fulfill her plans, she is asking for a loan of Php5,000.  She will then be able to support her husband. 

Normie and her husband believe in God’s promise that if they would abide in Him, God will give them whatever they ask for. She prays a lot and is very positive that in the coming days they will be able to overcome all challenges that will come their way.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam C. was born in 1954, and she now lives in Traping Chok village in Kandal province. She owns a small grocery store in the local marketplace. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Sam C. is a 54-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is a car repairer while the other one attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Muminakhon

texts.en:
M. Muminakhon is 41 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of two children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now she dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle. With the income she generates she provides a better quality of life for her children, who are her greatest joy and have become her best friends. She is asking for a US$700 loan with the term of 5 months in order to buy more young cattle to later sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially increase her earnings and improve her quality of life. Let’s support this dedicated mother's proposal. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was a key post along the Silk Road and is where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It is famous for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle in order to expand the business and improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has owned a small general store in the Mwera neighborhood of Zanzibar for 2 years. She belongs to the Nia njema loan group (Group code 2007). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $25. Every day she works at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items (meat and soap) for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business 

Fatma is 22 years old, married, and has one child.

loans.use: To buy meat, soap and other items for her busness.

loans.name: Umarhoja

texts.ru: Умарходже 30 лет, женат. Его жена нигде не работает, сидит дома с 3-мя малолетними детьми. Ранее Умарходжа ездил в Россию на заработки, но постепенно те места где он подрабатывал не покрывали его расходов и он решил приехать в Таджикистан и начал здесь заниматься предпрнимательством. Направление его бизнеса – это реализация электротоваров (электропровода, лампочки, предохранители и тп). Бизнес налажен и имеет постоянных клиентов. В данном бизнесе не помешает привлечение дополнительных денег и Умарходжа решил обратиться в Микроинвест за займом.
texts.en:
Umarhoja is 30 years old. He is married. His wife is unemployed - she is a stay-at-home mom. Umarhoja used to do seasonal work in Russia but with time his earnings stopped covering his expenses, and he decided to come back to Tajikistan and start his own business. Now he sells electrical appliances (wires, lamps, etc.) The business is run well; Umarhoja has regular clients. Since in business extra cash never hurts, Umarhoja decided to get a loan from Microinvest.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Kosar Sabir Group

texts.en:
Kosar S. and her husband have lived in the city of Kot Radha Kishanin the Punjab province of Pakistan for the past 11 years. Kosar is a very hardworking lady. In addition to all her family duties, she runs a vegetable selling business out of a room of her house.  Her husband has had a fruit selling business for the past 6 years. He sells his products from a cart in the community. Kosar successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her husband’s fruit selling business. 

This is a group loan. Kosar is the leader of this group, which consists of her and two another women from her locality. Asma Nazir wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Shazia S. wants a loan to buy clothes for her cloth selling business. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits for selling

loans.name: Yenina Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Yenina Lidia A. Y. tiene 22 años vive en Asentamiento Humano Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, no siguió más estudios debido a que se casó y se dedicó a su hogar. Tiene 01 pequeña hija que depende enteramente de ella.
Yenine se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, al inicio se dedicó a la venta de pasteles, luego inicio la venta de productos de belleza hace 4 años, negocio que le es muy rentable y le da muchas ganancias que le han permitido comprar una refrigeradora la que ahora utiliza para vender gaseosas. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de màs productos de belleza y gaseosas.
Yenine sueña con tener una bodega y estudiar ingles.
texts.en:
Ms. Yenina Lidia A. Y. is 22 years old and lives in the Aurora Díaz housing settlement, district of Salaverry,Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú.She completed her secondary studies but did not continue to study because she married and dedicated herself to her home. She has one small daughter that depends entirely on her. Yenina is dedicated to selling beauty products. At the beginning she dedicated herself to selling cakes but then began to sell beauty products four years ago, a business that is very profitable and gives her a lot of income that has allowed her to purchase a refrigerator that she now uses to sell soft drinks. Her business is run from her home. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from the communal bank "Las Auroras en Acción II" she invested in the purchase of beauty products. With the credit of 800 soles, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of more beauty products and soft drinks. Yenina's dream is to have a store and study English.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products and soft drinks

loans.name: Yik

texts.en: Mrs. Yik U. lives in Trapaing Snaur village in Takeo province. She is a grocer and owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Pen Pang, is a farmer who owns a piece of land and cultivates rice. Mrs. Yik U. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income. She is 48 years old and the mother of two children;one is employed in a garment factory and the other is attending the local school. She and her husband are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding to earn more income.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo B. is 41 years old. He and his wife have 7 children.  He lives in Tuburan Cagayan de Oro City. Danilo's primary source of income is through traditional gold mining, locally term pamiling. Danilo wakes up early and go to the pamiling area (near the Tuburan River).  The whole day, under the heat of the sun or even when raining, Danilo pursues his work to earn money. Usually he can bring home 300 to 500 pesos from the gold he mines in a day.  This time, Danilo is applying for a third-cycle loan from HSPFI, a KIVA partner. The amount released to him will be used for the enrollment of his children in school. Danilo is looking forward to spending time as a good member of HSPFI.

loans.use: To enroll his children in school

location.town: Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Vat V., 35, earns her daily income by selling a few wares, including pork, vegetables, and fish. She uses her old bicycle to sell this produce door-to-door in the village. Additionally, she and her husband cultivate rice and vegetable crops on their own farmland. The family's house is lacking some parts, since the family's financial problems have stopped them from completing its construction. Therefore, Vat V. has decided to seek a $700 loan to buy housing equipment to fill the lacking part of her house. She and her husband are in the picture.

loans.use: To buy housing equipment

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille D. runs a sari-sari or general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc. in the local community. She is 26 years old, married and has one infant child. She is from the village of Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Cecille has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Cecille joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Cecille is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly H. is a woman of 44 years living in the capital of Phnom Penh. She is a good mother, caring for three teenage children. One of the children is on the sewing staff of a garment factory and the others are still living at home. She is married to Las Osman, age 44, who is a mobile cooked-goods seller. Ly H. hopes to encourage her husband to attain a new suitable job as a taxi driver, because she saw that this sector is a profitable one for the family, but she lacks the money to make that possible. Therefore, she H. decided to ask for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL to be used as capital to add to her personal savings to buy a used car for her husband to begin running a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a used car for her husband to begin running a taxi

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina sells various types of cereal grains and tea leaves at her business in the Oile Market of Kisumu. She was born in the southern part of Nyanza Province in a town called Kendu Bay. Amina has been selling for about ten years, and has her favorite suppliers of tea from Mombasa. She says that since other people are selling the same items as her, she has to work hard to gain loyal customers. With her loan proceeds, she plans on increasing her stock of tea and cereals so that she is able to provide a good selection to each of her customers.

At 42, Amina struggles at times to pay her four children’s school expenses. She is a widow, and she is the only source of income the family has. Her dream is to buy a house of her own instead of renting like she currently does. She says that her children are smart, but are currently being held back by a lack of financial resources. She would like to remedy that situation by earning more through her business.

Amina has already overcome a lot of adversity. At the end of 2007 and beginning of 2008, her business was looted and destroyed in the aftermath of the Kenyan election. She says that to this day, her business has been slow to recover. Her hope is that this loan will provide the necessary boost to get her and her family back on their feet.

loans.use: A new supply of tea leaves and cereals for resale

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng K. lives in Poun village in Takeo province. She runs a general store where she sells grocery goods, vegetables, and baskets. She is 36 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Her husband, Mr. Hy Hak, is a basket maker and he is shown on the left in the photo. He is also a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he needs some money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizer to support the field. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Seng K. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the Mnazi borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 42 years old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 19, 16,and 13 years old.

Lucy has owed a clothing business selling sweaters for 14 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 30,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Lucy`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh  in order to buy more sweaters for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the us of this loan, Lucy hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sweaters

loans.name: Nyume

texts.en:
Nyume J. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and onions and is requesting a loan to purchase beans and rice to sell as well. Nyume is 30 years old and married to a husband who is a peasant. She has four children and they all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Edith Xiomara

texts.es: Edith Xiomara B. D. R. D. 31 años D. edad resiD. en Mejicanos municipio del departamento D. San Salvador. Edith vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos Jerson D. 8 años y Emilio D. un año D. edad. Edith recibe el apoyo económico D. su esposo quien trabaja como profesor, pero Edith lo apoya económicamente,  con su pequeño negocio, una librería que no tiene competencia alguna en la zona, Edith venD. variedad D. productos D. uso básico, pero ahora quiere surtir su negocio para ir expandiéndose  y obteniendo mayores ventas.
texts.en:
Edith Xiomara B. D. R., 31, lives in the Mejicanos municipality in the San Salvador department. Edith lives with her husband and their two children. Jerson is eight, and Emilio is one. Edith receives economic support from her husband who works as a teacher. Edith helps him economically with her small business. She has a bookstore, which has no competition in the region. Edith sells a variety of products for basic use. But, she now wants to stock her business to expand it and get greater sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize flour and beans to sell.

loans.name: Svitlana

texts.en:
Svitlana is married and has one son. She is an entrepreneur from the town of Skvira, where she sells groceries -she owns two vending locations at two different markets. Svitlana has been in this business for 5 years. She has one hired employee who works at one of her vending kiosks. Currently, she has 65,000 Grivnyas invested in merchandise. Her average net profit amounts to 5,800 Grivnyas a month. 

Svitlana is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise and stock one of her grocery kiosks with confectionery inventory for the upcoming holiday season. Svitlana is very enthusiastic about her venture and business. She invests all her energy in her business and seeks its growth.

loans.use: to stock one of her kiosks with additional merchandise

loans.name: Mohammad Hasham Ameir Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Marzya is the group leader of M. H. Ameir M. group. There are six members in this group. Marzya is 48 years old and married with five children, three daughters and two sons. They are in school. She wants to take a loan to improve her husband’s business, a fuel selling shop.

Sameyna and Zaynab want to take a loan for their home-based business of carpet weaving. They need a loan for their business to progress. Safya and Shakyllah want to take a loan for their husbands' shared business of a general store and vegetable selling. Both women clean and package the vegetables, and then their husbands sell them in their shop. They want to expand their business. And Saleha wants to take a loan for her husband, who has a car part shop. He wants to make his shop larger. 

They requested a group loan of 60,000 Afghani. With this loan they can make their businesses larger, support their families and make a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To expand their businesses, such as fuel sales

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama sells groceries and baby things in her shop to make a living. She has been in this business for four years. Her greatest joy in her business is the profits that she makes. Adama is a single lady without a child. She is 29 years old. Adama is very enthusiastic and optimistic about the future growth of her business. She hopes for a loan of 70,000 NGN to purchase more groceries and baby things to sell. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and baby things to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: L. Sra. María Martínez D. L. C. D. 24 años D. edad,  vive con su esposo y su menor hijo en casa propia D. material noble con techo D. caña ubicada en el Caserío D. Sacta Distrito D. Santiago. Perciben ingresos trabajando como obreros D. campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 2 años D. experiencia. Solicita el préstamo para poder terminar D. construir su vivienda que esta en plena construcción. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin D. alcanzar una mejor calidad D. vida. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar a través D. estos financiamientos.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Martínez D. L. C. is 24 years-old and lives with her husband and their young child. They live in their own house maD. of good materials and a roof maD. of reeds, located in the town of Sacta Distrito in Santiago. They both earn wages working as field workers for an agricultural-industrial company and have two years of experience. They are asking for this loan to be able to finish building their house which is still being constructed. Their dream is to succeed in building all of their home, thus improving their quality of life. Both of them are grateful for the support that we can proviD. them through these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of home.

loans.name: Dina Nora

texts.es:
La señora Dina es socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” desde hace 10 años, vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y  venta de calzado.

Dina nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar zapatos y zapatillas de diversas tallas y modelos.

Su sueño para el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio y así progresar junto a su familia.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y las reuniones con las compañeras.
texts.en:
Dina, 30, has been a member of the "Alto Alianza" communal bank for 10 years. She lives in the Yunguyo province, Puno department. She is married and has 3 children. She finished elementary school and she is a shoe merchant. Dina tells us that her first, 300 sol, loan from the Manuela Ramos Movement increased her capital and she bought more products. She is now asking for 800 new soles to buy shoes and sandals in various sizes and styles. Her dream for the future is to have her business grow and together get ahead with her family. What she likes best about her communal bank is the get-togethers with her fellow members.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha Z., 51, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Constantino Z., a jeepney (small bus) driver, they are blessed with two children. In order to ensure that their family can have a better life, she helps her husband manage their jeepney business.

Editha has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than seven years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow 18 times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to buy auto parts for their jeep.   

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 25,000 loan. This amount will be used for registration expenses and the purchase of needed auto parts for their jeep.

Editha dreams that someday they will buy a van to be used as a transport service so that they will earn enough money to finance their children's college education. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: registration expenses and needed auto parts for their jeep

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Sifa is 31 years old and is married with one child. She and her little family live in the Gasabo district.

Sifa has been a self-employed businesswoman selling meat since 2003. The hours of her butcher shop are from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Sifa, during the time she was starting this business, could not get enough clients to the extent that she could not sell one cow per day. But now her number of customers has so much increased that she can't even satisfy them. Sifa needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can purchase one more cow for sale. She also wants to start selling the meat of sheep and hens.

With this additional business, Sifa hopefully will earn more profits. Those profits will allow her and her family to build a secure future for themselves and keep their business financially stable.

loans.use: To buy one more cow, sheep and hen

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en: To supply additional income for her family, Merlita E. has been running a farm for almost 15 years. She is 46 years old, married and has two minor children. She lives in the province of Rizal with her husband, Amador. He is a farmer and works closely with Merlita. Merlita would like to receive a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase additional materials for her business including palay (rice seeds), insecticides and other supplies, and to cover labor expenses. Merlita believes that the loan will help to grow her farming business and be the drive for increased revenue. Mercedita has been a proud member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 1999. She is a dedicated member demonstrating regular attendance at weekly meetings and steady repayments on previous loans. Her long-term goals are to maintain the profitability of her business, to build a concrete and durable home, and to support the education of her children. Merlita is hopeful that her farming business venture will continue to grow and improve the overall standard of living for her entire family. About ASHI Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of the Grameen Bank approach (GBA) to deliver credit to the poorest of the poor in the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the role models for credit delivery to the poor in the country.

loans.use: To purchase palay (rice seeds), insecticides and other supplies, and to cover labor expenses

loans.name: Lilia's Group

texts.en: Lilia G. is from the village of Palutan. She is 40 years old and is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lilia G.. Lilia is married and has five school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Lilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tuul

texts.en:
Tuul is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Tuv province, Mongolia in an apartment which they own. He has two sons, the oldest of which is 28 years old and works as a specialist for a mining company. His youngest son, Purevochir, is 26 years old, and has been working in Japan for the last two years.

Tuul operates a taxi service business in his home town. He previously worked as a driver for a local organization between 1977-2003, but has operated independently since 2003. He has steadily made progress with his business over the years and is known today as an experienced and safe driver. Tuul uses his earnings to support his family and has to pay for repairs to his car regularly. Tuul is a very hardworking person and is optimistic about the future. He says, “My dream is to one day start my own auto repair center.” He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to overhaul his car.

loans.use: To repair his car.

loans.name: Kakra

texts.en:
Kakra A. sells slippers, moving from one house to the other in and around Akotokyire. With the income she generates from the sale of slippers, Kakra is able to support her husband to pay for rent and food for the home.

Kakra’s loan will be used to buy other types of slippers to add to the types she currently sells. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a shop.

Kakra has no formal educational background. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: To buy other types of slippers

loans.name: Krishna Devi

texts.en:
Mrs. Krishna Devi M. is a resident and grocery shopkeeper in the village of Thecho, one of the developing villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in her region are engaged in farming. She opened her grocery store two years ago to improve her family's standard of living. She has one son, in grade 10, and one daughter, in grade 5. Her son helps his mother in her grocery store.

Mrs. Krishna Devi M. is requesting a loan of 25,000 NPR to buy various grocery items such as rice, maize, and snacks to expand her shop.

loans.use: to buy goods for her grocery shop

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo “San I.”  nombrado así por que son originarias del Poblado San I.. Es integrado por tres mujeres. Los representa doña Aurelia L. H., tiene 5 hijos,  Doña Lilia D. L. C. I. tiene 3 hijos, tiene junto con su esposo L. venta D. pescado, además se dedica a vender productos D. catalogo marca Avon y Jafra y  bisutera enfrente D. su casa, doña María J. T. se dedica a L. crianza D. cerdos para su matanza y venta D. carne, tiene un chiquero en L. parte D. atrás D. su domicilio, comprara alimento, vitaminas y vacunas.


Doña Aurelia se dedica a L. renta D. computadoras en un local que construyó en L. parte D. arriba D.  su casa, el crédito lo utilizara para arreglar las computadoras e  impresora. Sueña con tener su local D. renta D. computadoras con más aparatos, para atender y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Además desea que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria para tener así un mejor nivel D. vida.


Son mujeres  muy unidas y sus actividades son diferentes, es un grupo solidario y se conocen desD. hace años.  

Agradecen el apoyo que le brinda L. Fundación y KIVA por ser considerados para poder realizar sus pequeños negocios y hacer sus sueños realidad.
texts.en:
The San I. Group is aptly named because its three members are originally from the village of San I.. Doña Aurelia L. H. has five children. Doña Lilia D. L. C. I. has three children and sells fish with her husband. She also sells Avon and Jafra products by catalog as well as costume jewelry in front of her house. Doña María J. T. raises pigs and slaughters them to sell the meat. She has a pigsty behind her house. Doña María plans to buy animal feed, vitamins, and vaccines.

Doña Aurelia has a computer rental business built above her house. Her loan will be used to repair the computers and a printer. She dreams of acquiring more devices so that she can attend to more customers and proviD. better service. Doña Aurelia wants her children to finish their university degree so that they can have a better standard of living.

The women are very close. Even though they have different business activities, they are a united group and have known each other for many years. They are grateful to the Foundation and to Kiva for the support they have provided and for considering them so that they can continue their small businesses and make their dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for computer & printer repairs

loans.name: Fabiola Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Fabiola de 37 años de edad, es madre de familia de cinco hijos, se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, perfume productos Avon, para poder aportar con los gastos básicos. Su esposo trabaja como oficial de la policía Nacional.
Contenta por que pronto tendrá su casa que ha deseado tanto para dar a sus hijos un techo digno, todavía esta en la construcción falta poner el techo. Con este financiamiento quiere invertir en la compra de ropa. Zapatos, cosméticos, perfume para seguir vendiendo y poder ayudar a los gastos. Para lograr terminar su casa que le falta poco.
Sus planes es lograr aumentar de volumen en las ventas para lograr clientes nuevos, afiliarse con otras empresas para obtener productos accesibles de precios y lograr vender mas.
texts.en:
Doña Fabiola, 37, is a mother of five. She sells clothing, shoes, and Avon perfume products in order to be able to contribute to basic costs. Her husband works as a police officer for the National Police. She is happy because they will soon have their own home, which they have wanted so dearly in order to give their children a dignified roof over their heads. It is still under construction and they need to add the roof. With the requested loan, she wants to invest in the purchase of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and perfume in order to keep selling. She will also be able to help with costs and be able to finish their home, which is almost complete. She plans to expand her merchandise in order to get new clients, and to affiliate herself with other businesses in order to obtain products with better prices, and thus sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Benkadi 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Benkadi 1 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nangola, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités hivernales. 
Les spéculations sont le riz, l’arachide (avec Fatoumata D.) et le petit mil. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, Fatoumata compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 6 Hectares.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Fatoumata D. compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60.000FCFA par campagne.
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi 1 portent toutes leur confiance pour le bon déroulement de la campagne hivernale.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 1 group are married women, on average 50 years old with four children. Most live in polygamous families in Nangola, one of the villages in the Dioïla Prefecture of the Koulikouro region, which belongs to the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to undertake successfully their winter campaign activities. They speculate on rice, ground nuts (as with Fatoumata D.), and millet. This is their fifth campaign loan, and all previous loans were well reimbursed. With this new loan, Fatoumata intends to buy seedlings and fertiliser, small farming equipment and pay labor costs to cultivate six hectares (approx. 15 acres). Her crop is sold after harvest in Nangola and the adjoining area, and in the town of Dioïla, to both men and women customers. Fatoumata D. hopes to attain an average profit of 60,000 FCFA per campaign. The women from the Benkadi 1 group are all hopeful for the successful progress of this winter campaign.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: seedlings, fertiliser, small farming equipment and labor costs

loans.name: Nelly Elizabeth

texts.es:
Nelly Elizabeth tiene 29 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Jucuapa del departamento D. Usulután, Es casada tiene dos hijos D.  3 y 1 año D. edad, su esposo es policía y ella tiene un tienda D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad.
Inicialmente ella le ayudaba a la madre,  la cual la motivo a que emprendiera su propia tienda en la cual venD. artículos D. primera necesidad, atienD. el negocio D. lunes a domingo, lo cual a servido para solventar las necesidades básicas D. su familia.
Nelly solicita un préstamo para compra D. productos que actualmente no tiene y sus clientes demanda, por lo cual ella invertirá en la compra D.: Frijoles, arroz, aceite, azúcar, café , esto permitirá incrementar las ventas, mejorar su condiciones D. vida D. la familia.
Sus aspiraciones son mantener el negocio, incremento sus ingresos los cuales le permitan sacar adelante a sus hijos, a futuro le gustaría abrir otra tienda en el sector del municipio D. Jucuapa.
texts.en:
Nelly Elizabeth is 29 years old and lives in the municipality of Jucuapa in the Usulután department. She is married and has 2 children aged 1 and 3. Her husband is a policeman and she has a store where she sells products that are basic necessities. She started out initially helping her mother, who motivated her to start her own store selling basic necessities. She attends to this business every day, and it serves to cover the basic expenses of her family. Nelly requests a loan to buy products that she currently does not have and that her customers are demanding. She will invest in the purchase of: beans, rice, cooking oil, sugar, and coffee. This will allow her to increase her sales and improve the living conditions of her family. She aspires to keep her business and increase her income, which will enable her to support her children. In the future, she would like to open another store in a neighborhood in the municipality of Jucuapa.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, cooking oil, sugar and coffee

loans.name: Maria Lucrecia

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una madre esforzada para sus hijos, trabajadora desde su juventud.
Desde hace más de un año,  tiene un trabajo fijo como conserje, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba solo a la venta de cosméticos. Pero las ventas no le estaban dando el resultado ya que estaban bajas y los clientes no le estaban pagando en la fecha indicada.
Lo que se le había hecho difícil, lo que logra encontrar trabajo fijo, y poder  cubrir sus gastos alimenticios, como gastos básicos. 
A través de estos préstamos ha logrado hacer las mejoras de su casa, ya que con el préstamo anterior logro cambiar el techo. 
Y ahora hará un anexo en los cuartos, en donde comprara: doscientos bloques, dos metros de arena, piedrin, cemento, hierro para comenzar.
Y seguir beneficiándose a través de estos financiamientos.
texts.en:
Maria is a dedicated mother who makes a great effort for her children. She's been a hard worker since her childhood. For more than a year she has had steady work. She used to only sell cosmetics, but her sales were not successful, they were low, and her customers were not paying her on the dates promised. It was difficult for her to find steady work and be able to cover all of her food and basic expenses. These loans have made it possible for her to make improvements to her home and the previous one allowed her to replace her roof. Now she wants to add a room and she needs to buy 200 cinder blocks, two meters of sand, gravel, cement, and iron bars in order to begin and continue to benefit from these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio D. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. He is 53 years old. Arsenio is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Arsenio owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of vegetables with his wife working together in the local community. Arsenio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 9500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arsenio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arsenio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Arsenio is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Arsenio from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & for working capital

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Our CCT* Community Partner, Linda N., 50, is married to Rolando N., and has four children who are still studying. They live in Silang, Cavite, north of Manila. Rolando works as a chef in a local restaurant in their community.

Linda owns and manages a coin bank manufacturing business for almost ten years now, which basically serves as her family's main source of income. They make these items in their own shop, which is adjacent to their house. After ten years in this business, she has established patrons of her products who buy them on a wholesale basis. Linda earns at least Php1,000 in sales every day. 

Linda is applying for a loan of Php50,000, which she plans to use to purchase raw materials needed to continue operation of her business. She believes that additional capital will increase production at her business, that would cater to the demands of her wholesalers.

At present, Linda finds the frequent rain greatly affects delivery of orders for her clients. However, Linda still hopes and believes that God has destined her for greater things. She dreams of owning a bigger business with more customers to cater to, even in Metro Manila and beyond. Further, it is her dream that her children will be able to finish their studies in college. Linda has been a member of Center for Community Transformation a for few years now and regularly attends fellowship meetings*.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to manufacture coin banks.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana M., es la propietaria de un negocio de confección  de ropa, elaboración de productos de lencería y cerámica llamada “Confecciones Louly” ella es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 13 años, que ha solicitado un credikiva para comprar insumos y materiales para la confección articulos de lencería como telas e hilos alusivos a la temporada de amor y amistad y para prepararse desde ya para las fiestas de navidades y de año nuevo, comprando insumos apropiados para ello.
Su negocio lo heredó de su madre pero ella le ha ido dando un matiz algo diferente, porque estudió diseño de modas y su énfasis son los cubre lechos,  baja ollas, adornos de cocina y de sala en general, para darle mayor elegancia al lugar donde habitan las familias. Su principal clientela son las amas de casa  y jóvenes para los que también elabora productos acordes a su edad. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, dándose a conocer cada día más y abrir un almacén donde pueda hacer una oferta de los bellos diseños que produce con las más sofisticadas técnicas y mucho amor.
Su desafío mas importante es adquirir gradualmente la infraestructura que requiere para aumentar la calidad de sus productos y mejorar los tiempos de respuesta a sus clientes, como maquinas y equipos. Así mismo Liliana sueña con construir un buen capital para que sus hijos puedan en el futuro estudiar y tener muchas oportunidades laborales de calidad
texts.en:
Liliana M. is the owner of a clothing store. She makes also makes lingerie and ceramic crafts under the business name "Louly Creations". She is a married woman and she has two children, aged 7 and 13 years old. She requests a loan to purchase materials to make crafts, such as fabrics and threads, to get ready for the holiday, new year's, and valentine's day season. She would like to purchase other holiday merchandise. She inherited her business from her mother but she has made it her own. She studied fashion design with an specialization in household crafts, including bed spreads, pot holders, kitchen decorations and general living room items to an element of elegance to families' homes. Her clientele is mostly made up of housewives and youth, for them she also makes special age-appropriate products. Her dream is to expand her business and to make a name for herself. She wants to open a store where she will be able to showcase her beautiful designs, crafted with technical expertise and a great deal of attention. Her goal is to gradually improve the infrastructure of her business, a requirement to improve the quality of her products and improve the turn around times for orders placed by her clients. She would need sewing machines and other tools. Liliana dreams of building a good working capital so that her children will be able to enjoy quality work opportunities in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric and threads.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 48 years old. She is a widow and has four children between the ages of 14 and 25.  All of her children are enrolled in school.  She owns houses that she rents out and she also sells clothes.  She says that her clothing business is well known and clients can either come to her shop or she will deliver to them.  With the proceeds from this loan, Mary will purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.es: Clarisa, de 57 años, es una mujer sencilla y muy trabajadora que junto a su esposo saca adelante a sus dos hijos; a los que cuida y cría en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Progreso. Afirma con mucho optimismo y tranquilidad, “que los recursos son escasos pero las fuerzas no “. Pese al tiempo que le dedicó a la agricultura no se siente cansada y todas las mañanas a primera horas del día, se levanta muy contenta, pues quiere ver cuanto crecieron sus cultivos de arveja y demás hortalizas que siembra cada temporada. Lo que más le gusta a ella es poder ver sus plantaciones saludables, creciendo sin mayor dificultad. Clarisa ya tiene un sitio ganado en la capital, aquí vende su cosecha a muy buen precio y con las ganancias que obtiene lo ahorra para poder instalar una tienda de comestibles, de esa manera piensa incrementar sus ganancias y poder dedicar más tiempo a sus hijos. Es el noveno crédito con MFP y en todo este tiempo aprendió el valor del ahorro y progreso; por eso agradece a su banco comunal que hace posible que ella surja y avance. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas de arvejas, así como también abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Clarisa, 57, is an unassuming, hard working woman who, together with her husband, supports their two children.  She cares for and raises them in her own home located in the town of Progreso.

She states with much optimism and calm:  “resources might be few but strength is not.”  Despite the time she’s been farming she does not feel tired and every day rises at dawn happy to see how much her pea and other vegetables she plants each season have grown.  What she enjoys the most is seeing her crops healthy, growing problem free.  

Clarisa has secured a spot in the capital where she sells her crops at very good prices.  She is saving up her profits in order to open a foodstuffs store to increase profits while being able to spend more time with her children.

This is her 9th loan with MFP.  During this time she has learned the value of savings and progress.  For this reason she is grateful that the communal bank makes it possible for her to grow and move forward.

She will use the requested funds to buy pea seeds as well as sacks of manure to improve her crops.

loans.use: To buy pea seeds and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 58 años, es viuda y vive a lado de sus 2 hijas que son mayores y tienen su propia familia. Desde hace 18 años se dedica a la venta de leche, producto que extrae de su misma vaca que cría. Es así que todos los días se dirige al estable de un familiar, lugar donde cuida a su vaca, desde muy temprano realiza el ordeño en donde extrae la leche fresca, para luego ser vendido a clientes que son comerciantes de productos lácteos. Además de vender leche, procesa este producto para convertirla en yogurt natural y queso. De la misma manera vende mazamorras de manera ambulante, eso le genera ingresos diarios a su hogar. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, ya tiene varios años de experiencia y ahora su gran anhelo es tener más vacas. Es su crédito número 13 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero. Asegura además que le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece  a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de envases, así como semillas ya que sembrará alfalfa, que servirá como forraje para su vaca.
texts.en: Adela is 58 years old.  She is a widow and lives with her two grown-up daughters who have their own families.  For 18 years she has been selling milk for a living.  The milk comes from her own cow which she reared.  Every day she heads to a family member's stable where she looks after her cow.  Very early in the morning she milks her cow and obtains fresh milk which is then sold to her customers who are dairy product salesmen.  In addition to selling milk, she processes it into yoghurt and cheese.  She also sells 'mazamorra' (a Peruvian dessert) in an itinerant manner which provides daily income for her home.  She enjoys her work a lot, she already has several years' experience and now her great desire is to have more cows.  This is her 13th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She states that she likes being part of her community bank because all its members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive.  She also thanks all those who will help fund the loan that she is requesting as it will be very useful for her business' progress.  She will use her loan to purchase containers as well as seed because she will sow alfalfa which will be given to her cow as fodder.

loans.use: To purchase containers to keep milk fresh and to purchase alfalfa which will be used as fodder for her cow

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K.  is currently in the business of selling fish at the market  and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil, tomatoes etc to sell.  Mary is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a government staff worker. She has 3 children and her children all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil, tomatoes etc to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used shoes

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som P. cultivates a rice crop to earn a living.  Her husband (pictured, because Som P. was not available for the photograph) works as a motor taxi driver in and around Phnom Penh City.

Som P. was born in 1967.  She and her husband are blessed with two children, who are both single and in school. Som P. cultivates a rice crop to earn a living.

Unfortunately, Som P.'s husband's motorbike often breaks down during use. Som P. has decided to seek a loan of $300 from Kiva, which she will use to replace the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace a broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia D. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Lucia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk foods in the local community. She also buys and sells fruits like pomelo. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages & junk foods. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lucia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like beverages & junk foods.

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es:
Noemí Maura, es casada, tiene 54 años de edad, y tiene 3 hijos ya mayores de edad.
Actualmente es la tesorera del grupo “SARITA COLONIA”, el cual ya lleva cuatro años de formación y se encuentra integrado por 10 socias que residen en la zona de Comas.
Desde hace 2 años la Sra. Noemí se dedica a la venta de productos de necesidad en su bodega. Se inicia en este negocio vendiendo golosinas como ambulante, así es como Noemí decide poner este negocio y es así como inicia una fuente de ingresos para su hogar, permitiéndole mejorarar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos y crecer gracias a la dedicación que le brinda a su pequeño negocio.
Con su trabajo ha logrado incrementar su mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad, permitiéndole  ahorrar e invertir mucho mas. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en su negocio (compra de mercadería y panetones para esta campaña navideña).
texts.en:
Noemí Maura is married, is 54 years old, and has three adult children. 

She is the treasure of the group called “SARITA COLONIA,” which was formed four years ago and made up of 10 members who live in the Comas zone.

Noemí has been selling personal products in her shop for the past two years.  She started this business by selling snacks on foot and this lead to this business and a source of household income.  This allowed her to improve her and her children’s quality of life, thanks to the dedication she gives her small business.

Her work has allowed her to increase her inventory, allowing her to offer her customers a larger variety of items, and to save and invest much more.  She will use the money from this loan to invest into her business (merchandise and pants for this Christmas season).

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Johana Teresa

texts.es:
Johana es una mujer emprendedora que con esfuerzo y dedicación ha alcanzado ser una microempresaria teniendo un negocio de venta de carne. 

Con la ayuda de su eposo y la buena administracion que le ha dado al negocio ahora ella puede comprar variedad de carnes para venderle a los clientes mas cercanos. Trabaja desde las 08h00am vendiendo carne de todo tipo hasta las 22h00pm. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con el negocio ya que quiere invertir mas dinero para tener un capital fijo y vender mas carne en su local. En el futuro quiere comprar congeladores para tener mas oportunidad de venta.
texts.en:
Johanna is an enterprising woman who, with an effort and dedication, has become a small business woman, owning a butcher shop. 

With her husband's help and through sound business administration she has developed her store to be in the position to purchase a variety of meats to sell to her closest neighbors. She works from 8am to 10pm, selling all kinds of meats. She has great plans for her business, wanting to invest more money in order to secure a steady capital savings and to sell more meat from her store. In the future she wants to purchase freezers to increase her sales opportunities.

loans.use: To purchase meat for resale.

loans.name: Roberto Ignacio

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Granada, del Departamento de Granada, el señor Roberto Ignacio M. se dedica arduamente a la labor de Operador de Pozo desde hace  tres años en una Empresa ubicada en esta ciudad. Es acompañado y con tres hijos menores de edad.

Una de las necesidades que el señor Roberto M. atraviesa al día de hoy es que tiene que mejorar su casa de habitación y al mismo tiempo realizar cancelación de una tarjeta de crédito que tiene y debido a esta necesidad es que se acerca a las oficinas de CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para realizar dichas mejoras de vivienda y cancelar la tarjeta.

Es importante señalar que por medio de la realización de esta obra y la cancelación de la tarjeta este señor podrá seguir dándole un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Roberto Ignacio M., who lives in the City of Granada, in Grenada Department, works very hard as a Well-Drill Operator. He has done this work for the last three years for a company in the city. He has a companion and three young children. 

One of the challenges that Roberto M. faces these days is that he needs to improve the house where they live, and at the same time manage to cancel a credit card that he has. Due to these necessities, he approached the CEPRODEL offices to request a loan to complete these home improvements and to cancel the card.

It is important to note that by means of completing this work and the canceling of the card, this gentleman will be able to continue improving the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: Home improvements and canceling a Citybank credit card.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng S., 34, resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice-producing regions in Cambodia. S. is employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 44 on food and USD 5 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase an ice-cream box and a motorbike for her brother to start a business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy an icebox and a motorbike

loans.name: Kubra Muhammad Siddiq's Group

texts.en:
Kubra lives in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, called Kot Radha Kishan, which is known for its dairy industry. Her home is in the area of Judgawala and it consists of two rooms. She is married to M. S. who is a welder by profession. He is good at his work and provides good quality services to his customers.
Kubra has five sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works with his father. Three of the children are getting an education at the local school while the others remain at home. Kubra is a housewife who stays at home to carry out her household responsibilities. She makes the utmost effort to provide comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs.
Kubra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband who wants to buy another welding machine. He will also hire an assistant who will help him to provide better services to his customers and earn a good income. Kubra is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her sixth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy another welding machine

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is a 43-year-old businessman. He is married and has six children. Saidu has been selling assorted items in a shop for the past 11 years. His shop is located in the busy city market in Kenema.

Saidu established this business so that he could generate enough income to provide a livelihood for his family. He is very determined to see that this business continues to grow. Saidu opens his business by 7 a.m. and closes by 11 p.m.

Saidu has a good loan-repayment history. He needs a loan of 3,000,000 Sierra Leone leones to help him buy cartons of milk, some bags of sugar, pure water, toothpaste, etc.

He intends to use the proceeds of this loan to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of milk, some bags of sugar, pure water, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
In the province of Kompong Thom, Chhin E., 25, has been feeding piglets in the cage behind her house for selling when they are big enough.  Her husband is a recycling buyer and they can make an income of $2.50 per day. They have given birth to a child who is still enrolled in a local school.

In order to increase her income, Chhin E. would like to ask for a loan as an advance for purchasing cashews in bulk for resale. This couple intends to finish college, to expand the business, and they want to enlarge her house.

loans.use: to purchase cashews in bulk for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, soap, sugar... for his store

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCION-ANTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicitas; ella tiene 36 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de granos secos, ella vende trigo, cebada, maíz y moraya, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de granos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar granos secos al por mayor.                     
                          
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Immaculate Virgin of Conception-Anta” cooperative bank located in the Anta district of the department of Cusco.  

Her name is Felicitas; she is 36 years old, married and has 1 child.  She alternates her daily activities with a business selling dry goods such as wheat, barley, corn and dehydrated potato.  Through this business, she has been able to help her family get ahead.  She would like to expand her dry goods enterprise and requests this loan to buy products at wholesale.

She is very happy for the access to credit, and commits to making her payments.

loans.use: buy products such as wheat, barley and corn at wholesale.

loans.name: Lolina

texts.en:
Lolina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fish to sell.

Lolina has been in this business for 30 years. Lolina earns additional income from piggery and the selling of fermented shrimps.

Lolina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of  fish to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta  is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Julieta is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Julieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional grocery products to sell. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Julieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Pelicia

texts.en:
Pelicia is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Pelicia has a retail shop that sells CTF WELLNESS products like coffee. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy CTF WELLNESS products such as coffee.
Pelicia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy CTF WELLNESS products like coffee

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bibiana, la socia tiene 67 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 7 hijos todos ellos independientes, la socia  apoya aun a uno de sus hijos al menor con sus estudios superiores, la socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene un stand de compra y venta de frutas y verduras, la socia la socia vende en el mercado de Santa Ana; ella desea el crédito para poder invertir en la compra de verduras y fruta al por mayor de los proveedores y de este modo implementar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras para la venta.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "IMASUMAC II" community bank; the bank is located in the Huanchac district in the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Bibiana, who is 67 years old.  The member is married and has 7 children, all of whom are independent, though the member is helping one of the younger children with their higher education.  The member works in retail, she has a stall in the Santa Ana market for purchase and sale of fruits and vegetables.  She is looking for the loan to invest in the purchase of vegetables and fruit at wholesale from the suppliers, and in this way facilitate her business.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables for sale.

The member is grateful for the support being granted to her, and similarly agrees to comply in a disciplined manner with the payment of dues.

loans.use: to invest in buying fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
La Sra. Olga  esta casada con el Sr.Amadeo con quien tienen dos Hijos, los cuales están estudiando en el Nivel Secundario. Tienen una casa propia.
La Sra Olga se dedica a la venta D. Joyas en Plata y Oro. Por medio D. este trabajo ella ha conseguido mantenerse y solventar los gastos D. la casa, con la ayuda D. su marido. Ella comenta que es una profesión muy linda y que le encanta.
Ella se considera una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora. Todo lo que hace es para ver, algún día, a sus hijos terminando una carrera universitaria.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra D. mas joyas, para D. esa forma poder innovar con mas variedad. Quiere comprar mas cadenas, pulseras y anillos.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga is married to Sr. Amadeo and they have two children who are secondary school students. They own their own home. 
Olga sells silver and gold jewelry. She uses her earnings to support the household with help from her husband. She says that jewelry selling is a great business to be in and she really enjoys it.

Olga is considered a selfless and hardworking woman. All that she does is so that she can see, one day, her children get to university. 

She is seeking a loan to buy more jewelry so she can stay current and have a greater variety to offer her customers. She wishes to buy more chains, bracelets, and rings.

loans.use: to buy more chains, bracelets, and rings etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, age 30, runs a small business selling fish, chicken, and other meats. She has been engaged in this business for the past six years. Business is going well for her and she is confident about her future. Her main focus is to ensure that she sells all her stock every day as she has no storage.

Emma lives in Paynesville and has two children, ages four and six. They both live at home with her and attend school. Emma did not go to school herself.

Emma is requesting a loan to purchase fish, chicken, and other stock for her business and intends to use the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. In the future, she hopes to ensure that her children receive a good education and plans to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase fish, chicken, and other stock for her business

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng, 53, is a fish seller living in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. She and her husband have a fishing business. Her husband catches fish in the lake, pound and river and she takes these fish, along with fish purchased from a wholesaler, and brings them to sell at the local market. She earns $3 per day. 

They have four children who are still dependent on their income. 

Seng has requested a loan from Kiva to purchase a new motor for their fishing boat so that her husband can haul his nets more quickly and they can earn more money from their fish-catching business.

loans.use: to purchase a new motor for their fishing boat.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 27 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and her husband is employed by a construction company. They have two children ages six and eight years old, both of whom live with their parents and are presently in school.

For the past six years Fatu has been selling rice and vegetables among other things in the local market. She is requesting a loan of 17,000 LRD from BRAC to purchase more goods to sell.

She hopes to buy land and build a house on it.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Even though my parents have no capacity to send me to school, I strive just to finish my college education, Consolacion says. She worked as a secretary and got married when she was 25 years old. After marriage, Consolacion resigned her work. She and her husband are blessed with two children. Her husband is a farmer working in the Philippines.

In times of financial crisis, Consolacion goes abroad just to sustain her family needs. She worked as a domestic helper for 10 years. When she had enough earnings, she came back to the Philippines and make a decision to put up a sari-sari store business in which she sells snack foods, sugar, coffee, vinegar and cooking oil.
 
Consolacion says even though there are struggles in her life, she is still happy because she successfully sent her children to college and holds a degree. She is also happy because she sees that her children are now professionals.

Nowadays, sometimes Consolacion encounters problem because her sari-sari store is her only source of income for their daily needs. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase beans, diapers, drinks and bread to sell in their village. She hopes for the growth of the business and a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase beans, diapers, drinks and bread to sell in their village.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela nació en la ciudad de Cusco y tiene 50 años de edad. Actualmente, Adela vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas, ella tiene un negocio que consiste en la venta de golosinas en una pequeña kiosko. En esta oportunidad Adela requiere el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería como por ejemplo dulces y galletas. 

El Banco Comunal “Salud” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
