Adela was born in the city of Cuzco and is 50 years old. Currently, Adela lives and works in the city of her birth. She has a business selling sweets from a little stall. Adela needs this loan to buy more product, such as cookies and candies.

The Salud village bank meets monthly in Cuzco, Peru, a city known for its vibrant tourism economy and for the traditional Inti Raymi festival held each year on the June solstice. Nearby is Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to buy more product, such as cookies and candies.

loans.name: Elvis Edward

texts.es: El señor Elvis se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en el área urbana de nuestra ciudad trabaja como transportista  en radio taxi,  se dedica a esta actividad hace  6 años,  el señor vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo; su domicilio es familiar ubicado en la zona norte de Cochabamba,  el préstamo que solicita es para realizar mantenimiento y refacción  a  su vehículo el cual es su única fuente de ingresos; el señor indica que el crédito le ayudara de gran manera para continuar con su actividad la cual le ayuda a sustentar a su familia y también brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Elvis provides urban transportation services in our city; he works as a radio dispatched taxi driver.  He’s been in this line of work for the last six years.  He lives with his wife and young son.  His family home is located in the north part of Cochabamba.  

The loan he’s requesting is to service his vehicle which is his only source of income.  He indicates that the loan will be of great help to him to continue in his activity which helps him support his family and also to provide good customer service.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 34 years old and he is married with four children between the ages of 6 and 12 years old. Innocent makes a living by selling clothes and shoes. This is his 10th successful year in this business. Innocent's business is open from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day.

After realizing that his capital is still too low to expand meaningfully, Innocent has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more clothes and shoes to sell. With this loan, Innocent will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting and saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Digna Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Girasoles, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad, se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Digna, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual aun no tienen hijos pero espera muy pronto tener. Su marido trabaja en el Camal Municipal.

Ella para ganarse algo propio y obtener para sus gastos se dedica a la venta de  frutas y verduras,  tiene un puesto  en el mercado municipal, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 17h00. Para abastecerse de mercadería se desplaza muy temprano hasta el mercado mayorista donde consigue de todo para sus clientes. Lleva tres años en este negocio y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito es para comprar más frutas y legumbres y así tener bien surtido su puesto. Lleva seis ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades de pago.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya donde viven es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of the 'Girasoles' (Sunflowers) community bank meet in El Progreso neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a very densely populated, poor, urban area of the city which is known as 'sector de la cárcel' (the prison sector) because it is home to Portoviejo's women's prison.

Here we meet Digna.  She is 21 years old and lives with her partner.  They do not have any children yet but she hopes that they will very soon.  Her husband works in the town slaughterhouse.

In order to make her own money and cover her expenses, Digna sells fruit and vegetables.  She has a stall in the town market and works there every day from 7.00am to 5.00pm.  In order to stock up with merchandise, she goes to the wholesale market very early in the morning and gets everything she needs for her customers.  She has been in this business for three years and it is going pretty well.

Digna will use this loan to buy more fruit and vegetables so that she can have a well-stocked stall.  She has been a member of her community bank for six loan cycles and she likes it because of the credit facilities.

Digna's dream is to own her own home as she currently rents.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Jose Lenin

texts.es: José Lenin de 58 años, se dedica a brindar servicios funerarios y a la elaboración de ataúdes, él ya tiene varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo de su negocio. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de madera, pega, tela, clavos, entre otros productos. De esta manera obtendrá un buen medio ingreso para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: José Lenin, 58, owns a funeral services and coffin manufacturing business.  He has owned the business for several years and he knows what it takes to operate a successful business.  He will use this loan to buy wood, glue, fabric, nails and other supplies that he needs to support the business.  The investment will provide him a way to increase his income.

loans.use: to fund his funeral services and coffin manufacturing business.

loans.name: Delfin

texts.en: Delfin is a 42-year-old married man with two children living in a permanent house in Minallo in the province of Isabela. He has been growing and selling rice since 1991. When he started, he was producing 50 sacks of rice, but now he produces 150 sacks. He faces the challenge of high labor costs. His dream is to diversify his business by growing more crops, and to educate his children. Delfin is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seed for his farm.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has been in the cattle sales business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 17 years. He is 43 years old and married to Mary, and they have three school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more buy cows so as to boost his business.

In the future, Francis hopes to invest more in his business and sell cattle to other parts of the country, thereby getting more income to pay school fees for his children as well as improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: To buy more cows for sale.

loans.name: Cornelio Cipriano

texts.es:
Cornelio Sipriano tiene 48 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 20, 19,16 y 7 años en el cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Cornelio se dedica al agricultura a la siembra de arroz, maíz hace 22 años, Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Pueblo viejo.

Solicita el crédito para seguir trabajando en la siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar sin ningún tipo de problema los insumos. El sueño es poder hacer un mejoramiento en la vivienda, No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problemas. En los tiempos libres le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Cornelio Cipriano is 48 years old, in a common law relationship and has four children.  He lives with his wife and children who are 20, 19, 16 and 7 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of the “Las Palmas” communal bank are located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.  Cornelio is a farmer who has been growing rice and corn for 22 years.  His purchases and his sales take place in Pueblo Viejo.

He is asking for the loan to continue working his corn and rice crops.  With help from the loan he will be able to buy supplies problem-free.  His dream is to be able to do some home improvements.  He has had no type of problem and in his free time he enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has been making candles for two years. She is 45 years old, married with eight children.

Helen sells her candles to store owners in her town. She is able to help her husband buy their basic needs such as food and clothes. Helen works hard to improve her income and be able to send all her children to school.

Helen has requested this loan to purchase wax, cans, wicks and other materials for making candles.

loans.use: to purchase wax, cans, wicks and other materials for making candles

loans.name: Guardiano

texts.en:
Guardiano is 55 years old. He manages his computer shop in the market. He has been in this business for two years and earns PHP 15,000 a month. He wants to increase his usual income in order to expand his business. For him to achieve his dream, he is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 as additional capital, which he will use to buy computer parts and to expand his business.

Guardiano is looking forward to producing more income through his loan. He knows that he will achieve a good profit because he works tirelessly in his business.

loans.use: to buy computer parts and expand his business.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is from Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children. 

Merlinda owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month from it. 

In 2010, Merlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of two children, and she owns a butchery and rental houses in Kinoo. Her husband supports her with additional income from his teaching job. Beth has been in the business for five years now and gets a monthly income of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

This will be Beth’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for her butchery. With the profit that she earns, she will pay school fees. In the future, she wants to be able to build two store buildings by mid-year.

loans.use: To buy meat for resale.

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es: Don  Alvaro tiene 37 años de edad, es casado su esposa es ama de casa tienen dos hijos uno cursa la escuela primaria y otro la secundaria, siendo el único que trabaja como ayudante de albañil le es muy difícil ya que cubre con todos los gastos del  hogar. Poco a poco ha ido haciéndole mejoras a su vivienda con solicitudes de créditos hasta llegar a hacer su casa de concreto, este es su tercer préstamo con Afodenic que lleva como objetivo la construcción de un anexo que será un cuarto para sus hijos y para lograr levantar la obra necesita comprar cemento, hierro, perlines, bloques, piedrín y pagar la mano de obra. Esto le ayudara para continuar acondicionando su hogar y lograr darle a su familia un lugar seguro y las condiciones necesarias para vivir.
texts.en:
Alvaro is thirty-seven years old and is married.  His wife is a homemaker and they have two children; one is in elementary school, and the other is in secondary school.  He is the only one who works; he is a bricklayer's helper.  It is very difficult to cover all of the home expenses.

Little by little, he has been making improvements to his home with loan requests so that he can make his house concrete.  This is his third loan with Afodenic.  His objective is to construct a room for his children; to do this work, he needs to buy cement, iron bars, purlins, blocks, building rocks, and to pay the workers.  

This will help him to continue adapting his home and he will be able to give his family a safe place, and the necessary conditions, in which to live.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron bars, purlins, blocks, building rocks, and to pay the workers to construct a room.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Miwononvi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MIWONONVI est composé de trois personnes. La représentante du groupe, nommée Damienne Zinhoué (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 36 ans a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire. Damienne Zinhoué est mariée à un électricien-Auto du nom de Côme. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Damienne Zinhoué vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison que Damienne Zinhoué vend des céréales depuis quinze ans environs. Damienne Zinhoué s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Damienne Zinhoué ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIWONONVI sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du riz, haricots et de l'huile de palme.

loans.name: Grupo Guineales Sector Centro Group

texts.es:
(La que se ubica en medio de las tres de blusa morada) Para una mujer con grandes inspiraciones en la vida no hay nada imposible, por esa razón trabaja día con día para darle a su familia lo mejor, ella es Manuela la representante del grupo Guineales Sector Centro, ella trabaja vendiendo ropa típica en su comunidad desde hace 5 años, gracias a esta labor a su familia ha sacado adelante. Manuela tiene una familia de un hijo que aún no está estudiando. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de mejorar su negocio de ropa típica comprando productos como: fajas, güipiles y cortes, porque en estas fechas la demanda de ropa incrementa, por lo que ella busca satisfacer mejor a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra y venta de ropa típica como: fajas, güipiles y cortes.

loans.name: Monica Veronica

texts.en:
Monica is mother of a little one of 3 years of age, is married and lives in the city of Monterrey in the State of Neuvo Leon. She has always been an enterprising woman, which is why when her husband faced problems, she started to save some of their income to invest and start selling shoes by catalogue. This is how she was able to help him and how she was able to provide a better quality of life for their son. It has already been one year since she started her business and the extra income has been of great help.

Monica now requires a loan in the amount of $200, which she will use to fill the orders she has received and has not been able to honor due to her lack of liquid capital. You can help her continue supporting her family. The decision is yours, do not wait. She and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Mónica es madre de un pequeñito de 3 años, es casada y vive en la comunidad de Monterrey, en el Estado de Nuevo León. Ella siempre a sido una persona muy emprendedora, es por ello que al ver que su esposo comenzaba a tener problemas con su salario, ella comenzó a designar parte del gasto que él le daba para invertirlo en la ventad e zapatos por catálogo, y de esta manera ayudarlo y poder brindar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida. Ya es un año de que inició con este proyecto y los ingresos extras que recibe gracias a este les ha sido de mucha ayuda.

Ahora Mónica requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 DLLS, mismos que utilizará para poder surtir unos pedidos que tiene pendientes, por faltad e capital en este momento Tú puedes ayudarla a continuar ayudando a su familia, la decisión esta en tus manos, no lo dudes más, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo is a rice farmer from Baba, Ecuador, a sector known for its rice cultivation. He has only had his farm for several years, but it is serving well to feed his wife and his infant child. He wants to invest the loan received in improving his crop output. He hopes to buy more seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. His long term goal is to improve his home for his growing family.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana-producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large multinational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soybeans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Baba

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain, there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soybeans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
For the past 7 years, Reyna has focused on selling plastic products. She began selling after her husband retired because his pension didn’t cover all the bills. She started her own business so that she could take care of the family’s finances. She has 8 children, seven of which are married and only the youngest daughter lives with them. At the beginning, she only had a small amount of inventory, but with time she accumulated enough inventory that now she has a designated area in her home where she keeps all of her plastic products.

In order to increase sales and to better serve her clients, she would like to increase her inventory by offering a different variety of plastic products. In order to do so, Reyna is requesting a loan in the amount of $650 USD. She will repay the loan within 6-12 months. You can help improve the living conditions of her family. Please don’t hesitate! Reyna thanks you for your support!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace siete años Reyna se dedica a la venta de productos de plástico, inició cuando jubilaron a su esposo ya que la pensión que recibe es muy baja, y para poder cubrir todos los gastos comenzó su propio negocio, ella tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales 7 están casados y sólo la más pequeña vive con ellos. Al inicio tenia muy poca mercancía, pero poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio y ahora ha acondicionado una parte de su vivienda para continuar con sus ventas.

Para incrementar la variedad de productos Reyna solicita un préstamo de $650 dólares, mismos que devolverá en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses, de esta manera podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y podrá incrementar sus ventas. Tú puedes ayudar a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, no lo pienses más, Reyna agradece mucho tu apoyo,

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Lorena Guadalupe

texts.es:
Two years ago Lorena started making and selling foods. She started this business in order to feed her 2 young kids and pay for their education. She is divorced and receives a very low amount of money from her ex-husband, which made it difficult to provide for her kids. She started offering few foods, but thanks to a growing demand for her food, she was able to increase the quantity of her products, and now offers sauces too.

In order for her business to continue to grow, Lorena is now asking for a loan of $200 which she will use to buy ingredients. With this she will also increase the amount of food she makes and will be able to cover her clients’ demands. She promises to repay this amount over a period of 3 months. Lorena and her children thank you for any sort of help you can offer them, they are counting on you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace dos años Lorena se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas, este negocio lo inició para poder darle sustento y educación a sus dos pequeños hijos, ella es divorciada y recibe una pensión muy baja de su ex esposo lo que le dificultaba solventar todas las necesidades de sus hijos. Empezó ofreciendo poca variedad de comidas, pero gracias a la creciente demanda que logró conseguir fue incrementando la cantidad de alimentos que elabora y ahora también ofrece empalmes y salsas.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio, ahora Lorena está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos, con lo que incrementará su producción y logrará cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Lorena y sus hijos agradecen mucho cualquier tipo de apoyo que puedas brindarles, ellos cuentan contigo.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Antonieta Del Carmen

texts.en: Antonieta, 20, runs a pica pollo, a fried chicken store with her father’s help, which they bought six months ago and began the operations a month later.  In any typical pica pollo, they sell parts fried chicken, tostones (fried plantains), fried potatoes and so on.   The food store opens from 12 pm to 12 am.  The environment is very pleasant since people can hear good music while they eat. Antonieta wants to renovate the space to make it more convenient and comfortable for customers.  She also wants to hire two persons in addition to the cook.  Lastly, she plans to have flyers printed to promote special offers and to attract more customers. She hopes to get loan requested so she can start executing her plan to expanding her new business.

loans.use: To renovate her foodstore, hire 2 persons, and have  promotional flyers printed.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Soeun and her husband Mr. Chan Mov got married in 1976 and have seven children: three daughters and four sons. She learned to weave silk from her mother in 1971 and started her own silk production business in the same year. Her husband builds wooden houses and also grows rice and food crops in the village. One of her sons weaves silk and one of her daughters is studying, while the other five children are married.

Mrs S. has borrowed money from MAXIMA five times prior to this. She is now requesting a $200 loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread,  paying fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Nanci

texts.es:
Nancy belongs to the Communal Bank El Gran Pajaten, she lives in San Martín region, Mariscal Cáceres province, Juanjui district, and her business is located at Jr. Leticia donde funciona el mercado Nº 1 where she sells eggs.

Thanks to the support of her husband and children she has been able to grow her business. Previously she was a street vendor, and seeing the great demand in the selling of eggs, she decided to expand her business and sell them wholesale, and today she delivers her eggs to homes.

With the 2000.00 Soles loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy eggs in crates and by the hundred as well as packages of toilet paper.

Nancy is very active, she likes to work, she is 26 years old and has two children, she lives with her husband who helps her and gives her encouraging words to continue to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nancy pertenece al banco comunal El Gran Pajaten, vive en la región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui y su negocio está ubicado en Jr. Leticia donde funciona el mercado Nº 1 y se dedica a la venta de huevos de granja.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijos logró incrementar su negocio. Anteriormente la venta era ambulatoria y viendo la gran demanda en la venta de huevos decidió incrementar su negocio y venderlos al por mayor con lo cual hoy en día reparte sus huevos a domicilio.

Con el préstamo de S/.2,000.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará huevos en jabas y en cientos, así como papel higiénico en paquetes.

La señora Nancy es muy activa, le gusta el trabajo, tiene 26 años y dos hijos, vive con su esposo, el cual le ayuda y le da palabras alentadoras para seguir luchando.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (eggs and toilet paper)

loans.name: Maria Jesús

texts.es:
Perishable products are all those which, in one way or another, if not used within a fixed time period, will go completely bad - up to the point where they are totally unusable. Sra. Maria de Jesús R. has specialised for the last five years in the sale of perishable goods (fruit and vegetables) in la Estación market in the town of León. One challenge for her is to sell her products quickly once she acquires them, in order to avoid them rotting and creating expense and waste for her business.

With the hope of expanding her business little by little, she asks for loans from Ceprodel who extend a friendly hand and help her. She has already managed to develop her business and obtain a slightly higher income.

The continuing work of Sra. Gonzáles provides for the upkeep of her four school-age children: that this culminates in a university course is her dearest wish, so that they are able to improve their quality of life. Her credit record is 20 credits.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Los productos perecederos son todos aquellos que de alguna u otra manera, si no se les utiliza en un determinado tiempo estos tienden a malearse por completo hasta quedar inservibles. La Sra. Maria de Jesús R. se dedica a la actividad de venta de perecederos (verduras y frutas) desde hace 5 años en el mercado la Estación de la ciudad de León. Un reto para ella es vender sus productos una vez que los adquiere, de no ser así estos se dañan y se pierden generándole gasto en su negocio.

Con la esperanza de ir progresando poco a poco en su negocio solicita préstamos a CEPRODEL quien le extiende su mano amiga y le ayuda. Hoy en día ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio obteniendo un poco mas de ingresos.

El trabajo continuo de la Sra. Gonzáles le permite el sustento de sus cuatro hijos en edad escolar y el que coronen una carrera universitaria es su mayor sueño para que logren mejorar su nivel de vida. Su record crediticio es de 20 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase of perishable goods

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea Y. , 35, and her husband, Min Saray, have been married since 1994. They have four children; two sons and two daughters. Three of their children are studying in the local school and the youngest child stays at home. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Y. is in the business of growing jasmine and selling fruits and flowers at a Phnom Penh market. Her husband has worked in the construction business since 2001. Both husband and wife hope that their businesses will continue to support the family and allow their children to continue their schooling.

Mrs. Y. is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase construction materials for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mrs. So C., age 45, is a widow with two children. She sells porridge in her village and makes around $2 a day of profit. One of her daughters is a garment worker with a salary $70 a month and her son works digging a well in the village.

Mrs. So C. wants to use this loan to renovate her house.

loans.use: She will use this loan to renovate her house.

loans.name: Gulbodin

texts.en: Gulbodin lives in district 3 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is the father of 6 children. He is uneducated and he does agricultural work. His work is the only source of income for his family. He wants to expand his business by taking out an individual loan to complete his agriculture needs so as to take the best advantage of his land so that he can help all his children and give them a better education.

loans.use: To complete his agriculture needs

loans.name: Ysabel Margarita

texts.en:
Ysabel Margarita L. E. has a general store and raises animals to sell in the town of Mache, high in the sierras (mountain range) of the La Libertad region of Peru. Ysabel raises cattle and pigs and sells them in Trujillo, the capital of the region. She has 12 years of experience and has many loyal customers.

Ysabel is 43 years old and has 4 children. She enjoys her business and being able to take care of her family. She works long hours so her children can have the opportunity to study and become professionals.

A member of the Mujeres de Mache community bank, Ysabel is requesting a loan of s/1500 ($550) that she will repay over 4 months. She’ll use the loan to buy a few more pigs.

loans.use: To buy a few more pigs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary K. is a widow. She is a forty two year old mother of three children who are currently in school. Mary owns and operates a grocery and cosmetics shop in the local market. She believes she can make her business grow bigger and brighter with loan support, and wants to use the loan to buy more grocery stocks like rice, canned food, bottled water, candies, biscuits and assorted cosmetics to increase her stock of goods. She belongs to the community group called “Asempa kanea” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan. Mary’s photograph was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more grocery stocks like rice, canned food, bottled water, candies, biscuits and assorted cosmetics.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Mariam M.. She is married and has two children aged 7 and 11. In 2002 Mariam established her small shop. Working seven days a week, and thirteen to sixteen hours a day, she earns about US $30 every month from this business. Mariam requires a loan in order to buy more cooking oil, sugar, soaps, salt, and other utensils. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, sugar, soaps, salt, and other utensils.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru:
Safargul K. lives in Jalollidini Rumi. She is 47 years old. She is a single mother of 10 children. Her husband died 14 years ago. Since that time, she has worked in business. She opened a small bakery where she bakes flat bread and then sells it at the market. She plans to take out a loan to buy flour and other necessary ingredients for her business. This business is the sole source of income for her family. Therefore, she wants to expand it. She can pay off the loan in 3 months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонова Сафаргуль проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 47 лет. Осталась одна с 10 детьми на руках. Муж умер 14 лет назад. С того момента она и начала делать бизнес. Открыла небольшую пекарню , где выпекает лепешки , а затем реализует на базаре. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы обеспечить дело мукой и другими необходимыми ингридиентами. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи , поэтому она хочет развивать его еще шире. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 3 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying flour

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mr. Seng S., 45, and his wife, Mrs. Borin Pov, 47, who live along National Road Number Six about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1983 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. Two of their children work in a plywood factory and the youngest one studies in a local school.

Mr. Seng and his wife have been farming for over ten years. They grow many types of vegetables in the farm near their house and sell them to the middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Seng is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to purchase seed, fertilizer, and pesticides for growing vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase seed, pesticides and fertilizer for growing vegetables

loans.name: Daniela Del Socorro

texts.es: Desde pequeña aprendió  costura, una vecina le enseñó, luego se convirtió en operaria de una microempresa de costura y con la ayuda de su mamá compró su primera máquina y empezó su propio negocio en su casa. En la actualidad tiene 2 maquinas de coser y trabaja con su hermana mayor; con su mamá y hermana comercializa el producto que ofertan en los mercados de Masaya y Rivas, con los créditos de adim ha logrado comprar  más materia prima, ya que la demanda es grande. Ella vive con su mama y sueña con tener un taller más grande y abrir otros mercados en otras ciudades
texts.en:
When she was a child, Daniela learned how to sew from a neighbor. She then started working for a small sewing business, but after her mother helped her purchase her first sewing machine, she opened up her own business in her home. She currently owns 2 sewing machines and works with her elder sister. She and her mother and sister sell the finished product at the markets in Masaya and Rivas. With the loans she received from ADIM, she has been able to purchase more supplies because demand is high. She lives with her mother and dreams of having a bigger sewing workshop and opening other markets in different cities.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Borann

texts.en:
Mrs. Borann P., 47, is a widow with three children; two sons and one daughter. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home and another son assists his mother in her grocery business. 
 
Borann has been a grocer since 1986. She bought grocery items from market to resell from her home. She is requesting a loan of $500 purchase more grocery items to resell and for her stock.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Azamjon

texts.en: B. Azamjon has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008. He is applying for a loan with the intention of improving his livestock business. Mr. B. Azamjon raises his livestock himself and sells livestock for profit. With the money he earns, he has purchased more livestock in the neighboring Kyrgyzstan. He dreams of having a larger flock so he wants to build a big cowshed. Mr. B. Azamjon thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: to build a cowshed to house livestock

loans.name: Rithy Moeung's Group

texts.en:
This group which consists of four people is located in Sontouch village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Rithy M. is the group leader. She is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and then re-sell later at a better price. This business is going well, so she wants to expand it and has asked for a loan to buy 1,000 kilograms of rice to keep in stock. Her husband, Mr. Chhoem Sarun, is a policeman who makes a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Rithy M. is 41 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are working as constructors while the others are attending the local school.

Mrs. Rithy M. will share this loan with the members of her group.

loans.use: To buy 1,000 kilograms of rice to keep in stock.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna D. a 22 ans, est fiancée, et vit chez ses parents  dans le quartier Darsalam I de la préfecture de koutiala(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
Très tôt elle abandonna les études pour se consacrer aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat –vente des produits de beauté et diverses autres marchandises. Elle a appris le commerce auprès de sa  maman dépuis son jeune âge. Actuellement elle évolue à son propre compte y’a de cela 2 ans.  Elle est trés bien connue dans le secteur de la cosmétique.  Pour augmenter la taille de son activité et diversifier ses activités, elle décida d’intégrer l‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il ya deux mois. Elle est à son 1er prêt en individuel.
Maimouna compte acheter, un important  stock des produits de beauté avec ce prêt.. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des commerçants grossistes de Koutiala et souvent à Bamako(capitale du Mali). Elle vend sur son étale sis au centre du marché de Koko dans la ville de koutiala à une clientèle  constituée essentiellement de femmes , au comptant et à crédit.
 Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt et préparer son mariage.
Dans ses perspectives, elle envisage d’agrandir son activité jusqu’à  ouvrir une boutique au marché de koko.
texts.en:
Maimouna D. is 22 years old, engaged to be married, and lives in the home of her parents in the Darsalam I district of Koutiala prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Very early on, she abandoned school to devote herself to income-generating work, notably buying and selling beauty products and various other goods. She learned commerce from her mom when she was young. And now, making it on her own for two years, she is very well known in the cosmetics sector. To expand her work and diversify her business, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two months ago. She is on her first individual loan and plans to buy a sizable stock of beauty products with it. She gets her supplies from wholesale merchants of Koutiala and often in Bamako (capital of Mali). From her display at the Koko marketplace in the city of Koutiala, she makes her sales to customers composed essentially of women, cash or credit accepted. Maimouna intends to realize a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that she envisions using to repay the loan interest and to prepare for her marriage. With these prospects, she envisions expanding enough to open a shop at the Koko marketplace.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products for resale

loans.name: Choun

texts.en: Choun S., 36, lives with her husband and daughter in the Kampong Cham province. She works in a grocery store, earning around $7 per day, while her husband has a business selling rubber and earns approximately $5 a day. Mrs. Choun would like to use this loan to purchase more grocery items to meet her clients’ demands.

loans.use: groceries to stock store

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. María Teresa, vive en la zona de Villa Victoria, conjuntamente a su hermana la Sra. María Isabel, quien tambien es cliente de Kiva y de Emprender, aunque ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades viven en el mismo domicilio junto a su señora madre ya que su padre falleció hace algunos años.
La Sra. Maria Teresa, se dedica a la mecánica dental, trabajo que realiza arduamente en un pequeño taller ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ha demostrado ser una cliente muy responsable en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa lives in Villa Victoria with her sister Maria Isabel who is also a client of Emprender and Kiva. Although they dedicate themselves to different careers, they live in the same house with their mother (their father passed away a few years ago). Maria Teresa dedicates herself to providing dental care, a service that she runs out of a small shop within her house. She has demonstrated herself to be a very responsible worker.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en:
G. Iskandar has worked for many years in the difficult business of raising cattle. He is an exemplary husband in that he always tries his hardest to provide food for his wife and the three children in their home. After purchasing his cattle, Iskandar provides them with all the right conditions for their growth: taking care of their food and protection and making sure they don’t get lost. Once they’re fully mature, Iskandar sells them in his area and also provides their milk for sale. Currently he needs to purchase cattle to raise and for this reason is turning to IMON International to obtain a loan of $600. Iskandar thanks Kiva for the support that Kiva provides to small entrepreneurs.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing young cattle

loans.name: Asunción Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Asunción del Pilar A. D. A. tiene 48 años, vive en el distrito D. Salaverry, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do D. secundaria, abandono los estudios debido a que sus padres no tenían los medios económicos para seguir apoyándola. Tiene 03 hijos D. los cuales  01 aun depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Asunción se dedica a la costura y tiene una pequeña bodega, iniciò su negocio  con la venta D. kerosene (combustible)y verduras que abandonò para dedicarse al cuidado D. su pequeña hija, luego se dedicò a la costura. Con el tiempo a iniciado la venta D. abarrotes y D. productos D. belleza. También se dedico a la venta D. calzado y queso por temporadas, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Jerid Camino al Éxito II”, lo invirtió en la compra D. calzado   
Con el crédito D. 1200 soles, que será cancelado en  6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. insumos para la elaboración D. alimentos para aumentar el capital D. trabajo.
Asunción sueña con tener una bodega granD. y comprarse un carro
Ella pertenece al club D. madres D. su sector
texts.en:
Mrs. Asunción del Pilar A. D. A. is 48 years old, lives in the district of Salaverry, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her second year of high school, but had to leave school because her parents did not have the economic means to continue supporting her. She has three children, one of whom is still financially dependent on her.

Asunción is a seamstress and has a small store. She began her business with the sale of kerosene (combustible) and vegetables, which she left to care for her small daughter; later she began her work as a seamstress. With time she has begun to sell groceries and beauty products. She also sells footwear and seasonal cheeses. She conducts her business from her home.

With the loan of 1200 soles, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy consumable products for food production in order to increase her working capital. Asunción dreams of having a big store and of buying herself a car. She belongs to the club of mothers in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Breanne Kochert, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of consumable products for the preparation of foods

loans.name: Fazala Group

texts.en:
Fazala is the group leader of Fazala group. There are four members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for her business.

Fazala wants to take a loan for her embroidery business. Leeda wants to take a loan for her quilt making business. Lateafa wants to take a loan for her husband, who is a taxi driver. Nulofer wants to take a loan for her fruit and vegetable shop. They are all very thankful to Kiva lenders, who can support all worlds.

loans.use: for purchasing necessary things for their businesses

loans.name: Lorivic

texts.en:
Lorivic A. is from the village of Taboc Sur, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is 24 years old and married. To make a living, Lorivic owns and operates a retail business called a "sari-sari," or general store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Lorivic has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately $150 USD a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lorivic joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorivic is requesting a new loan of $100 USD which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her "sari-sari." This loan will be the first loan taken out by Lorivic from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business and to support her family's financial needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Chon

texts.en:
Chon C. is 25 years old, single and a resident of Siem Reap Province, where he earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind his house. He raises ducks to produce eggs and sells the eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at his house.
On the other hand, he has also cultivated a rice crop on his plot of land in the village. He currently lives with his older mother and his three siblings. Chon C. requested a loan to use in both goals, to grow a rice crop during this rainy season and to buy additional small ducks to breed.

loans.use: To buy additional small ducks to breed and to grow rice

loans.name: Fahriniso

texts.ru: Фахринисо - 47 года. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Занимается продажей женской одежды на рынке "Фаровон" города Гафурова. Она привозит товар из города Алма-аты Республики Казахстан. Иногда ездит в город Бишкек. И два раза в месяц ездит в город Истаравшан. Фахринисо уже один год кредитуется в нашей организации. За этот период она показала себя как опытный бизнесмен и своевременно погашает свой займ. Фахринисо просит займ для закупки летней партии женской одежды.
texts.en:
Fahriniso is 47 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells women’s clothing at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. She brings her merchandise from the city of Alma-Ata in the Kazakhstan Republic. Sometimes, she travels to the city of Bishkek. And twice per month, she travels to the city of Istaravshan. Fahriniso has been our client for one year. During this time, she has shown to be an experienced entrepreneur, who timely repaid her loans. Fahriniso is requesting this loan to buy a stock of women’s summer clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's summer clothing

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Кадырова более 6 лет получает кредиты в нашей организации. Ее магазин автомобильных запасных частей находится рядом с домом. В бизнесе ей помогает сын, поскольку Рано работает бухгалтером дома быта «Навбахор». Клиентов ее магазина привлекает широкий выбор товаров и доступные цены. Получив следующий займ, Рано хочет расширить ассортимент колесных дисков для автомобилей.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Rano K. has been taking out loans at our organization for more than six years. Her spare auto parts store is located near her house. Her son helps her with the business because Rano works as an accountant at a home depot Navbahor. A wide variety is what attracts her customers to the store and also affordable prices. After receiving her next loan Rano wants to expand the assortment of wheel rims for cars.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheel rims for cars

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Señora Mary is seen here with two clients who are enjoying her delicious regional dishes. Mary runs a business where she sells cooked foods in front of her home in the evenings. She lives in an area called "Luz y Paz" (Light and Peace) in the city of Pucallpa.  

Mary is 36 years old and married with three children. Her children inspire her to keep working hard at her business.  Her husband works as a laborer at Pucallpa's port. (Pucallpa is located on the Ucayali, a wide brown river that flows past the city and eventually joins the Amazon to the north).  

Mary has worked with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for more than a year and belongs to a communal bank known as Las Romanticas. She used her very first loan of about $100 to invest in her business selling foods typical of the region. She plans to invest this new loan in the same manner. Mary is very pleased to be working with Manuela Ramos, as the organization not only provides loans, but also teaches borrowers strategies to grow and improve their businesses.  

Mary's goal is to improve the interior of her home so that she can make part of it into a restaurant. In this way, she will be able to serve her customers in a cleaner and more pleasant environment.

loans.use: To buy food and supplies for a catering/restaurant business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a member of the Itiji West borrower group in Itiji,Mbeya,she is 36 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 15 and 18 years.

Joyce started her own cafe  business selling  food 1 year ago,she works 8 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 10,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Joyce first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 100,000 In order to buy more commodities like sugar,salts for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from  the use of this loan Itiji hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,sugar,cooking oil,salts

loans.name: Djikiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djikiya est constitué de 6 femmes mariées (trois sont polygames deux monogames et une célibataire)   ayant en moyenne  32 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Médine un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dont le but  est de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de  pagnes wax, de céréales  et de boissons.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  25 pièces de pagnes wax, 15 sacs de 100 kg de céréales et  30 casiers de boissons. Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. 
Les marchandises sont vendues aux marchés, de façon ambulante dans les quartiers, dans la famille ou sur commande, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19.000 FCFA dont une partie sera investie dans les activités et l’autre partie en épargne.
Certaines femmes du groupe Djikiya ambitionnent agrandir et diversifier leurs activités et participer à l’épanouissement de leur famille.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: Jenielyn

texts.en: Jenielyn N. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old, is married, and has one school-aged child. Jenielyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling used clothing known as ukay-ukay in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Jenielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira B., 37 years old, started her general store six year ago. She lives with her three children and her husband, Armando, in a populous village in Tala, Caloocan City.

Elvira saves her profits to build up funds for the renovation of their house. Part of her earnings also goes to her children’s education. She is now making P 6,500 in net income per month.

She considers being a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative a blessing for her business and her family. Elvira is now in need of a new loan in the amount of P10,000 as additional capital for her general store. She will purchase grocery items and soft drinks.

Elvira wishes to help her children continue their education until college.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and soft drinks for her store

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en: Omolara is 40 years old. She is married with a child. She sells drinks and stationery at various retail prices to her customers. She loves this business because it is highly competitive; she hopes to meet the requirement of her customers. She hopes for a loan of N 100,000, with which she will purchase more drinks and stationary. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing more drinks and stationary

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Meas N., 62 years old, is a snack food seller. She operates her business in front of her home. Besides selling food, she and her husband always cultivate a rice crop when the farming season approaches. Meas N. is a good mother blessed with eight kids. Six of the children are married and the other two are still young. Meas N. is applying for a loan to buy more essential ingredients to continue cooking food for sale.

loans.use: To buy more essential ingredients to continue cooking food for sale

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura G. was born in 1959 in Koti village, Ijevan area. She is a widow and has four daughters. Two of them are married and live separately from Laura. Laura was a cigarette maker in the state farm for about 18 years. Since 1990, she is engaged in cattle breeding and land cultivation. Thanks to her income Laura provides for her family needs, organized her two daughters’ weddings and paid for their educations.

Laura needs a loan of 500,000 AMD to buy pigs and fodder for her farm animals. She plans to spend her increased income on her younger daughters’ educations and to provide a dowry for them.

loans.use: To buy pigs and fodder.

loans.name: Thelesphore

texts.en:
Thelesphore is a 25-year-old single businessman. He lives in Musanze, a region of Ruhengeri, in the Northern Province of Rwanda, which is approximately two hours from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Thelesphore has been successful in his business of selling dishes and kitchenware for the past seven years. He began his career as an entrepreneur early in life. He employs three people from his community and together they work from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every weekday. 

Thelesphore is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. He plans to use these funds to purchase more dishes and kitchenware in order to meet the growing demand from his customers. With this expansion, he will satisfy the prevailing market and in the process, increase his sales and attract more customers.

If his plans work out, Thelesphore hopes to increase his revenue and reinvest any profits in his business in order to create a strong financial base for his growing enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase more dishes and kitchenware

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Maria tiene 60 años, es viuda pues su esposo falleció hace 8 años y tiene 8 hijos que ya no dependen D. ella pero vive con sus dos hijos Rosmar y Nataniel.           

La socia alquila habitaciones D. su domicilio que dan hacia la calle y ahora desea alquilar las habitaciones internas D. la casa. Ya son dos años que alquila habitaciones D. su domicilio y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una mujer emprendedora que requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimientos D. cuatro a cinco habitaciones D. su domicilio que están en mal estado, la socia va contratar un albañil para hacer mejorar las paredes y los pisos D. los cuartos por lo cual se necesitara material D. construcción como yeso y cemento.    

La socia es natural D. la ciudad D. Urcos D. la provincia D. Quispicanchis del departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qori Orcco” D. la Asociación Arariwa.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old. She has been a widow for eight years, and has eight children. Her children are no longer dependent on her, but she lives with two of them, Rosmar and Nataniel.

Maria rents out rooms in her house that face the street, and now she wants to also rent the insiD. rooms. She has been renting rooms for two years and it is going well, thanks to the determination she puts into her work. She is an enterprising woman and needs this loan to do maintenance on four or five rooms that are in bad condition. She will contract a mason to improve the walls and floors and will need construction materials like plaster and cement.

Maria is a native of the city of Urcos in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco. She belongs to the “Qori Orcco” communal bank of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity and promises to make her payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hire a mason to improve the walls and floors

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
El señor Raúl H. es padre de familia y tiene tres hijos adolescentes que actual mente están estudiando.
Con unos ahorros que tenía empezó la construcción de un cuarto mas para la vivienda, pero le esta haciendo falta colocar el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera. 
El está solicitando el préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarlo con sus ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo en una fábrica en  el departamento de producción. 
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Raúl H. is the head of a household and he has 3 adolescent children who are currently in school. With some savings he began building an additional room onto his home, but he still needs to add the roof. He wants to build the roof from a concrete slab, so that it will be more secure and durable. He is requesting a loan for this construction, and he plans to pay if off with the income that he earns working in the production department of a factory. He wants his children to have their own room so that they can live better.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a concrete roof

loans.name: Vreneli

texts.en:
Vreneli S. is from the village of Anakan, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Vreneli is married and has 4 school-aged children. Vreneli owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Vreneli has been involved in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Vreneli joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vreneli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Vreneli is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Vreneli from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zoila Estela

texts.es: Zoila estela A. D. M. D. 60 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive únicamente junto a su esposo quien trabaja como peluquero. Zoila posee una venta D. sopa muy típica D. este país llamada “sopa D. pata”, la cual esta hecha a base D. piernas D. res y verduras, esta sopa es muy popular, y solicitada por las personas. Zoila elabora y comercializa esta sopa, en el mercado central D. San Salvador, uno D. los mercados más grandes D. la capital, en donD. exixte una gran competencia entre las diferentes ventas D. comida. DesD. hace 16 años que Zoila se dedica a este tipo D. trabajo, logrando obtener gran fama por darle un toque muy especial a su producto, en su lugar D. trabajo es muy conocida y respetada por ser una señora muy trabajadora y amable, tanto con sus clientes como con las personas que le ayudan en el negocio. Zoila solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración D. esta exquisita sopa, ya que es gracias a este negocio como ella ha logrado seguir adelante junto a su esposo, trabajando mucho por poder tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Zoila Estela A. D. M., 60, lives in Ilopango, San Salvador department. She lives with her husband, who is a barber. She sells a kind of soup that is very typical of this country, called "Sopa D. Pata," which is maD. based on beef leg and vegetables. This is a very popular, sought-after dish. Zoila makes and sells this soup in San Salvador's central market, one of the capital's largest and a site where there is much competition in food sales. Zoila has been in this type of work for 16 years and has acquired a bit of fame due to the special touch she adds to her product; she is very respected and known for being hard-working and kind both to her customers and to the persons who help her in her business. Zoila is asking for funding to buy the raw materials needed to make this delicious soup because, thanks to this business, she and her husband have managed to get ahead working hard to have a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina has managed a small store since 1987. She sells coconut wine for PHP 200 per container. Then the income was used to buy the daily needs of her family. She continues to sells coconut wine because it is a very good business. She would like to increase her business through the help of a loan.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional coconut wine for her store.

loans.use: To buy additional coconut wine to resell

loans.name: Mame Yacine

texts.fr: Madame Mame Yacine D. sollicite un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour acheter des tissus du genre indigo (thioupe)  qu’elle place à ses clients qui lui règlent par fin de mois. En fait cette dame, célibataire âgée de 44 ans, est dans le secteur du commerce depuis  5 ans pour dit-elle régler ses propres besoins. Elle pratique le commerce ambulant de tissus, d’habits, arachide …etc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Yacine D. is requesting a 150,000 FCFA credit loan to buy indigo-style fabrics (thioupe) she offers to her clients, who then pay her end of month. This 44-year-old lady has in fact been active in retail commerce for the past five years, to meet her personal needs. She is an itinerant vendor of fabrics, clothes, peanuts, etc.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabrics for her business

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Byambasuren operates a soldering and manufacturing iron products business with her husband in her town. She has been operating her business since 1999, and has steadily expanded her business and over the years she has gained much experience. Byambasuren and her husband have a loyal customer base, and they manufactured the iron fence along the driveway of the Arvaiheer soum.

Currently, they have been busy with many orders from customers, and they are planning to expand their business and workplace in the future. Byambasuren is a very hardworking person and she is very enthusiastic about the future. She says, “Education is the most important thing for everyone, and I would like to be financially available for my children's studying in the future. In addition, I would like to have my own plot of land with a yard in the future.” She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug to purchase more iron while the wholesale prices remain low.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua E. operates a fufu joint at Akotokyire where she pounds fufu with a variety of soups, depending on the day of the week. On this day, Monday, she was going to serve the fufu with palm nut soup. Fufu is one the most popular food in the country. It is made out of cassava and plantain, cassava and cocoyam or yam mixed together in a form of pounding. Ekua has received a senior high education.  She is married to a driver and has two children. Ekua helps her husband in the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs such as yam to cook to bring variety into her sales. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to put up a shop where people can comfortably sit to eat.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as yam

loans.name: Alaba

texts.en: Alaba E. is 27 years old, married with 3 children. Her eldest child is 6 years old. Her children attend school and this gives her joy as a mother. Alaba sells clothes by hawking them on a cart within her community in Ibadan, Oyo state. She hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. Alaba says thank-you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: María

texts.es: María S. O. de 60 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, la cual día con día se esfuerza por salir adelante y mejorar en todo lo que sea posible. Vive junto a su esposo, su hija y dos nietos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. María posee una tienda en la cual vende productos de primera necesidad como: agua embotellada, gas propano, pan, leche y otros más, la tienda se encuentra ubicada en su casa de habitación la cual se encuentra en Santa María, en el departamento de Usulután. Desde hace 5 años que María cuenta con este negocio, el cual poco a poco ha ido sacando adelante surtiéndolo con lo que ha sido posible para ella, ya que esto es bastante difícil, ya que la mayoría de las ganancias son destinadas a los gastos familiares. Es por esta razón que María solicita un préstamo a Integral por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos comestibles, así mismo productos los cuales sean de primera necesidad para el hogar. María es alguien quien sueña con mejorar su condición económica, es por esto que espera mejorar mucho su negocio.
texts.en:
María S. O. is 60 years old. She is a hardworking woman who works day to day to get ahead and improve in every way possible. She lives with her husband, her daughter and her two minor grandchildren, who are in school. María has a store where she sells basic products such as: bottled water, propane gas, bread, milk, and more. The store is located in her house, which is in Santa María, in the department of Usulután. Maria has had this business for five years. She has gotten it ahead little by little, diversifying it as much as she has been able, since it is very difficult. Most of the profits are used for family expenses. This is the reason that María is asking for a loan from Integral through which she can buy a greater quantity of edible products, and items that are basic necessities for the home. María is someone who dreams of improving her economic condition, and that is why she is hoping to much improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishable items.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha tiene 64 años, vive sola en su casa propia, pues sus hijos ya son independientes. Ella se dedica en la venta de productos de belleza, actividad que ha venido desarrollando a lo largo de todos estos años, pues al ser sus hijos ya independientes y no teniendo responsabilidades económicas con ellos, puede realizar su trabajo más cómodamente. Martha es la líder de la zona en la que vive, esto significa que debe organizar a un grupo de compañeras, para que realicen bien la venta y proveerles la cantidad de productos que han logrado vender. Ella se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, pues ha pensado en seguir mejorando su negocio adquiriendo mayor cantidad de productos y de paso ganar los premios que le ofrece la compañía de cosméticos para la que trabaja. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Martha quiere comprar mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
Martha, age 64, lives in alone in her own house. Her children are now independent. She sells beauty products, an activity which she has developed over many years. Now that her children are independent and she is not economically responsible for them, she can work more comfortably. Martha is the leader in the area where she lives. That means that she needs to organize a group of colleagues in order to make good sales and to provide them with the products they have sold. She is very happy with the work she does. She has thought about continuing to improve her business by getting more products. Then she would win the prizes offered by the cosmetic company she works for. This is her first loan with MFP, and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments. Martha wants to buy more beauty products to have them in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of beauty products

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: The photo shows Prak P. with his wife at their home.  Prak is 32 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom Province.
