To pursue a daily income, he owns a motorbike and operates a taxi service.  Beside his taxi business, Prak and his wife grow a few crops on their land next to their house for extra income.  They have one child who attends school.  The coming rainfall is good for growing, however, Prak needs a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers, insecticides and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: Marcelo, de 65 años, lleva 21 años separado de su pareja, pues no tiene hijos, por lo que vive sólo en su casa propia, en compañía de sus inquilinos.En su juventud  era operador de locomotoras y trailers, en un asentamiento minero del cual se jubiló y de inmediato se fue a vivir a su ciudad natal. Tenia temor de  regresar a trabajar en  la agricultura, pero luego de un tiempo se decidió, y aplico las técnicas agrícolas que le enseñó su padre y ahora es uno de los mejores productores, pues desde hace 8 años cultiva  diferentes tipos de tubérculos, además de avena (pastizal), en sus terrenos propios. Lo que más le gusta es trabajar sus tierras y mantenerlas siempre limpias y verdes, porque así auguran una cosecha exitosa, sin embargo, le disgusta no contar con la ayuda de nadie, por eso piensa arrendar todos sus terrenos a su hermano, además quiere comprar cantidad de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y conejos pues quiere  instalar su granja.Es la décima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y como es parte de la junta directiva, se siente contento de seguir trabajando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, porque son personas responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.Marcelo tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de abono para esparcirlos en sus cultivos, pues desea mejorar la calidad, de esta manera espera continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Marcelo, 65, has been separated from his partner for 21 years, but he doesn't have children so he lives alone in his own house in the company of his tenants. In his youth he was a train and truck operator in a mine site, from which he retired and immediately when to live in the city of his birth. Marcelo was afraid of going back to work in agriculture, but arrived at a point when he decided to do so and applied the agricultural techniques that his father taught him. Now he is one of the best producers in the region. For 8 years Marcelo has cultivated different types of tubers, as well as wheat (grass) on his own plots of land. What he enjoys most about his work is working on the land and keeping his crops clean and green, as this assures him of an excellent harvest. Nevertheless, he doesn't like not having anyone to help him and so he is thinking about renting his land out to his brother. Marcelo also wants to purchase a quantity of small animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens and rabbits, and to install a barn. This is the tenth time he has had a loan from MFP, and as he is part of the board of directors he feels happy to continue working with the members of his communal bank as they are very responsible people. Marcelo plans to invest this loan in the purchase of sacks of fertiliser to scatter on his crops as he wants them to be of a better quality, and in this way continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser to improve crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cosmetics, creams, and tools to use in her beauty salon

loans.name: Tirso

texts.en:
Tirso R. is from the village of Cabisera 5, Baribad. He is 37 years-old and married with three young children. To make a living, Tirso owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Tirso has been engaged in his business for over 16 years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Tirso joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tirso is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Tirso from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra S. is from the town of Banga. She is 48 years old. Sandra is married and has 4 children. Her eldest is aged 28 and the youngest is 20. To make a living, Sandra owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Sandra wishes for her children to become professionals some day.

Sandra joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sandra has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Sandra is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Decsi Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

La señora Decsi mantiene una relación de unión libre hace ya 25 años, tiene 6 hijos los cuales todos estudian y aun viven en su casa, el esposo se dedica a la venta de legumbres en un triciclo el cual recorre la ciudad para hacer sus ventas.

En los actuales momentos ella trabaja en la venta de legumbres en su casa dice que el negocio es pequeño pero esto le permite ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia, trabaja desde 4am hora que junto a su esposo se va al mercado a comprar las frutas y legumbres que estén bien frescas para venderlas en el transcurso del día. Labora hasta las 3pm.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas y verduras. Además de sillas, mesas ollas, y otros artículos para poner una picantería (restaurant). Está en el banco desde hace 10 ciclos y le gusta el banco por que presta el dinero sin muchos tramites.
 
Sus metas son que su negocio sea productivo y comprar un piano para su hijo que quiere ser músico.
texts.en:
The community bank named "May 3" meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for its commerce, for its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the generally happy population. Decsi has been with her boyfriend for 25 years. They have 6 children together and they all go to school and still live at home. Her husband sells vegetables from a tricycle that he drives throughout town to make his sales. She also sells vegetables but from her house and she says that the business is small but it helps her contribute towards the family's expenses. She works from 4am, the same time when her husband goes to the markets to purchase their fruits and vegetables, to have the freshest product possible to sell during the day. She works until 3pm. This new loan will be used to purchase fruits and vegetables, as well as chairs, tables, and other items to set up a small restaurant. She has been a member in the community bank for the past 10 loan cycles and she enjoys this community bank because there isn't a lot of red tape. Her goal is to have her business be more productive and purchase a piano for her son. He wants to be a musician.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables and furniture to set up a restaurant.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 40 years old and married with four children who are between 4 and 19 years old.  Vestine owns a shop where she sells a variety of goods which include rice, sugar, salt, etc. She also sells drinks and some other goods (as shown in the picture).  She has been in this business for about three years. The business hours are from 6 am to 9 pm every day.

Vestine needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, Vestine will purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs.  She hopes to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to keep reinvesting in her business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet N. lives in the Kalerwe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, three of whom are in school.   Annet has a business of selling chickens. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 7 days out of every week. Annet sells her products at the market, by means of retail.

Annet has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more chickens. The main business challenge(s) for Annet include seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start rearing chickens herself.  Annet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for resale.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño, tiene 39 años, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos (21,17,15,13 años.
Gabriela se dedica  a la preparación y venta de alimentos (restaurante) tiene una concesión en el paradero de la Ruta No 6, su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de telares, carteras, tapices, cojines, etc.
Gabriela con el préstamo que solicita comprará, arroz, azúcar, aceite , fideos, papas verduras y todo lo necesario para la preparación de alimentos y una parte para la compra de lana para que trabaje su esposo e hijo.
Le gusta las reuniones de su bancomunal porque puede ahorrar, hay mucha solidaridad entre las socias, se ayudan cuando algunas de ellas tienen dificultades o problemas.
Le gusta las capacitaciones porque le hablan de negocios, salud, de como invertir su dinero, a no sobreendeudarse ya sabe como debe trabajar las juntas directivas.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y que tengan su propio negocio para que no sufran, le gustaría también tener un local donde pueda vender los trabajos que elabora su esposo pues ahora los intermediaros lo visitan y compran.
texts.en:
Gabriela is a member of the 'Retoño' community bank.  She is 39 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 4 children aged 21, 17, 15 and 13.

Gabriela makes and sells food (restaurant).  She has a concession at the bus stop of route number 6.  Her husband works with a loom making wallets, carpets, cushions etc.

Gabriela will use the loan which she is requesting to buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, potatoes, vegetables and everything else she needs to prepare food.  The rest she will use to buy wool for her husband and son to work with.

She likes the meetings of her community bank because she can save and there is a lot of solidarity between the members.  They help each other when anyone has difficulties or problems.

She likes the training sessions because they talk about business, health, how to invest money and how not to get themselves too far into debt.  She now knows how boards of directors should work.

Her dream is for her children to be professionals and for them to have their own businesses so that they don't suffer.  She would also like to have premises where she can sell her husband's handicrafts as right now intermediaries visit them and buy from them.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, noodles, potatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Tamasha

texts.ru:
Tamasha H. 42 qoda. Ona zamujem i jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Tamasha imeyet 2 detey doch kotoroy 19 let ona uchitsya v universitete i sin kotoromu 16 let uchitsya v shkole.

Tamasha uje 4 qoda zanimayetsya prodajey tovarov domashneqo upotrebleniya. V svoyom maqazine ona prodayot kastruli, skavorodki, tarelki  a tak je spalneye bilyo, skaterti i t.d Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit pomesheniye.
texts.en: Tamasha H. is 42 years old. She is married and lives in the Absheron Region together with her family. Tamasha has two children: a 19-year old daughter who is a university student and a 16-year old son who goes to school. For four years, Tamasha has been selling household goods. In her store she sells pots, pans, dishes, as well as bed linen, tablecloths, and so on. She learned this business from her mother. At present she needs 2000 AZN in order to expand her facility.

loans.use: Expanding her store facility

loans.name: Muratbek

texts.en:
Muratbek S. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His three oldest children attend a local school, and his youngest son is in kindergarten. His wife works as a librarian, and Muratbek operates a coal-delivery business using his own truck. 

Muratbek began his transportation business in 2000 and has gained much experience as a driver. After many years of owing his business, he has established a wide customer base. Muratbek is a hardworking and decent man and says, " All I want is to improve my truck, which is very outdated and requires a lot of repairs." He is requesting a loan of 1,100,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to increase his working capital for his coal-delivery business.

loans.use: To repair his truck

loans.name: Marleni

texts.en:
Marleni is twenty-eight years old. She shares her home with her four children. The family lives in the district of Tambogrande in northern Peru.  Tambogrande is a semi-tropical zone just a few hours away from the coastal desert in the province of Piura. It is primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers. Many residents own small fruit plantations or raise animals. 

Marleni sells beauty products. She works primarily with the product line UNIQUE, a well-known company in the area, which provides women with access to business opportunities. Marleni has a good number of consistent clients. She visits her clients regularly and makes bulk orders twice per month. She sells products from inventory, on request and on credit. Her clients appreciate the good treatment she provides and the flexibility.

Marleni has worked with Edpyme Alternativa in the past. She has a good repayment record and has used the loans responsibly. She plans to use the funds to expand her inventory and to meet the last minute needs of her clients as the holiday season approaches. She hopes the investment will improve her market share and to improve her income ongoing.

loans.use: To expand her inventory and to meet last minute needs of her clients as the holiday season approaches.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío es socia del Banco Comunal Belén, tiene 24 años de edad, trabaja en un taller de confecciones, los préstamos que ha recibido los ha utilizado para comprar hilo, agujas, tijeras y tela. En esta época el negocio es bajo debido a que el año escolar terminó recientemente y gran parte de su negocio proviene de confección de uniformes escolares. Rocío es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace mas de un año y ha sido presidenta de su Banco Comunal Belén. Lo que más le gusta de trabajar con FINCA Perú son las capacitaciones que recibe sobre cómo mejorar su negocio. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, comprar más máquinas de coser, actualmente sólo tiene uno.
texts.en:
Rocío is a member of the Belén (Bethlehem) community bank.  She is 24 years old and works in a dressmaking workshop.  She has used previous loans to buy thread, needles, scissors and fabric.  During this season her business is slow as the school year recently ended and a large part of her business comes from making school uniforms.

Rocío has been a member of FINCA Perú for more than a year and she has been president of her community bank.  What she most likes about working with FINCA Perú are the training sessions that she attends on how to improve her business.  Her dream is to expand her business and buy more sewing machines.  She currently only has one.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Eliberto de Jesus A. es un comerciante 27 a;os de edad, casado, con tres hijos, y reside en el barrio Guanacaste en el municipio de La union, Olancho. Eliberto es integrante del grupo solidario Las Estrellas y funge como coordinador del mismo. Desde hace un a;o Eliberto inicio con el negocio de venta de abarroteria en un peque;o espacio de su domicilio. Su esposa le de terminar con los quehaceres del hogar lo ayuda a atender a los clientes. Su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo desde las 6:00 am hasta las 7:00 pm. Una de sus ventajas es que en el barrio donde vive no hay otro negocio parecio al de El, es por eso que cuenta con la clientela total. 

Eliberto solicita el prestamo para surtir su pulperia de mas productos para asi poder ofrecer a sus clientes una gama de opciones. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra seguir teniendo una entrada de dinero para sostener a su familia, ya que su negocio estara bien surtido. 

Su sue;o es tener un mini super y contar con los ingresos suficientes para educar a sus hijos y darles una mejor condicion de vida. Es su segundo ciclo en FAMA y ha demostrado responsabilidad en el pago de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Eliberto de Jesus A. is 27 years old and is a merchant. He is married, has three children and lives in the Guanacaste neighborhood in the municipality of La Union, Olancho. Eliberto is a member of the communal bank Las Estrellas and also serves as the bank's coordinator. A year ago Eliberto started his business selling groceries in a small space in his home. After she finishes her housework, his wife helps him serve the customers. His work schedule is Monday through Sunday, from 6:00 am until 7:00 pm. One of his advantages is that the neighborhood where he lives does not have a similar business which is why he counts with all the customers. 

Eliberto is requesting a loan to stock his grocery store with more products to be able to offer his customers a range of options. With the support from this loan he will be able to continue to have an income stream to support his family since his business will be well stocked. 

His dream is to have a small supermarket and have enough income to educate his children and to give them a better quality of life. This is his second loan cycle with field partner FAMA and he has shown that he is responsible in making his payments.

loans.use: Purchase groceries to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Rosalia Josefina

texts.es: Rosalía es una señora muy responsable con los pagos de sus cuotas. Ella trabaja arduamente en sus chacras, se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de tunas y cochinilla desde hace más de diez años. Con el producto de su trabajo logró comprar terrenos para chacras pero como son pequeños y ella desea sembrar mayor cantidad de semilla decidió alquilar más terreno. Rosalía está feliz con el ingreso de su actividad porque con la ayuda de estos ingresos y el apoyo moral, económico de su esposo cubre los  estudios de su hija quien se está preparando para ingresar a la universidad y también cubre los gastos de sus pequeños hijos. Ella solicitó el préstamo para comprar más abono para seguir cultivando sus chacras. A Rosalía le encantaría que su hijo mayor quien está estudiando mecánica  tenga su propio taller o factoría. En la fotografía podemos apreciar a Rosalía con el último de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosalía is a woman who is very responsible with her repayments.  She works hard in her fields growing prickly pears and cochineal; she’s been thus occupied for over 10 years.  Her work made it possible for her to buy land for farming but, because the plots are small and she wants to plant larger amounts of seed, she decided to buy more land.

Rosalía is happy with the income from her activity because with the income and moral and economic support from her husband she covers her daughter’s educational expenses who is preparing to enroll in the university as well as the expenses of her little children.

She asked for the loan to buy more manure to continue farming her fields.  Rosalía would be ecstatic if her oldest son, who is studying mechanics, could have his own workshop or factory.

In the photo we can see Rosalía with her youngest son.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina has been living in the area of Daata Nagar, Lahore, for the past 16 years with her family in a 2-room brick house. Lahore is Pakistan’s 2nd largest city and also known for its history and culture.  
Samina is 38 years old, married to M. A., and has 2 children. Both are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. 
Her husband has been involved in the furniture-making business for the last 10 years. His showroom is located in the market and he makes good quality furniture. 
Samina herself is a housewife.  She prefers to stay at home and take care of her household responsibilities. She is an active and supportive lady and takes care of her family very well.  She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy wood, nails, and furniture polish to make larger quantities of furniture. This should help him to fulfill larger orders on time.  Samina is very confident that her husband will make good use of the loan and will successfully be able to expand his business.
This is Samina's 2nd loan application with Asasah.   In the previous loan year, she has proved herself a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting.

loans.use: To buy wood, nails and furniture polisher for furniture making business

loans.name: Filomina

texts.en:
Filomina T. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 63 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a manufacturing business, making and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-six years and earns approximately $47 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Filomina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. 

Filomina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be her 5th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia S. is from the city of Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is 55 years old. Cecilia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Cecilia makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2011, Cecilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Cecilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Irailakan's Group

texts.en:
Irailakan T., age 55, is the leader of this group. She has earned a living by offering convenience goods for sale for the past 34 years. Her monthly profit is 3,000 soms. She hopes to obtain this loan in order to purchase more goods so that she can increase the turnover of her business. With part of the loan, she will purchase fertilizers and seeds for farming. In the future, she wants to improve the family’s living conditions. 

Irailakan lives with her husband and family in Uzgen, a beautiful and ancient town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Her husband is retired and receives a monthly pension in amount of 2,500 soms. Together they have raised seven children: the youngest son is 15.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
- People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), 
- Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and 
- Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). 
MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Pyramide Plus Group

texts.en:
Clément is the leader of a community bank named “Pyramide Plus”.  This group which is composed of 15 microentrepreneurs, united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.
 
Clément sells second-hand clothing. He started his business in 2005 with the beginning capital of US$60. With hard work and determination, he has succeeded in making it thrive thanks to good management and accumulated profits.  Currently, he earns a profit of $120 every week. 

Clément is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has received three previous loans which he has successfully repaid.  He intends to use this next loan to increase the inventory for his business by purchasing a second-hand clothing bundle in order to increase his profit. 

Clément is married and is the father of three children aged between 10 months and 6 years old -- one of them is currently going to school. His dream is to open a general boutique and a drugstore in his community.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to resell

loans.name: Pasha

texts.ru: Pasha A. rodilsya v 1969 qodu. Pasha uje 12 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom, pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Seychas Pasha nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya uvelicheniya molochnoqo produkta dlya prodaji v magazini.
texts.en: Pasha A. was born in 1969. Pasha has been a herdsman for twelve years, raising cows.  He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives with his close-knit family in the Fuzuli region.  He is married and has two children who go to school.  Now, Pasha needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to increase production of the milk he sells in stores.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Charen

texts.en:
Charen is 29 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Charen has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from ready-to-wear clothing.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is a hardworking entrepreneur living in the Philippines. He is 48 years old and married. Roberto has five children. His wife works as a domestic helper.

Roberto has been in the business of furniture making for four years. Each month, he earns 15,000 Philippines pesos. He plans to use this loan to purchase wood to be used in furniture making.

In the future, Roberto would like to diversify his business to make frequent sales and to make his family more economically stable.

loans.use: to purchase wood to be used in furniture making

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He has been active in mixed farming for over ten years, producing and selling coffee, milk and bananas to the local market. He is married and has one child, aged nine years. He gets additional income from his masonry work.

Kenneth has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES to start construction of a modern dairy unit. He hopes the better shelter will secure his cows, limit the common animal diseases and improve his income, which will enable him to educate his child.

He notes that animal diseases and the high cost of dairy feeds are still the greatest challenges for his farming business.

loans.use: to construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: 10 Hải Sơn - Hoằng Trường - Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Ms. Thuỷ is applying for a loan to improve her business. She operates a food stall selling fish.

Thuỷ is 21 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 10 Hải Sơn - Hoằng Trường - Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her three dependents.

In 2010, Thuỷ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thuỷ has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thuỷ has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Thuỷ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thuỷ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for fish selling

loans.name: Sope Baye Niass Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité sope baye niass a été créé le 29/06/2009.Il est composé de 11 membres issus de la même localité.Leur activité principale est le commerce.

Madame Tabara en position assise , à l'extrême droite est la responsable du groupement elle est mariée, âgée de 45 ans et mère de 02 enfants .

Sa principale activité est le commerce de chaussures,d'écharpes,de mil et des arachides.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin  de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui est essentiellement féminine.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires,construire sa maison.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Baye Niass was created on June 29, 2009. It is composed of eleven members from the same town. Their main work involves commerce. 

Ms. Tabara (seated at the far right in the photo) is the group's official. She is 45 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  Her main business involves commerce in footwear, scarves, millet, and peanuts. 

Her loan will enable her to stock up on a sufficient quantity of merchandise in order to respond to the demands of her customer base, which is essentially made up of women. Her goal is to increase her turnover and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (footwear and scarves)

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 32 years old and lives in Paynesville. She’s married and her husband collects and sells used bottles.  They have two children aged 8 and 3 years.  Both of them live at home and attend school in the morning.  In the afternoon, the elder looks after the younger child and minds the stall when Mamie has to go to the market.  

Mamie sells dried goods (Soap,Tissue, Toothpaste, etc) from a table; sometimes she uses a wheelbarrow to make deliveries.  Her principal concern is fluctuations in the level of business which is sometimes very slow.  She learned this business from her auntie.  She is proud to run her own business and of the independence it gives her.

She’s requesting a loan to purchase stock for her business.  In the future, she hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase stock (Soap,Tissue, Toothpaste, etc) for her business.

loans.name: Bandina

texts.en: Bandina is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Bandina has a pigpen and sells matured & grown pigs. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs. Bandina has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Bandina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Béatrice Ama

texts.fr:
Béatrice Ama est une femme  âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 03enfants.
Béatrice Ama travaille comme revendeuse de bananes, de farine, de charbon, de tapioca  depuis 1989. Elle livre ses marchandises à la maison après achat à Danyi(KPALIME).
Béatrice Ama a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbon, des bananes, de la farine.
WAMPA
texts.en:
Béatrice Ama is 47 years old. She is married to a driver and the mother of three children. She has been selling bananas, flour, coal and tapioca since 1989. She sells her goods out of her home after having bought them in Danyi (Kpalimé).

Béatrice Ama came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy coal, bananas and flour.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coal.

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is 33 years old and married. She has 2 children ages 7 and 6. Jenilyn's husband is a farmer.

Jenilyn has had a sari-sari (convenience) store business for 3 years. She sells canned goods, sugar, coffee and other various products. Jenilyn also helps her husband grow rice on their farm. She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, coffee, sugar and other items.

In the future, Jenilyn hopes to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, coffee, sugar and other items

loans.name: Marie Providence

texts.en:
Marie Providence, who is single, is a rice farmer. She has been doing rice farming for the past four years. She was taught rice farming by her parents.

She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and, lastly, in harvesting activities.

With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Manohari

texts.en:
A four-storied wooden framed building in the heart of Tangal, a busy district near Kathmandu, is home to this family-run business, ‘Nepalese Wood Craft Child Craft.’ The family has been in the wood craft business for three generations. Over the years, the business has expanded to employ twenty people from the community who have become like a family, according to the business proprietor. She is applying for a Kiva loan to purchase more raw materials to make wooden toys and learning tools for children.

Once a year during the sale season, she sells her products to a number of buyers, including non-profit organizations such as “Save the Children” and “Room to Read.” Many of these products help children learn to read and count, while some products, such as the rocking horse, are meant for entertainment. For rest of the year, Manohari is busy overseeing the preparation of stock for the next season.

The factory works at every stage of the production line - from cutting through the first grain of wood for making a rocking horse or a jigsaw puzzle to varnishing a toy with final paint. The Kiva loan will help Manohari to purchase materials for these processes so that the business can produce more stock in time for the big sale season.

loans.use: to buy wood to craft children's toys and learning tools.

loans.name: Wanjohi

texts.en:
Wanjohi is a resident and a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. He is 38 years old and married with four children between one and ten years-old. His farm produces milk, maize, beans and vegetables for the local market. He fully relies on farming for his family upkeep.

Wanjohi has made a loan request amounting to 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He will use the additional income to repay the loan and school fees for his children. He hopes to upgrade his cattle in future and operate under economies of scale.

He mentions high costs of raising animals as the main problem in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer Group

texts.es:
Nuevo Renacer se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, gracias a que la actual presidenta, la Sra. Norma contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 14 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en el 1° ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Una de las miembros es la señora Ramona, quien se dedica a la venta de lencería, dice que tiene ya muy buena clientela, ya que siempre trae productos de buena calidad y eso agrada a sus clientes. Comenta que por medio de este trabajo ella logra mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de todo tipo de lencería, lo cual le ayudará a cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
An excellent group of women is called Nuevo Renacer. It based is the city of Villa Elisa, thanks to the present president, Norma, who contacted the consultant in a weekly meeting that she had in the area to find out about the type of work the Enterprising Women's Committee does. Once she had consulted about the program, she was able to get 14 women together who are working very well together and are in their 1rst cycle. They are united and supportive in the program.    

One of the members is Ramona. She sells undergarments. She says she has a very good customer base since she always brings good quality products and this pleases her customers. She remarks that with this work she is able to support her self and her family.  

She is asking for the loan to buy all types of undergarments, which will help her to satisfy her customers demand.

loans.use: to buy undergarments to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia Maria está estudiando administración de empresas, está cursando el quinto año, y el crédito solicitado será para pagar el curso de titulación para obtener el título de su carrera. Sueña con tener su propia empresa y apoyar a los jóvenes que desea superarse y que por falta de empleo no han podido. Le inspira el poder lograr sus metas para superar las necesidades de su familia. Siempre ha sido responsable con sus compromisos, y espera mantener el mismo comportamiento con este crédito
texts.en: Claudia María is studying Business Administration; she’s in the fifth year.  The loan will be to pay for her final course in order to graduate and receive her professional title.  She dreams with having her own firm and to help young adults who want to get ahead but who have been unable to do so because of lack of employment.  She’s inspired to reach her goals to overcome her family’s needs.  She’s always been responsible with her commitments and expects to behave the same way with this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her university courses.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en:
Edgar owns and manages his corn farming business. He is proud that he is a farmer. Edgar has managed his corn fields for almost 20 years and he is able to earn an income of P45,000 per crop season but he uses this amount for school fees, household expenses and allowances for his children. He devotes full-time in improving his corn fields because he would like to earn a greater amount to provide for his family's needs. He is 40 years of age and married with two children. He is glad because he has a supportive wife.

Edgar aims to increase his yields this coming crop season because his crops were destroyed by the typhoons "Pedring and Quiel". With this circumstance, his profit is no longer sufficient and that's the reason why he is asking for additional capital amounting to P50,000 which will be used in buying fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides to improve the growth of his crops. He is hoping that he can obtain his goal in life and most of all he will be able to send his children into higher education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides for agricultural business.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 82-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
 
Vicenta has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts for copra. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts and bananas for selling.

Vicenta has been a member of HSPFI since 1996. In the future, Vicenta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for selling.

loans.name: Rosa Carlota

texts.es:
Rosa Carlota tiene 45 años de edad es soltera tiene tres hijos, vive con los hijos de 19, 17 y 12 años de edad en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Rosa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 12 años. Las compras y las ventas los realiza en ventanas. Solicita el crédito para seguir trabajando, comprar abonos agrícolas.

 Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá pagar a los trabajadores. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problemas. 
En el tiempo libre le gusta trabajar.
texts.en:
Rosa Carlota, 45, is a single mother.  She lives with her three children--19-, 17-, and 12-years old, respectively--in Ventana, a canton of the Ecuadorean province of Los Rios.  

Rosa Carlota is a member of the Las Palmas community bank in the rural town of Campo Alegre.

Rosa Carlota has been a farmer for 12 years.  She grows maize and rice.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy manure to fertilize her land.

Your loan will help Rosa Carlota to pay her workers.  She's never had problems of this kind before.  She likes to work, even in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married and has two children. Rosemarie is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Rosemarie is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice crops to sell to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years and every month she earns 18,893 PHP from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

Rosemarie has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to enable her children to complete their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: Sambath, 57, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She sells cake at the market. Her husband is a construction worker. All of her children are garment workers. Sambath is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work and to run as motor taxi when he is free. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate extra income to support her family. In addition, she plans to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia is 30 years old and married with two children aged two and 11. For the past six years, she has sold used clothes to earn a living, and now employs one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to expand her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy trousers, dresses and jackets to resell.

loans.use: To buy trousers, dresses and jackets.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 38 years old.  She is married and has three children aged 15, 14 and 10.  In 1998, she established  her poultry farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy chickens for her business.  

In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 0In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business.  Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy.  Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chickens for her business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María, se decidió por un nuevo crédito en vista que a su negocio llegan más clientes y considera que su inventario no cubrirá las demandas que estos le hacen, realizara la compra de prendas de vestir y calzado para ambos sexos, con ello podrá satisfacer a sus clientes y tener ingresos estables para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
 Se siente muy satisfecha por administrar bien los créditos que se le otorgan, pues hoy en día genera más ingresos, su negocio ha crecido, sus deudas han disminuido y puede ayudar mucho más a su familia.

loans.use: compra de prendas de vestir y calzado para ambos sexos, con ello podrá satisfacer a sus clientes y tener ingresos estables para cumplir con sus obligaciones

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: A 32-year-old woman, married with four children, Dorcas I. lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks to the community. She promises to increase her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Nafesa

texts.en: Nafesa D/O G. A. was born in 1962 and lives in District 7 of Kabul City. She is married and helps her husband financially with her Bead Working business. When she first started her business she lacked the money to buy all the material she needed, but she worked hard and made good quality clothes and sold them in the market. Her first loan was used to buy beads and fabric to produce more clothes to sell. She is ready to take another loan in order to purchase more beads and fabrics which will enable her to produce more clothes and do more business in the market.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and beads

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuy O., 47 years old mother of 5 children, lives with her husband in a part of Preyveng province, Cambodia. To service in her family's expenses, Tuy O. operates a business in the suburb of the city selling a variety of fruits, and typically makes about $16/day in revenue. Her husband, meanwhile, works on a farm growing crops and breeding animals, while 2 of her children work at a local hotel and the rest are students.

Tuy O. is requesting a loan amount of $1000 to purchase more fruits in order to keep investing in her sustainable business as well as to meet her clients' demand. For the coming year, she hopes to have enough money to keep expanding her business and offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Mery Angelica

texts.es:
Mery works selling ceviche and other foods made with fish and seafood. She began her business to meet her family’s needs and also to let her excellent abilities in the kitchen shine. She is located in San José de Sisa, in the department of San Martín, Perú. The ceviche and other foods are prepared according to the requests of the customers, who are from the community and also visitors that come from other cities.

The loan that she that she will receive is from the Moviemento Manuela Ramos, through its Doradinas en Acción Communal Bank. She will invest it in fixing up her own restaurant with adequate furniture to provide better service to her customers and will also buy ingredients for making ceviche and a diversity of other foods so that she can fulfill the daily orders. The loans she has received have grown from S/300 ($94) to S/700 ($219).

She is 38 years old and has two daughters. In addition to tending to her business and taking care of her family, she is also studying at a technological institute in order to better prepare herself because her goal is to buy land and produce and sell agricultural products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Mery, se dedica a la venta de cebiche y otros paltos a base de pescados y mariscos, decidió iniciar su negocio para solucionar las necesidades familiares, y además para sacar a relucir las habilidades que posee en la cocina. Ella esta ubicada en San José de Sisa, en el departamento de San Martín – Perú. El cebiche y otros platos son preparados según los pedidos de los clientes que son propios de la comunidad y los visitantes que llegan de otras ciudades El préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos, a través de su Banco Comunal Doradinas en Acción, será invertido en el arreglo de su propio local, implementación con mobiliario adecuado para una mejor atención a los clientes, compra de insumos para la producción del cebiche y platos diversos y así cumplir con los pedidos diarios. Los prestamos que ha recibido han ido creciendo desde S/300 ($94) llegando a S/700 ($219) Ella tiene 38 años y 2 hijas, paralelo a la atención de su negocio y con el apoyo de su familia, estudia actualmente en un instituto tecnológico para superarse cada día más, porque su meta es comprar tierras y dedicarse a la producción y venta de productos agrícolas.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her restaurant and to buy food ingredients

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
Sebastiana is 40 years old and has three children. She and her husband are merchants; they sell fruits and vegetables to other communities far from their hometown. They have a van that lets them travel and transport their merchandise from one place to another. Sebastiana is part of the solidarity group called Crisantema 1. With your loan she will increase the investement in fruits and vegetables which will allow them to visit more communities and increase their income, thus improving the financial situation of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

SEBASTIANA tiene 40 años y tiene tres hijos. Ella junto con su esposo son comerciantes, se dedican a vender frutas y verduras a otras comunidades lejanas a su lugar de origen, tienen una camioneta que les permite viajar y transportar la mercancía de un lugar a otro. Forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Crisantema 1. Con su préstamo aumentara la inversión de frutas y verduras lo cual permitirá que visiten más comunidades y así obtendrán mas ganancias que les permitirá mejorar su condición económica familiar.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (fruits and vegetables)

loans.name: Mork

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Mok and her husband Mr. Mut Moen got married in 1979. They have five children: two daughters and three sons. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor in2000 and started her silk production business in the same year. She has never attended primary school, while her husband, who began, did not graduate from primary school. Her husband grows rice and raises cattle.

This is Mrs K. Mok's first loan from MAXIMA. She is requesting $500 to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and to pay for fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
Mrs. T. has been making and selling tortillas for 10 years. Through her efforts, she has demonstrated that she can improve her financial situation. She started out with a small tortilla stand, and then, with her profits, she was able to set up a tortilla shop that she runs from home. Her hardwork has permitted her to raise her two children and proviD. for their schooling. With this loan, she will buy corn so that she can sell some while reserving the other portion for the fast-approaching winter. She also wants to take advantage the current market value of corn.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra T. tiene 10 años D. dedicarse a la venta D. las tortillas considera que con los esfuerzos se pueD. salir adelante y a si lo ha demostrado, ya que inicio con la venta D. tortillas y actualmente a puesto una tienda en su misma casa D. la ganancia que le a ido quedando D. ella. Su esfuerzo a contribuido para poder sacar adelante a dos D. sus hijos y seguir dándole el estudio a los demás con el financiamiento ella comprara Maíz para poder vender y tener D. reserva para el invierno que pronto se acerca, y aprovechar los precio actuales en el mercado.

loans.use: Purchase of corn for distribution and production of tortillas

location.town: Final Colonia Jerusalen Contiguo a Ferrocaril  cal

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel M. is a woman with many strengths who has managed to expande her clothes-selling business in the town of León in Nicaragua.

She is very proud of being a grandmother: she already has a grandson who is her responsibility and to whom she is dedicated to caring for at all times. It is for this reason that she tries to work everyday in order to give support to her young daughter in the maintenance of her small son

Through 35 long years, Maria Isabel has undertaken this activity. She used to acquire clothes sporadically but at very high prices. For this reason she came to Ceprodel in order to receive help with loans and thus acquire the merchandise to then market and sell it.

It is necessary to stress that currently she has a record of 7 credits, all repaid on time and in the correct manner. These have been used to buy stock and to improve the quality of life for her, her daughter and her grandson.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Isabel M. es una dama que con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio de venta de ropa en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua.

Se siente muy orgullosa por ser abuela, ya que tiene un nieto a su responsabilidad que se dedica a cuidarlo en todo momento. Es por esta razón que busca la manera de trabajar todos los días por darle el apoyo a su joven hija para mantener a su pequeño hijo.

Desde hace 35 largos años se dedica a esta actividad. La ropa la adquiere esporádicamente pero a precios muy altos. Por tal razón es que acude a CEPRODEL para recibir apoyo crediticio y así adquirir la mercadería y luego comercializarla.

Es necesario destacar que actualmente tiene un total de 7 créditos pagados en tiempo y forma. Estos han sido destinados para la compra de los productos y mejora de la calidad de vida de ella, su hija y su nieto.

loans.use: Purchase clothes

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru:
Gulandom M. lives in the Yavan region. She is 28 years old, single and does not have children. She has a High School education. She is in the business of selling clothing. She has her own sales location on the market. She brings clothing for sale from the the city of Dushanbe and sells it in Yavan. Because she does not yet have her own family, she helps her parents. She has 12 years experience working in this business. She plans to use the obtained loan to purchase spring clothing for sale. Her business makes it possible for the locals to purchase the necessary articles of clothing locally and at an affordable price without having to spend a lot of money on the road. She plans to repay the loan in a 12 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazu, Kiva volunteer

Музафарова Гуландом жительница Яванского района. Возраст 28 лет , не замужем, детей не имеет.Образование среднее. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли одеждой. Имеет торговую точку на рынке в районе. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и реализует в Яване.Т.к своей семьи не имеет помогает родителям. Опыт в этом бизнесе 12 лет.Кредит планирует использовать для ввоза весеннего товара.Так же ее бизнес дает возможность населению покупать необходимые вещи у себя в районе по доступным ценам не затрачивая деньги на дорогу. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase spring clothing

loans.name: Gwali Mutala Women's Group

texts.en: Macrene, age 54, is the chairperson of Gwali Mutala Women’s Group in Kasanje. She is a farmer growing sweet potatoes and cassava on her family land; and at the same time she buys produce from other farmers, including bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, and green pepper, which she takes to Kibuye farmers’ market every Wednesday for sale. She has been doing this with the help of her husband, who is also a farmer, for the past 20 years; and so far she is not regretting the path she took, especially with the loans she has been getting together with her members for 8 years now. Her dream is to buy a motorcycle to help her with the transportation of her produce from the villages, where she buys most of the produce. She is married with 8 children, the eldest being 35 years old and the youngest being 19. She also helps to look after 4 grandchildren who are still in school.

loans.use: Macrene intends to use the loan to buy more green bananas, Irish potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and green pepper so as to expand her business.

loans.name: Anna's Food Vending Group

texts.en:
Anna is 25 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 8 years old. She and her husband also take care of 3 other people, ages 49, 21and 8 years old. Anna owns a small food vending store and she is a clothes seller, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items and more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Edithar, who has business dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items and more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena has three children, two daughters ages 19 and 23, and one son age 28. Eight years ago she realized she needed to find work when she separated from her husband. The money he gave to the children didn't cover the family's expenses, and after a lot of time looking for work, Elena decided to start her own business selling used clothing. Little by little she has grown her business.

She is requesting a loan, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase more clothing to offer her customers and increase her income. Your contribution will help make this possible.

Elena, es madre de 3 hijos: 2 mujeres de 19, 23 y un varón de 28 años; desde hace 8 años se vio en la necesidad de buscar un trabajo debido a que se separo de su esposo, y con el dinero que le daban sus hijos, no le alcanzaba para cubrir los gastos familiares, después de mucho buscar decidió poner su propio negocio de venta de ropa usada, y fue así como poco a poco fueron incrementando sus ventas.

Ahora solicita un préstamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses, para surtir con ropa nueva para así tener más opciones para sus clientes, y tener un mayor ingreso. Con tu contribución Elena saldrá adelante.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE USED CLOTHING TO OFFER HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Jorge Roman

texts.es:
Jorge is married and he has two grown up children who are also married.

He began his business seven years ago when he was made redundant from his job in a gas company following its restructuring and reorganisation. Needing to earn an income, he decided to use the knowledge and experience he had gained on security products to market and sell these products.

Jorge needs a loan for $975, repayable over six months, to remodel and redecorate his office premises to be able to convey a better and more professional image to his clients. With your support, he will be able to increase his revenue and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Jorge es casado y tiene dos hijos, ya casados. El inicio su negocio hace 7 años al quedarse desempleado debido a un reajustado de la compañía de gas donde trabajaba, por lo que requeria de algun ingreso seguro, fue asi que decidio emprender su propio negocio, y al tenr conocimiento sobre los productos de seguridad decidio empezar con la comercializacion de dichos productos.

El necesita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para remodelar el local donde trabaja y tener una mejor imagen para sus clientes. Con tu apoyo Jorge hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Remodelling and Redecoration of business premises

loans.name: Fanta's Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Tiessiri 2 group are married women with an average of 28 years of age and 5 children. They live in polygamous families in the village of Sikouna 2 in the Fana area (Koulikoro region in Mali). The main activity of this group of women is the sale of wood for heating, charcoal (which they sell to peasants in Sikouna 2 and in surrounding villages) and various other items (gathering products, etc). They have a stock room for the charcoal or keep the wood in front of their joint sales stands. They generally sell the charcoal for cash or credit in the village or wholesale to buyers from big cities like Ségou and Bamako, who also come to the village to buy cargoes of heating wood. Linked by professional and friendship ties, and very experienced in the business, the members of the group decided to request their first group loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. They intend to buy 50 charcoal bags and 3 loads of heating wood and plan to attain an average monthly income of 12500FCFA, which will be used for paying the interest on the loan, providing for the needs of their families and especially for building their business activities.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Les membres du groupe Tiessiri 2 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’age de 28 ans et 5 enfants Elles vivent dans des familles polygames dans le village de Sikouna 2 sous préfecture de Fana( Région de Koulikoro République du Mali) L’activité principale de ce groupe de femmes Tiessiri 2 est la vente du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois (qu’elles achètent avec les paysans sur place à Sikouna 2 et dans les villages environnants) et d’articles divers (produits de cueillettes etc.). Elles disposent d’un lieu de stockage dans pour le charbon de bois) ou devant (pour le bois de chauffe) les concessions conjugales pour le stockage de leurs marchandises. Elles vendent généralement le charbon de bois à détail au comptant et à crédit à domicile (au village) et en gros aux forains venant des grandes villes comme Ségou et Bamako, qui viennent également jusqu’au village pour faire leurs cargaisons en bois de chauffe au comptant. Unies par des liens professionnels, de voisinage et très expérimentés dans les activités économiques, les membres du groupe ont décidé ensemble de solliciter la collaboration de l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. Elles comptent acheter 50 sacs de charbon de bois 3 chargements de bois de chauffe et envisagent réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12500FCFA. qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et surtout renforcer les activités.

loans.use: Purchase of coal and heating wood

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is married with 5 children ages 19, 15, 5, 3, and 1. She has been a vegetable seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 8am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Rebeca now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Aramatoulaye Khassim

texts.fr: Aramatoulaye Khassim D., 48 ans, mariée, 8 enfants à sa charge est membre du banc villageois de Néma Sobeya depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son activité de vente d’huile de palme, de miel, de citron, de balais, de poisson et d’huître. Ses revenus lui permettent d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’aider ses proches.<b>Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.<b/>
texts.en:
Aramatoulaye Khassim D., 48, is married and has 8 children in her care. She has been a member of the village bank Néma Sobeya for 6 and a half years. She would like to bolster her business selling palm oil, honey, lemons, brooms, fish and oysters. Her income allows her to improve living conditions for her family and help those near and dear to her. She is asking for a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and resale of foodstuffs and brooms

loans.name: Mrs. Hou Channa's Village Bank Group

texts.en: The Village Bank loan, which is located in Au Da Village in Kampong Cham Province, consists of eight members and they plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Hou C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is 31 years old and the mother of a child who is attending the local schoO.. She owns a small lake where she raises fish. Since she now has a lot of fish, she does not have enough money to buy enough food to feed them so she decided to ask for a loan to deal with this purpose. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Nak Pheak, is a construction worker who can earn less than $2 a day. Aside from this business, he is a breeder who raises four pigs.

loans.use: Hou would like to buy more food to feed her fish to sell and the rest of the group would like to improve their small businesses.

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đào Thị Vệ tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2003. Hiện tại chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con đã trưởng thành tại huyện Ninh Giang tỉnh Hải Dương. Hàng ngày ngoài chăn nuôi và trồng trọt  chị Vệ đi  buôn bán hoa quả tại chợ, chồng chị ở nhà đan cót bán cho người dân địa phương. Do chăm chỉ và biết cách làm ăn nên sau 5 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương hiện tại kinh tế gia đình chị Vệ đã có sự phát triển rõ rệt. Với mức thu nhập khá ổn định từ buôn bán, chăn nuôi  ngoài việc hoàn trả và chi tiêu trong gia đình chị Vệ còn đầu tư sửa sang  được nhà cửa, mua được xe máy phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh buôn bán của gia đình.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 6.000.000, một phần chị đầu tư mua 30 bó tre nứa phục vụ cho công việc đan cót của chồng, số còng lại chị sẽ sử dụng để đầu tư thêm vốn vào kinh doanh hoa quả phát triển kinh tế gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs. Dao Thi V. joined TYM Fund in 2003. She is living with her husband and her two grown-up children in Ninh Giang town, Hai Duong province. Mrs. V. breeds poultries and plants fruits at home, and then sells them in the market. Her husband makes baskets at home and sells them for people in the town. After fiV. years of membership, her family’s income has become much more stable. She has been able to renovate her house and buy motorbike to facilitate the family’s business. In the next round of loan, Mrs. V. would like to borrow 6.000.000 VND ($375), part of which will be used to buy bamboo for her husband to make baskets; the rest will be invested in flowers to sell in the market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort D. is married and has 2 children. She completed senior high school. Comfort sells pharmaceuticals at Abandze near Abura, which she has done since 1997. Her husband is a pharmacist. Comfort uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Comfort will use the loan to buy more, better-quality products to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to invest in their children's education.

loans.use: To buy more, better-quality products to sell.

loans.name: Thul's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thul P. is a group leader of four members who all live in Khnong village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Thul P. and her husband, Mr. Chhai Chhon, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn their living. In this plantation, they can gather only a little rice revenue which cannot support the family well. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Thul P. decided to ask for a loan to buy piece of land to cultivate to expand her rice revenue. Mrs. Thul P. is 37 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child four years old.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy piece of land to cultivate to expand her rice revenue.

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en:
Choeurn R. is 52 years old and is a rice farmer. Her husband is a village chief who earns a salary of $40 per month. Choeurn R. and her husband have eight children; four are married and no longer live at home, while two are employed as garment factory workers and two others are students.

Choeurn R. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a motorbike for her family’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma has been a firewood seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for the past 2 years. She belongs to the Hatuyumbishwi loan group (Group code 2025). She currently makes an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works for 14 hours.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and to save money for future use.

Fatma is 45 years old, divorced, and has six children: ages between 26 and 17.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Albertina L. se dedica a su negocio de venta de mecates y por no tener un establecimiento propio, vende en las afueras expuesta en ocasiones al sol y al trabajo duro.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los mecates ya que requiere adquirirlos lo más pronto posible para su venta. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y sale adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Chinandega, Albertina L. has a business selling rope. Because she does not have her own shop, she sells in exposed places outdoors, at times in the sun and working very hard.

Now she has turned to Ceprodel with the aim of receiving a loan for the purchase of rope, as she needs to obtain it as quickly as possible for its sale. She will benefit tremendously with this loan, and make progress in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of rope

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane M. is currently in the business of selling rice,dale and beans at the hotel and is requesting a loan to buy fans and a generator for the provision of fresh air in the hotel .  Jane is twenty-five years old. Her husband is employed as a nurse. She has two children and both of them go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, Jane hopes to be able to open up a supermarket.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy fans and a generator to provide fresh air in the hotel

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.ru: Юсуфчону 35 лет.Он женат и уже имеет 5-ро детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, нянчит детей и по мере возможности кормит скот. Юсуфчон занимается откормом и продажей скота. Начало весны для Юсуфчона – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что скот сейчас стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Юсуфчон не покупает для скота сено. Через 4 месяца наступает священный месяц Рамазан, и городские люди начинают покупать скот. Вот тогда, Юсуфчон продаст свой скот.
texts.en:
Yusufjon is 35 years old. He is married and already has 5 children. His wife does not have a job. She stays at home and takes care of the house, raises the children and feeds the livestock when she is able. Yusufjon fattens and sells livestock. The start of spring is the season for purchasing livestock for Yusufjon, because it is currently cheap. He also does not need to spend a lot to fatten the livestock. The livestock eats mountain grass and Yusufjon does not purchase hay for it. In 4 months starts the holy month of Ramadan and city residents start to purchase livestock. Then Yusufjon will sell his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Buvoisho

texts.en:
Buvoisho O., a married mother of four children, has for many years been involved in the cattle-raising business. This noble work that she inherited from her parents fills her with happiness and satisfaction, and thanks to the care and dedication she offers each one of her animals, they reproduce quickly. With the sale of the animals, she can better the economic situation of her family, and most importantly, offer the possibility of completing higher education to her children. Buvoisho and her husband, who also works in this business, wish to keep increasing their quantity and variety of animals to better their quality of life and secure their plans. Both are requesting a loan that will allow them to fulfill their objectives in a short time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more cattle in order to expand the business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
