Tabitha C. sells beans, green vegetables, and flour and is requesting a loan to stock more beans and flour to sell. She is 39 years old and married to a driver. Tabitha has three children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for the family to live in. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock more beans and flour to sell

loans.name: Maria Naid

texts.es: Maria Naid C. D. B. resiD. en La Herradura ubicado en departamento D. La Paz. Maria tiene 64 años D. edad, vive con su familia compuesta por su esposo, su nuera y una nieta. El esposo D. Maria trabaja D. pescador, obtiene ingresos mensuales D. 100$, es por ello que Maria busco otra manera para generar dinero ya que no eran suficientes lo ingresos D. su esposo y fue así como puso su negocio que es una tienda con productos D. primera necesidad. Maria solicita este crédito para surtir su tienda y así lograr mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Naid C. D. B. lives in the department of La Paz. She is 64 years old and lives with her family—her husband, daughter-in-law, and a granddaughter. Maria’s husband is a fisherman whose monthly income is $100.00. For this reason, Maria sought another way to make money because her husband’s salary was insufficient, so that is why she set up her general store in which she sells basic need items. Maria is requesting this loan to increase inventory, thus boosting sales.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Anna Ruby

texts.en: Anna Ruby R. is from the village of Labuyo, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Anna Ruby owns and operates a business providing dress-making services to local community members. Anna Ruby has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Anna Ruby joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Math A. is a widowed mother of fifty-two years who is blessed with four children: two are single and two are married and live separately.

Math A. is currently buying and selling used-goods to earn a living. One of her single children is assisting her in the business operation. At the moment, Math A. uses her wheelbarrow to serve as her business transportation. She proposes to use her loan money to buy a motorbike to connect to her existing cart. This new system will allow her to transport more used-goods more quickly. She and her daughter are pictured.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to connect to her existing cart

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en: Anthonia is 41 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living selling hair extensions and cream, and is also a hair stylist. She has been in this business since 1993 in Lagos, where she lives. She is very happy and grateful to Kiva for its financial help in these hard times. Anthonia has applied for a loan to buy more hair extensions and cream to sell, and thanks Kiva participants for their support.

loans.use: To buy more hair extension and cream to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sonia Caridad

texts.es: Sonia Caridad P. D. F. resiD. en la capital del país en unos D. los municipios más poblados Soyapango. Sonia tiene 46 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos uno D. ellos es empleado y el otro se encuentra estudiando en la universidad. Sonia se dedica a la venta D. productos D. perfumería, cremas corporales, zapatos entre otros; Sonia posee una clientela ya establecida y obtiene un buen margen D. ganancia. El crédito que solicita para invertirlo en productos nuevos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia Caridad P. D. F. lives in Soyapango, one of the most populated municipalities in the capital of the country. Sonia is 46. She lives with her husband and their two children. One of the children is employed, and the other is attending the university. Sonia sells perfume products, body creams, shoes, and other things. Sonia has an established customer base, and she has a good margin of earnings. The loan she is asking for is to buy new products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her inventory

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the KDC borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 39 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are aged 13,11,7, and 4 years old. She also cares for other 2 dependents.

Elizabeth has owned a tailoring business for 3 years. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Elizabeth`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Elizabeth hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more materilas

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick W. is 40 years old and married with three children. He has a poultry farm where he incubates chicks then sells to customers from the outskirts of Kinoo center, which is highly populated. He has never borrowed from another MFI and was introduced to KADET by a friend. He has applied for a loan which he wants to use to acquire incubators that will hold up to 1000 chicks at a time. He hopes to be a major supplier of chicks in the area and also to other big poultry firms.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy more chick incubators

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber in bulk

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en:
Ariel C. is from the village of Zone 1, Camarahan, Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 33 years old. Ariel is single. To make a living, Ariel makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling grilled meat such as chicken legs, chicken feet, chicken intestines, pork, chicken liver, etc. in the local community. Ariel has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ariel joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ariel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Ariel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S., 28, is married. She resides in Kandal Province, Cambodia with her husband. To make a living, she and her husband grow specific types of vegetables such as beans and salads to serve the market’s demand, earning collectively an income of US $10 per day. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. This primary source of income helps cover the household expenses. Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase construction materials to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the house

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is 49 years old. She has four kids who are currently in school. She trades in maize in the local market in her community. She requests a loan to enable her to buy more maize to grow her business and scale up sales. She says her major challenge is getting herself a container shop where she can sell her stock.  She hopes to increase her savings to acquire a shop.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk.

loans.name: Rosenne

texts.en: Rosenne has been doing tailoring for the last nine years. She makes dresses, tablecloths and also sells material. She is married and has two children. Her husband is also a businessman. Her customers are mostly ladies. Her major challenge is the seasonality in demand for clothes. She is borrowing KES 70,000 to restock her business with clothing and to buy a new sewing machine in preparation for the festive season. She is visionary and hardworking and wants to have a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Claudia Luz

texts.es:
La señora  Claudia Luz C. se dedica a la venta de verduras y carnes, esta actividad la realiza en un carrito estirado por un caballo, sale todas las mañanas bien temprano a repartir los productos, ya tiene su clientela  formada, con este trabajo mantiene  a sus 4 hijos, ella realiza este trabajo con su marido , Con este trabajo  dignifica a su familia, pues a todos sus hijos les ofrece estudio y un hogar donde vivir.
La misma se dedica a esta actividad hace bastante tiempo y para mejorar las condiciones de su trabajo recurrió a la Fundación ya que ella no cuenta con  garantías reales para poder acceder  un crédito y por eso agradece a la Fundación por la ayuda  que la misma le ha brindada.
texts.en:
Claudia Luz C. sells vegetables and meats from a horse-drawn cart. She goes out very early every morning to deliver her products to her regular customers. She does this work together with her husband. With their income, they maintain four children, and are able to offer them schooling and a place to live.

Claudia has been running this business for a good while and to improve her work conditions she turns to Fundación Paraguaya because she has no collateral for getting a loan. She is grateful for the help.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, peppers, lettuce, tomatoes, carrots, eggs, garlic, meat, apples, oranges, pineapples, grapes, mangos, etc.

loans.name: Vaivao

texts.en:
Vaivao T. is 30 and married with 3 children (ages 5 - 13years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Vaivao has 4 years of experience in this business.  Vaivao needs a loan of WST $750 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 110 tala or US $46 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Vaivao joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Vaivao's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Vaivao T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.5 out of 3

You can view pictures of a typical vegetable garden in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/VegetableGarden#

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Chan Thoeun

texts.en: Mrs. Chan Thoeun L. is 27 years old and she lives in Chong Angkar village, Takeo province. She lives with her spouse and they have two children, one of whom is a student in the local school; the younger child is 2 years old. Mrs. Chan Thoeun L. and her husband, Mr. Saem Soeun, are farmers who own 4-hectare field to cultivate rice on. In this farming, Mrs. Chan Thoeun L. needs 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy supplies for a pump, gasoline, fertilizer, and pesticide. She plans to use the rest of the loan to pay for laborers to dig a well to support the field. Aside from being a farmer, she is a scarf weaver who can earn a small income to support the family. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy supplies for a pump, gasoline, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Annick

texts.fr: Annick D. est âgée de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Depuis 4 ans elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Mboro et y a bénéficié de 8 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Elle fait un petit commerce tissus et d'effets de toilettes. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale et la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
Annick D. is 39 years old, she is married and the mother of 5 children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Mboro for the past 4 years and has received 8 loans from the organization, all of which were fully repaid on time. She has a small business selling cloth and toiletries. Her goal is to help her husband pay for the needs of their family and their children's tuition.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her business.

loans.name: Kalyskan Tagaeva`s Group

texts.en:
Kalyskan is 39 years old. She is divorced and has one son. He is a college student. She has been involved in a sewing business for more than 10 years. At present time, this is her main income of source. At the first stage, she rented a sewing machine. Later she had some savings and bought a sewing and overstitching machine. She mainly sews curtains and women's garments. She is asking for her first loan to buy sewing materials. 

Monuskan and Kalyskan are sisters. Monuskan, 37, is married with three children. Her husband is a foremaster. She is involved in animal breeding. She has cows, horses and sheep. This loan will be used to buy additional cattle. 

Kubatbek, 36, is married. His wife is a housewife and mainly looks after the animals. They have cows, horses and eight sheep. He wants a loan to buy five sheep. The increase in cattle will let her increase her overall family income. 

Zulayka is a widow. She has three sons. They always help their mother with the housework. She breeds animals. She started her business just two years ago with two sheep. Now she has three cows, two calves and two sheep. This is because of her hard work and enterprenurial skills. She hopes to increase the number of sheep, using this loan.
 
This is the first loan for all members of this group. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials

loans.name: Borhanudin Group

texts.en:
Husina is the group leader of the Borhanudin group. She is single and lives in district 11 in Kabul, Afghanistan. 
She lives in a household of five members and she is responsible for paying for the house rent and school fees of her sisters. 
She has a small tailoring business in her house and all her family members benefit through the income she generates.
She needs the loan to purchase a new machine, fabric and different kinds of needles and threads.
She hopes to expand her business and to open a shop instead of working in the house.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for her tailoring business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina C. is a young and hardworking mother of three children whose ages range from 6 to 9 years old. She has been a productive partner to her husband, who is a driver, by having her own businesses. She fattens hogs/pigs and has a “sari-sari” (variety) store. 

These businesses were put up and maintained through the loans she has accessed through ASHI, a Kiva partner. The proceeds of these businesses are a great source for providing her family, including her 68-year-old father and 25-year-old brother, with their basic needs. Though it is small, it is helping her and her family a lot. 

Despite poverty, Gina became hopeful that one day, she will be reaching her dreams by growing her business and having stable profits. With that, she is requesting another loan from ASHI to start another business, which is cattle fattening. Together with the hogs, the cattle will be sold either alive or slaughtered at the public market or to the people in their village.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for fattening

loans.name: Kabidolda

texts.en: Kabidolda is 62 years old and lives with his wife and son in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. His wife, Sameriy, is 58 years old and retired. His 27-year-old son, Asilbek, is an accountant in a local library. Currently, Kabidolda operates a transportation business with a microbus that he owns. He transports his customers to and from many different areas. Kabidolda has been operating his business since 2008 and operated a variety of businesses between 2000 and 2008. He received three loans so far from Xacbank. In his first loan, he did not pay his loan on time because his two children were students at that time and he had  to pay his two children's university fees. But he is a very open and enthusiastic person. Kabidolda says, “It would be great if I could sell my current car and purchase new car for my business.” He is requesting a 1,100,000 tugrug (~  785 USD) loan to purchase a new engine to change his broken down engine for his car.

loans.use: To purchase an engine

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkola, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Tiontala, sous préfecture de Massigui, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté et font le commerce de céréales et d’habits.
Ces femmes du groupe Benkola sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des céréales auprès des producteurs du  village  et environnants.  
Mariam Sidibé qui connaît le secteur du commerce de céréales dans lequel elle évolue depuis plusieurs années, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter,  trois sacs de 100kg des céréales. 
Elle s’approvisionne en céréales le plus généralement à Massigui et à Dioïla et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Massigui et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
All the women of the group Benkola are married and average 40 years of age and three children each. They live in traditional extended families in Tiontala, sub-prefecture of Massigui, Region of Koulikoro, in the 2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali.  They know one another though ties of community and kinship, and they work in the commerce of grains and clothing.  The women in the group are on their third solidarity loan, which will be used for buying grains from producers in and around the village.  Mariam Sidibé, who is familiar with the business of grains in which she has been working for several years, intends to use her loan for buying three 100-kg sacks of grain.  She stocks up for the most part in Massigui and in Dioïla, and she sells retail, locally at the market. And she accepts cash and credit from a customer base composed of women and men. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 300,000 francs CFA that will be used for covering day-to-day family expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in business. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying grains

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: Née en 1956 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Joséphine vit depuis vingt six ans environs à Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Joséphine est mariée à WATCHINOU Antoine et est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Joséphine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la famille. Joséphine n'a jamais été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Joséphine vend des condiments de sauce (oignons, piments, gingembre, légumes, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Joséphine vend du maïs. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au marché de Abattoir à Cotonou, que Joséphine achète ses produits. Joséphine a déjà quinze ans d'expérience dans l'exercice de son activité, et a déjà obtenu quatre prêts de ALIDé.Joséphine a bien effectué le remboursement de ces crédits. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Joséphine souhaite rehausser le niveau de son activité et mieux faire face à la demande des clients ; raison pour laquelle Joséphine sollicite un cinquième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Josephine K. has been living in Agabalilamè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, for 26 years. She is married to Antoine Watchinou and is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. Josephine lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes care of the family budget jointly. Josephine never attended school. In order to support herself, she sells condiments for sauces (onions, chili peppers, ginger, vegetables etc) out of her home. In addition, she also sells corn. She purchases her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin as well at the Butcher’s Market in Cotonou. She has 15 years of experience in this business, and had obtained four ALIDé loans in the past. Josephine has always repaid her loans properly. Facing the growing customer numbers, she would like to expand her business and better meet the demand, which is why she is seeking her fifth loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing condiments [for resale]

loans.name: Rosa Avelina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa D. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, vive en la parroquia el Valle comunidad el Despacho, en su mayor parte su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería pero los jóvenes han migrado a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

Nuestra socia tiene 44 años de vida, es una mujer viuda,  su esposo murió dominado por el alcohol, hace dos año, en su unión conyugal ha procreado 5 hijos los cuales tienen 22, 20, 18, 16, 15, años de edad, su hijo de 22 años trabaja como ayudante de albañil el cual le ayuda a su mamá económicamente, la hija de 20 años trabaja en un restaurante y  realiza sus estudios a distancia los días domingos; su hijo de 18 años luego de mucho luchar finalmente se ha graduado en el SECAP; el otro hijo de 16años por el momento está estudiando en el colegio; y finalmente su hija de 15 años trabaja como niñera y estudia los días sábados, toda esta familia vive en unos pequeños cuartos que han construido en los terrenos de su padre.

La señora Rosa trabaja en su casa realizando los quehaceres domésticos, también se dedica ala cría de cerdos y de aves domesticas. Es socia de nuestra institución por un periodo de 7 ciclos, y así ha podido  incrementar la cantidad de animales, para luego venderlos y así satisfacer sus necesidades diarias. Con el nuevo crédito que recibe por parte de la fundación ESPOIR lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y pollos. El sueño más deseado por nuestra socia es de tener una casita propia donde poder vivir con toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa D. is a member of the communal bank "Corazón de Jesús." She lives in the El Valle parish of the community of Despacho. There the majority of the population works in agriculture and livestock, but the younger ones have migrated to the city to look for better work opportunities. Rosa is 44 years old and is a widow. Her husband died 2 years ago of alcoholism. Their marriage produced 5 children, who are now 22, 20, 18, 16,and 15 years old. Her oldest son works as an mason's assistant, and helps his mother economically. Her 20 year old daughter works in a restaurant, and also is completing distance studies during each Sunday. Her 18 year-old son, after a long struggle, finally graduated from SECAP. The other son, who is 16, is currently studying in secondary school. Finally, her 15 year-old daughter works in child care and studies on Saturdays. The whole family lives in small rooms that were built on their father's lands. Rosa works in the home carrying out household chores, and she also raises pigs and poultry. She has been a member of our institution for 7 loan cycles, and in this way she has been able to increase the number of animals that she has, so that she can later sell them and support herself. With the new loan that she is receiving from the fundación ESPOIR, she will invest in the purchase of pigs and chicken. Her biggest dream is to have her own little house where she could live with her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria P., 55, is widow from the village of Antipolo, Dapitan City. She is 55 years old. Apolinaria has 11 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Apolinaria raises crops, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale.  Apolinaria has been in business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,900 PHP a month.

In 2008, Apolinaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Apolinaria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500 PHP from PMPC.  Apolinaria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living conditions. 

-------------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Hugo Orlando

texts.es:
Hugo de 36 años, vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil(zona urbana, su originalidad fue que habían muchas flores Orquídeas), el tiene una tienda de vivirse, vende todo tipos de alimentos como arroz, cereales, bebidas etc. 

Antes de tener su tienda el tuvo un puesto de comida de “fritadas” (comida típica del Ecuador, con chancho, mote y cebollas). Con unos ahorros que el tenia decidio comprar unos víveres y venderlos para pasar mas tiempo con sus dos hijos, por esa buena decisión ahora tiene una tienda de víveres, trabaja desde las 05h30ma hasta las 22h00pm todos los días.     

Para poder tener mas ingresos en su casa el quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, bebidas, enlatados para su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener un local de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Hugo is 36 years old and lives in Orquídeas de Guayaquil, an urban area where many orchids once grew. He has a general store where he sells all types of food such as rice, cereals, beverages, and other items.

Prior to having his store, Hugo operated a food stand where he sold “fritadas” (a traditional Ecuadorian dish made of pork, corn, and onions). Using his savings, he decided to buy a few provisions to sell so that he could spend more time with his two children. This turned out to be a good decision because he now has his own store where he works every day from 5:30am to 10pm.

In order to generate more household income he wants to use this loan to buy rice, beverages, and canned goods for his store. In the future he wants to open a fast food shop.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beverages, and canned goods

loans.name: Havila Group

texts.es:
El grupo Havilas lo conforman Yahoska M., Olga R. y Ana María C. tres féminas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es M. comerciante de ropa usada y nueva negocio que inicio hace dos años.
Las otras integrantes Olga R. comercializa cosméticos de distintas marcas y Ana María C. tiene una pequeña fritanga restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita y vende ropa.
texts.en:
The "Havilas" group is formed by Yahoska M., Olga R. and Ana María C., three dedicated, hardworking and enterprising women. The coordinator is M., who sells new and used clothing, a business that she started 2 years ago. The other members are Olga R., who sells a variety of brands of cosmetics, and Ana Maria C., who has a small restaurant where she sells fried food and also sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina A. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 54 years-old and married with three adult children. To make a living, Edwina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Edwina has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Edwina joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edwina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Edwina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mr. Moeun Kruoch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. Moeun K., 53, is married with four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory while the others are laborers. His wife, Mrs. Saroum Hun, is employed by a private company. Moeun is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land upon which he cultivates rice to sell. He also raises pigs. The family lives in Prey Chheu Teal village in Takeo province.

Moeun was selected as the village’s bank president by its other twenty-four members who will use their portions of the loan for different purposes. Moeun’s problem is that his field is not fertile. To improve his production, he is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and to hire both a plowing machine and farm laborers. With the rest of the loan he will buy more piglets.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire a plowing machine and laborers

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeurn S. is 30 years old, married, and has two children who attend the local public school. She owns a small shop in her village where she sells food and fruits to her nearby neighbors. She typically makes around $4 profit each day to meet her family's needs. Her husband works as a porter in the busy market.
Oeurn S. normally hires a motor taxi to travel to and from the market where she buys items for her business. She hopes to have a vehicle, which will allow her to travel without hiring taxis. To achieve her goal, Oeurn S. is requesting a loan to purchase a used motorbike. Any remaining cash from the loan will be used to increase her capital.

loans.use: To purchase a used motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying inventory for food market sales

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

La señora Carmen es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de cumplir y los intereses son muy bajos. Ella tiene 62 años de edad, esta separada hace varios años y de esta relación tuvo 6 hijos ya todos mayores de edad y solo uno de ellos vive con ella.

Tiene un comedor en el centro, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 5am hasta las 14h00 y los sábados y domingos desde las 4am hasta las 20h00, trabaja con la ayuda de su hijo, dice que la gente la prefiere ya que cocina delicioso y por eso tiene muchos clientes, su especialidad es el pescado hornado.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar materiales para la preparación de sus deliciosos platos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un local mas amplio y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The community bank Health and Life meets every two weeks in the city of Charapoto.  This town is known for its traditional culture and also for being a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province such as San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Ms. Carmen is a founding member of the community bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make and the interest rates are very low. She is 62 years old and has been separated for several years.  From this relationship she had 6 children.  All are adults now and only one of them lives with her.

She has a restaurant downtown and works Monday through Friday from 5:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. and on Saturdays and Sundays from 4:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m.  She works with the help of her son. She says that people prefer her because of her delicious cooking and that is why she has many clients. Her specialty is baked fish. 

She will use this loan to purchase materials to prepare her delicious dishes. 
 
Her dream is to have a larger location and to continue working.

loans.use: Purchase fish, rice, potatoes, yucca, etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia tiene 48 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 23 años posee una tienda de abarrotes, hace mucho años empezó en el negocio vendiendo de manera ambulante, pero hoy tiene un puesto de ventas dentro de un mercado cerca de su casa. Es así que atiende todas las mañanas a sus clientes y algunas horas después del almuerzo. Ella siempre esta pendiente de su negocio, por tanto procura mantenerla surtida de productos, eso hace que su negocio tenga estabilidad, permitiéndole a la vez sostener a su familia y no descuidar a sus hijos. Por el momento desea seguir trabajando en su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería. Es su crédito número 14 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita, puesto que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería ya que se acercan  fechas importantes donde sus ventas aumentarán.
texts.en: Antonia is 48 years old and lives with her three children in their own home. For the last 23 years she has had a grocery store. Many years ago she started the business with travelling sales, but today she has a store in a market near her house.  This is how she tends to her customers every morning and for a few hours after lunch.  She is devoted to her business, so she manages to keep it stocked with products, which makes her business stable, allowing her to both support her family and not neglect her children. For the moment, she wants to keep working in her business acquiring more merchandise. This is her 14th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has a financial support. In addition, she is grateful to be part of her communal bank, because all its members are responsible people and very supportive. She is also grateful to all the people that will fund the loan she is seeking, since it will be very useful in the further development of her business. She will invest the requested loan in the purchase of more merchandise, since important dates are coming up during which her sales will increase.

loans.use: To stock up on basic products

loans.name: Edidt

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Edidt; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de muebles, ella hace diferentes tipos de muebles como mesas, sillas, camas y después lo vende en la feria de muebles que se llama mercamueble, ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Edidt is a member of the Communal Bank “Mercamueble”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 33 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children. Edidt divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling furniture. She makes different types of furniture such as tables, chairs, and beds and then sells them at the furniture fair called “Mercamueble”. Yolanda works from 8am to 6pm. She wants to improve her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy wood in bulk.

Edidt is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase wood in bulk

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Баротов Курбонали проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 40 лет. Женат. Имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Более 8 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: B. Kurbonali lives in the Vose region. He's forty years old, married and has four children. He has a high school level of education and has bred cattle for over eight years. Generally, he fattens the cattle and then sells it for profit. He's asking for a loan to acquire some more cattle.

loans.use: To buy some cattle

loans.name: John Nganga

texts.en:
John Nganga M. is a 42-year-old businessman. He is married to Elizabeth, and they are blessed with two children. He is in the transport business and has owned a retail shop for the last six years. This will be his fifth loan from KADET.  

With his loan, he plans to purchase beans, rice, maize, and sugar. He will direct the anticipated profits into the expansion of his business.  John’s dream is to expand his transport business through the addition of more motorbikes.

loans.use: To purchase beans, rice, maize, and sugar

loans.name: Miriam Margot

texts.es:
Miriam es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, un distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de sus clientes concentrados en zonas rurales que distan mucho entre sí, sus principales actividades económicas son la agricultura y el comercio, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a la venta de prendas de vestir. Ella vende uniformes, buzos, zapatos y ropa en general a sus clientes, Miriam ofrece sus productos de acuerdo a la temporada del año y adquiere su mercadería en las tiendas confeccionadoras de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Gracias al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad, Miriam ha llegado a tener clientes fieles que a su vez han promocionado su negocio, lo que ha generado que cuente con una clientela estable. Actualmente desea adquirir capital para empezar a solicitar sus pedidos en las tiendas de Chiclayo y surtir su negocio con más mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente  solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Miriam ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla, en aquella oportunidad ella pudo ampliar su negocio adquiriendo mercadería para la temporada escolar, lo cual le generó bastantes ingresos con los cuales su familia pudo salir adelante, ella se encuentra contenta y  agradece a todas las personas que le ayudaron a sacar adelante a su negocio.
texts.en:
Miriam is a mother, she is 44 years old and she lives together with her family in the district of Olmos. The region is known for its population that mostly resides in rural areas with great distances between them. The main businesses are agriculture and commerce and the region belongs to the province of Lambayeque. It is one hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

For the past three years she has been selling clothing. She sells uniforms, sweaters, shoes, and general clothing items to her clients. Miriam sells clothing that is appropriate for the season. She acquires her merchandise from stores in the city of Chiclayo. 

Miriam has had a Kiva loan in the past through Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) and its allied company Capital Semilla.  With the help of the first loan she was able to expand her business with the acquisition of merchandise in time for the new school year. This generated substantial earnings and it was of great benefit to her family. She is very happy and she is grateful to all those individuals that have helped her turn her business into a success.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE ETERNO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria D. Carmen; La socia tiene 53 años de edad, es casada; la socia tiene 3 hijos, las socia trabaja en su librería cristiana, ella elabora también manualmente todo tipo de arte con motivo de la religión cristiana y empastan libros y canticos, la socia apertura hace muy poco su librería y está muy eiz de haberlo logrado a su edad, según ella manifiesta, la socia ahora solicita el préstamo para poder implementar su librería con los últimos acabados que siempre se requiere y la adquisición de libros que le están enviando de la capital. La socia solicita el préstamo para la adquisición de libros cristianos para implementar su librería.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
María D. Carmen, 53, is a member of the “PADRE ETERNO" (Eternal Father) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco department.

She is married and has three children.  She works in her Christian bookstore and also does Christian-themed religious crafts and binds books and hymnals.  She opened her bookstore a short while ago and is very happy to have done so at her age, as she states.

She now needs a loan to do the final finishing touches to the bookstore and to stock her store with books that are being sent to her from the capital. She is requesting a loan to acquire Christian books to stock her bookstore.

She is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy Christian books to stock her bookstore.

loans.name: Tahmina's Group

texts.en:
Tahmina D. is the leader of this group. She is 28 and married. Her husband works as an electrician. Together they bring up two sons and  both sons are preschool age (under seven). Tahmina works as a chief specialist in the Regional Department. Two years ago with the initial investment of 20000 soms the family started to breed livestock.  By reselling livestock after fattening they earn additional 2000 soms per month. Tahmina applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase furniture in order to improve the family’s living conditions.

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff

loans.use: to purchase furniture

loans.name: Reyna Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Reyna Cecilia tiene 46 años, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Ella brinda negocio de transporte, tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, sin embargo fue con el tiempo que logro obtener su taxi propio, con los ahorros que obtuvo, lo cual le ha brindado una mayor estabilidad económica ya que ahora las ganancias son para pagos y gastos de su familia. el crédito que está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de realizar unas compras de artículos para el vehículo, ya que necesita algunas reparaciones. Actualmente, al igual que todo el sector transporte está enfrentando el desafío de mantener los precios y las ganancias, pese a la alta inestabilidad del combustible, lo cual hace que cada día sea más cara la canasta básica y todos los artículos.
texts.en: Señora Reyna Cecilia is 46 years old and she has two adult children. Reyna has a transportation business and she has ten years of experience. Without a doubt, it took time to save enough so that she could own her own taxi, now her savings have helped her to establish greater economic stability and now she has the ability to cover payments and family expenses. The loan that Reyna is seeking is to buy a part for her taxi as the car already needs repair. In reality, the entire transportation sector is facing the challanges of maintaining profits with the instability of fuel prices, which are more expensive every for even the lowest grade.

loans.use: Working capital: auto parts

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  a sari-sari (general) store and copra. She lives in the municipality of Brooke's Point, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store and copra businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 12,500. Elvira is now borrowing PHP 13,000 so that she could purchase more stock. This will be her 23rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elvira aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business and buy more seeds for his land

loans.name: Estrellieta

texts.en:
Estrellieta C. is from the village of Sta.Cruz, Jimenz, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Estrellieta is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Estrellieta owns & operates a general store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Estrellieta has been engaged in her business for over 43 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Estrellieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estrellieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Estrellieta is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase rice and corn grits to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Estrellieta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn grits to sell

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a Transportation (Tricycle) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy tricycle spare parts for her transportation (Tricycle) business.

Janeth has been in this business for five years. Janeth earns more income buying and selling mahogany seeds.

Janeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy tricycle spare parts

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a young man from Deir Al Balah in the Gaza Strip. Saleh is a barber who works in his father's shop as his father is old and can't work anymore. Saleh's income must also cover the parents' household expenses.

Saleh took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a new shaving kit, creams, towels and hygienic items that are necessary and will help him offer better service to customers.

Saleh appears in his shop with one of the customers.

loans.use: to purchase shaving kit, towels and other needed items.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Concepción, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, es agricultor, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 6 años de edad, él trabaja desde hace 10 años en las actividades agrícolas, todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm.
Actualmente necesita un préstamo el cual invertirá en abono y fertilizantes, el préstamo le ayudara a asegurarse con todos los insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y frijol.
Él tiene como objetivo cada años mejorar sus cultivos, trabajar por recibir buenas cosechas y de esta manera sacar adelante a su hijo en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Concepción lives in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel Department.  He’s a farmer living with his wife and 6-year-old son.  He’s worked in farming for the last ten years every day from 6am until 3pm.

He needs a loan to buy manure and fertilizer.  With the loan he will be sure to have all the necessary supplies for his corn and bean crops.

His ultimate goal yearly is to improve his crops, to work towards attaining good harvests in order to support the family and help his son with his schooling.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Elsa works hard to support her family. 

She has a shell crafting business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling tropical fish. Elsa is borrowing 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy materials for her shell crafting business. 

Elsa has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her shell crafting business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and is a married woman with 3 children. The oldest child is 25 years old. 

Josephine is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del sur. She has been growing rice for 10 years. She also owns and manages a sari-sari store. She sells various items like soap and shampoo. Josephine earns 15,000 PHP per month from her businesses.

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to lift her family from the difficulties of life.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two school-age children. He has been working in the jewelry industry for more than 10 years. He works from his house. His work is specialized in producing jewelry, polishing them, and fixing the wrecked ones. He is well known for his high quality, handmade jewelry. His wife also works to support the family. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1300 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional jewelry products. He is sure that the loan will help him increase his profits by a significant percentage.

loans.use: to purchase additional jewelry products.

loans.name: Jorge Raul

texts.es: Jorge nació en la ciudad de Arequipa (Perú) y tiene 38 años de edad. Actualmente, Jorge vive en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Jorge tiene su taller donde confecciona de chompas de lana de alpaca. Ya son tres años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Jorge  requiere el préstamo para comprar fibra de alpaca.  El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Jorge was born in the city of Arequipa (Peru) and is 38 years old.  He now lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Jorge has a workshop where he makes sweaters from alpaca wool.  He has had this business for 3 years and it is going very well, thanks to the effort that he puts into his work.  At this time, Jorge needs a loan to buy alpaca fiber.  Jorge is a responsible and hardworking person; because of these qualities, his friends invited him to participate in the communal bank "Chaska Ñawi” in the Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy alpaca fiber

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is 41 years old, married and has six children. Her eldest son left his education after 10th and started working in a factory. Her second son also works in a factory. Her third and youngest sons are able to continue their education. 

Her husband operates a plant-selling business. He is very fair in his prices and deals with his clients in a professional manner. He has good number of business contacts and meets their requirements. 

Razia is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities very well. Part time, she also sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very good at her work and receives a good number of orders every month.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s plant selling business. With the loan, he will buy plants of different kinds that will allow him to make more sales and earn better profits. 

He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and Razia hopes that an investment will bring very good changes to his business and improve the life style of her family.

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Razia.

loans.use: To buy plants to sell

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 47 years old and lives in Paynesville. She attended school, attaining 11th grade. She is married and her husband is a teacher. They have four children two of whom live at home and attend school. Musu sells dried goods, mainly foodstuffs and charcoal, from a table in the market. Her main difficulty is keeping the business going when school fees and other expenses use up all her cash. She learnt this business from her mother and is proud to run her own business. She’s requesting a loan to ensure that she always has stock for her business. In the future, she wants to complete the children’s education and buy them a house.

loans.use: to ensure that she always has stock for her business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina, a 59-year-old resident of the Philippines, is married and has four children.  For the past five years, Catalina has had a food shop that sells banana cakes, and she is now requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. A new member of HSPFI, she  hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 37 years old, married and blessed with three children fourteen, seven and five years old. She buys and sells secondhand clothes, earning a monthly income of 8,000 KES. She has been in business over the past five years.

Lucy is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES, her third, to boost her business. She will use this loan to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes to sell. With the anticipated profits, she will increase the level of inventory in her business.

Lucy hopes to educate her children to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana María, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes pues tiene una tienda. El crédito lo requiere para aumento de capital y comprar  arroz, fideo y conservas para surtir la tienda y ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos a su clientela. Esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en  casa propia la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de  Alto Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ana Maria ya accedió a un crédito el año 2010 y ahora será la primera vez que requiere que Kiva ayude para conseguir el fondeo necesario.
texts.en: Ana María sells groceries because she has a store.  She needs the loan to increase capital and buy rice, noodles and canned goods to stock the store and have a wider variety available for her customers.  This activity is the source of income she has to cover her expenses.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Alto Irpavi zone.  She’s married and has a son.  Ana María already had a loan in 2010 and now this will be the first time she needs Kiva’s help to get the necessary funding.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Roxana Marínela

texts.es: Roxana Marínela D. cuarenta y tres años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en su humilD. casa que con mucho esfuerzo es propia en zona urbana y cercana a la capital del país. Ella se dedica a la venta D. platos plásticos, frutas y verduras frescas en su misma casa, es muy  conocida en el lugar donD. resiD. y se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan con producto D. muy buena calidad y a precios increiblemente accesibles; Roxana es una mujer decidida que le gusta el trabajo y mira la vida como la oportunidad D. invertir cada día,  es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar platos plásticos, tomates, ajos, cebollas, chiles, guineos y fruta D. temporada a fin D. incrementar su inventario o suplir productos que sus clientes últimamente demandan y por falta D. recurso propio no ha podido comprar. Roxana Marínela tiene la esperanza que así tendrá la oportunidad D. llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y forjar un mejor futuro para su querida familia.
texts.en:
43-year old Roxana Marínela lives with her husband and children in a simple house they worked hard to buy. It is located in a suburb near the capital city. Roxana earns her living selling plastic items as well as fresh fruit and vegetables from her home. She is well known in the area and has many customers because she always has what they want. The products are of good quality and a fair price. 

Roxana is a determined woman who enjoys work. She sees life as a daily opportunity to be seized, and for this reason she is seeking a loan from INTEGRAL to buy plastic dishes, tomatoes, garlic, onions, chiles, guineos (green bananas), and whatever fruit is in season. These purchases will allow her to increase her stock and proviD. what her customers have recently been asking for. She hasn't been able to afford to buy them herself.

Roxana hopes that the loan will give her the opportunity to proviD. a steady income and a better future for her beloved family.

loans.use: to buy plastic dishes, tomatoes, garlic, onions, chiles, mangos etc.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking mother who owns and manages a variety store to supplement her husband's income. She is now 50 years old and has two school-age children. Due to high cost of school fees and transportation, they need to earn more income to satisfy their needs and finance the education of their children. She aims to improve her variety store to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' needs.

Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, snackk foods, eggs, soaps and seasonings to sell in her variety store. She mentioned that this will be a great help for her to improve the business. She hopes that through her patience and sacrifices, she will make the business a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, snack foods, eggs, soaps and seasonings to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: Luis Alfonso de 30 años, el posee una panadería el era estudiante pero no pudo t conseguir un empleo entonces opto por establecer este negocio se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues el pan que comercia es de muy buena calidad, muy rico y con precio realmente accesible además el servicio es excelente, Luis es un hombre muy entusiasta con ganas de salir adelante siempre está con la mejor disposición de trabajar. El crédito es para la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla, queso, entre otros.
texts.en: Luis Alfonso, 30, has a bakery.  He was a student but was unable to find work so he opted to open this business.  He’s acquired quite a few customers because the bread he sells is very good quality, very delicious and priced quite affordably; besides service is excellent.  Luis is a very enthusiastic man with a strong drive to get ahead.  He’s always well-disposed to work.  The loan is to buy flour, eggs, butter and cheese, among others.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, butter and cheese, among others.

loans.name: Fredick

texts.en: Fredick is a Kenyan man married with two children who are 2 and 10 years old. His wife is a housewife. He runs a business making and selling pans, metal boxes and charcoal banners. His business is located downtown of the city. His customers come from within and outside of Nairobi. He says the business is good and the major challenge he has is insufficient funds. He is using his loan of KES 40,000 to add stock of scrap metal to grow his business. His future desire is to own several business. He is determined and hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap metal

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, a jolly 38-year-old married mother of two school-age children, has been patiently selling fruits and vegetables in her neighborhood, offering squash, eggplant and tomatoes on a house-to-house basis for a year now. Though the work is tiresome, she is very determined to acquire profits.

Now requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy more eggplant, cabbages, tomatoes and onions to sell, Vilma wants to improve her sales and earn more profits for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy eggplant, cabbages, tomatoes and onions to sell.

loans.name: Roselinda

texts.en:
Roselinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines.

Roselinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.

She has been in this business for 3 years.

Roselinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Siempre Viva Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Siempre Viva” esta conformado por 10 integrantes de los cuales dos son hambre y las restantes son 8 mujeres todos los integrantes del grupo son responsables y muy trabajadores, El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque se consideran personas muy trabajadoras en sus respectivas actividades que realizan cada uno de ellos, “Somos personas que nos sentimos vivas, muy agiles y con muchas de salir de adelante.
Doña Angelina que es la representante del grupo tiene 27 años de edad esta casada con el señor José desde hace 10 años juntos han procreado tres hijos José Manuel de 10 años quien cursa el quinto año de primaria, Ángel Eduardo, de 9años de primaria esta en cuarto grado y Gabriel de 3 años quien aun no estudia. 
La señora Angelina tiene una tienda de abarrotes quien el cual tiene por nombre “miscelánea Dieguito” en ella ha trabajado desde hace 9 años solo que en negocio lo inicio en la ciudad ahora lleva tres años con ella en la comunidad, esta vez ha solicitado el crédito para invertir en su tienda compra lo que mas le hace falta como productos enlatados, azúcar, leche, huevo, pan, lo que mas le hace falta son alimentos, lo que mas consume la gente.
Cometa que su único problema es que tienen demasiada competencia por todos lados y por lo mismo sus ventas no pueden aumentar, sin embargo esta segura que con el crédito le ayudara a tener un mejor precio para ofrecérselos a sus clientes ya que las personas buscan el mejor precio con la mejor calidad, así si ella da los precios mas bajos su clientela aumentara.
Una de sus metas es que su tienda de abarrotes este bien surtida y por su puesto beneficiar a toda la comunidad con los precios bajos.
Así como doña Angelina invertirá en la tienda de abarrotes los integrantes invertirán en otras actividades, Carlos en un ciber café, Guadalupe en Herbalife (tés), María, Estephani, Edith y Horalia invertirán en animales como borregos, pollos, cerdos  y guajolotes, Rosa María en una tienda chica, Rubén en cocina, Catalina en ropa. “Todos estamos muy contentos y agradecidos por el préstamo que nos han otorgado ya que nos ayudara a mejorar nuestra calidad de vida y también para nuestras familias”
texts.en:
Thte “Siempre Viva” [Always Live] group is made up of 10 members, two of whom are men and 8 of whom are women. All the group members are responsible and very hardworking. They chose the name of the group because they consider themselves to be very hardworking in their different activities. "We are people who feel alive, very agile, and who really want to get ahead."  

Angelina, who is the group representative, is 27 years old and has been married to Jose for 10 years. They have three children, José Manuel, 10, who is in fifth grade, Ángel Eduardo, 9, who is in fourth grade, and Gabriel, 3, who isn't in school yet. 

Angelina ha a grocery store named “Miscelánea Dieguito”. She has worked there for 9 years. She started it in the city and and has had it in the community now for three years. She is asking for the loan this time to invest in her store and buy what she needs the most, such as canned goods, sugar, milk, eggs, bread. What she needs the most is food, what people consume the most.   

She remarks that her only problem is that she has too much competition everywhere and because of this her sales can't go up. Nonetheless, she is sure that the loan will help her to have better prices to offer her customers since people always look for the best price with the best quality. So if she gives her customers lower prices her clientele will grow. 

One of her goals is to have her grocery store well stocked and off course benefit the whole community with the low prices. 
Angelina will invest in the grocery store and the other members will invest in other activities. Carlos in an internet cafe, Guadalupe in Herbalife (teas), María, Estephani, Edith and Horalia will invest in animals such as sheep, chickens, pigs and turkeys. Rosa Maria will invest in in a small store, Rubin in a stove, Catalina in clothes. “We are all very happy and grateful for the loan they have given us, since it will help us to improve our quality of life and also that of our families."

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, sugar, eggs and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and fuel wood for resale.

loans.name: Nimol

texts.en:
Nimol, 40, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a business of carrying clothes to sell around the village for over two years and is successful in her career. Her husband is a wood trader. One of her children is a construction worker.

In order to improve her business, Nimol is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for carrying her clothes to sell. In the future, she would like to expand her business and support her children's studies until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for carrying her clothes to sell

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad works hard to support four children. She is married and has a buy-and-sell livestock business in the Philippines.

Trinidad requested a PHP 1,800 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light, in case of emergency.

Trinidad is aware that, by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Ella es Fabiola tiene 24 años de edad, está estudiando Enfermería en la Institución Campo Alto, ella vive con la hermana, el cuñado y el sobrino en una situación un poco difícil, la hermana trabaja por días en casas de familia, el cuñado trabaja en celaduría y Fabiola trabaja como aseadora cuyo contrato es por servicios y el sueldo depende de lo que ella haga. 
En la casa colabora mensualmente para los gastos de la hermana, para el pago del arriendo y aparte compra la comida, paga loss servicios y los transportes. Debido a esta cantidad de gastos muchas veces solo le queda para pagar la mensualidad del estudio e incluso no logra pagarla completamente. 
Por otra parte como la hermana y el cuñado no tiene trabajos que les generen grandes ingresos  es difícil hacerle prestamos, por estos motivos ella necesita la ayuda que ofrece KIVA, porque muchas veces lo que gana no le alcanza para cancelar la cuota mensual que paga en Campo Alto y por eso debe hacer trabajo extra o prestamos independientes para conseguir completar la cuota, incluso ya hace un año debió aplazar el estudio, pero sigue buscando la manera de continuarlo, ya que el siguiente semestre, si continua estudiando, podrá empezar las prácticas.
texts.en:
This is Fabiola, age 24. She is studying Nursing at CampoAlto. Fabiola lives with her sister, brother-in-law, and a nephew in a bit of a difficult situation. Her sister works during the day at the houses of other families, her brother-in-law works at a security guard station, and Fabiola works as a housekeeper who contracts out her services. Her salary is dependent on each job.

At home Fabiola contributes each month toward her sister’s expenses, the rent payment, buying food, utility services, and transportation. Due to these numerous expenses, there have been several months in which the only thing left she can pay is her monthly tuition. Sometimes she hasn’t been able to pay anything at all.

Since her sister and brother-in-law do not have jobs that earn a lot of money, it has been difficult for her to obtain loans. For this reason, she needs the help that Kiva offers. Many times she has not been able to cover her monthly tuition payment to CampoAlto, so she has had to find extra work or seek private loans on her own in order to pay the bill. A year ago Fabiola had to postpone her studies, but she continues to look for ways to continue her education. She hopes to resume her studies the following semester so that she can begin her practicums.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Dúo Neftalí Group

texts.es: Dúo Neftalí La líder de este dúo es la señora Guadalupe, ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas ponedoras y a la venta de huevos.  Este es el tercer crédito que ella solicita a FAPE y KIVA  al principio de su negocio  ella se dedicaba a criar pollos, luego los vendía por libra.  Ella cuenta que  invertía más tiempo y recursos en los pollos,  por lo que decidió mejor comprar gallinas ponedoras a la cuales cuida y aprovecha la producción de huevos. Ya cuenta con dos años de experiencia en su negocio  y ya tiene buen número de  clientes a los que les entrega los huevos por cartón.  Ella solicita el crédito para comprar otras gallinas ponedoras ya que la producción de huevos ha bajado y ella no le quiere quedar mal a sus clientes a quienes surte los huevos.  La señora Guadalupe es una mujer trabajadora y cuenta que su meta es que su negocio crezca, ella tiene dos hijos uno de 21 y 23 años que aun que ellos ya son independientes ella trabaja para poder tener su casa propia, ya que actualmente alquila.

loans.use: Compra de gallinas ponedoras.

loans.name: Nasima

texts.en:
Nasima is 35 years old and a mother of 6 children, living in District 2, Kabul, Afghanistan.

It is almost 3 years that she has been working in her shop baking bread and selling to the bazaar 

She hopes to receive a loan through AFSG so she can buy wood and flour and find good income through this business.

loans.use: To buy wood and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase building materials and hire laborers for his rental houses business

loans.name: Zainura

texts.en: H.  Zainura owns and works in her shop, which located in the center of the Avganbasaar market.  She is married and has 4 children.  In 1992, she supplied shops with her goods from Uzbekistan, Iran.  Her husband is a doctor, and he helped to organize a place for trade so that she could start her own business in 2002.  She started her business with a loan provided by Micro Invest.  She is an active client of this organization.  Today she is an independent and experienced businesswoman.  Her little shop became one of the best known shops in the area, and is very deserving of her clients' trust.  The diversity of her goods attracts new clients who leave satisfied with the goods they have purchased from her.
