She is planning to use the next loan for the purchase of goods from Tashkent, Usbekistan to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: Purchase goods from Tashkent, Usbekistan

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim K. is a taxi driver in the northeastern Azerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Rasim has been driving a taxi for a few years now and is married, with one child. This will be Rasim’s first loan with Normicro. He has been approved for a loan of $575.00 with which he plans to purchase new tires for this taxi as well as some minor repairs for his vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase tires and to make other minor repairs to his taxi.

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en: Etevise is 32-years-old, married, and has six children. Her parents have had a vegetable garden for ages, and now Etevise has taken over. Her husband is a very hard-working man, and he has been working on the garden for a long time. Through years of hard work, they have managed to improve their family life. Etevise is thankful for the financial support from SPBD, especially since her husband is unemployed and their six children need looking after. She sells enough every week to make a profit, and she is planning to buy a car to use in delivering her vegetables, not only to the market but to the village as well.

loans.use: To buy a back sprayer, fertilizers, gromoxone chemical (weed killer), knives, and a spade for her garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more khat stock.

loans.name: Muava

texts.en: Muava is a mother of 3 from the big island of Savaii and is married to a business man from Matautu Falealili. She joined the program in 2005 when she needed help for her business. She is now applying for another loan to help buying more inventory for her shop and to pay her children school fees.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Kuña Kyre´ÿ Group

texts.en:
In the city of Yaguarón, a little more than nine miles from the main city Paraguarí, there is a group of 18 women who have come together to ask for a loan. They have lucrative businesses selling everyday goods like food and house supplies.

Together they have formed a support group and depend on one another to help repay the loans that are given to them. The group has taken on the name Kuña Kyre´ÿ; the name is in the second official language of Paraguay – Guaraní. It means “Active Woman”. All of these women have excellent qualifications and have formed an even greater system where each woman relies on the others to be accountable to repaying her loan. Together they bring different skills, businesses and specializations ranging from hairdressing to specializing in meats and breads.

loans.use: The loan will be invested in buying goods such as fabric, thread, meat, drinks, milk, cooking oil, pasta, rice, flour, baking power, beauty shop supplies, hair accessories, cleaning products and feed for cattle

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Hồng - Cụm Vọng Nguyệt Xã Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs Hồng, group leader, is 31 years old. She has 3 children who are still in school.She supplies construction material to local consumers. Her husband is a truck driver. Her family income is 6.25 USD a day. She request this loan to buy bricks.
Mrs Bảo will use the loan to buy pork.
Mrs Loan will use the loan to buy pig mash.
Mrs Oanh will use the loan to stock her grocery store.
Mrs Tiền will use the loan to buy waste metal to resell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunterr.

Chị Hồng 31 tuổi, có 3 con đang đi học. Chị làm nghề chở vật liệu xây dựng cho các gia đình trong địa phương. Chồng chị lái xe chở vật liệu. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị khoảng 100000 đồng/ngày. Chị vay vốn để mua thêm gạch.
Chị Bảo vay vốn để thêm vốn bán thực phẩm (thịt lợn).
Chị Loan vay để mua thức ăn cho lợn.
Chị Oanh vay vốn để bán hàng tạp hoá.
Cô Tiền vay để đi chợ sắt.

loans.use: to buy bricks, pork, pig mash, grocery, waste metal

loans.name: Lelis

texts.en:
Lelis P. F. runs a general store near the city of Pucallpa, Ucayali. There she sells goods that are popular with her neighbors and purchased daily. Lelis has a well-placed central location in her neighborhood. Her many loyal clients enjoy purchasing their everyday goods from her instead of traveling a longer distance to the main market.

Lelis is a mother of 3 and is happily married. She is proud of her business. Now Lelis has greater independence and doesn’t need to ask her husband when she wants to buy something for herself or her children. Lelis will continue to save and invest in her store and the children’s future.

A member of the community bank Las Lumbreras, Lelis is requesting a loan of s/1200 to repay over 6 months. She will use the loan to restock her store with rice, sugar, salt, oil, eggs, beer, and sodas.

loans.use: To restock a general store

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 32 years old and the single mother of a unique school-going 12-year-old son.  After her husband left, Joseline had to quickly find a way to survive and take care of her son, so she started a small business selling perfumes, shoes, silver jewels and other goods.  In a few years, she hopes she will have earned sufficient money to rent or buy a small shop.
With her loan of $175, this entrepreneur will purchase more goods to add to her stock, her goal being to maintain a comfortable life for her son.

loans.use: To acquire perfumes, jewels and shoes for a small business.

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.es:
Raymunda sells different American products and vitamins with the namebrand FOREVER. This is a namebrand with products such as pills, vitamins, lotions and beauty products. The selling is done through catalogs. A friend told Raymunda about this business, and this is how she began to attend meetings to learn how to sell these products.

Raymundo has been a FOREVER distributor for the past 3 years and says that she makes pretty good commissions. She also takes care of ill people since she's also a geriatric nurse. With the previous loans, Raymunda has been able to buy products to sell to friends. She would one day like to open up a phone booth in Manchay but still sell her FOREVER products.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva Volunteer.

Raymunda se dedica a la venta de productos y vitaminas americanas FOREVER. Esta marca consta de una gama de productos como pastillas, vitaminas, cremas, nutrientes e hidratantes de belleza. La venta es por catálogo. Ella conoció sobre este negocio por medio de una amiga, y fue así que empezó a participar de las reuniones donde se difunde esta línea de productos importados. Raymunda ya tiene tres años como distribuidora de FOREVER y dice que le ha ido bien con las comisiones de venta que ella gana. Además, ella se ayuda económicamente cuidando enfermos, ya que es enfermera geriátrica. Con los préstamos que ha pedido, Raymunda ha comprado productos para ofrecer a sus amistades. A ella le gustaría abrir un locutorio en Manchay, pero sin descuidar las ventas de productos FOREVER.

loans.use: To purchase more FOREVER products

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel Munoz dedicates her efforts to her business of selling clothing in the city of Chinandega where she sells her products at the central market.

She is a hard working person who is looking for a way to succeed in her business so that she can provide for her family. For this simple reason she is calling upon Ceprodel for a loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise to sell to her clients so that she may be able to continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Maribel M. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de venta de ropa en la ciudad de Chinandega donde vende sus productos en el mercado Central de esta ciudad.

Actualmente ella es una persona esforzada que busca la manera de salir adelante en su negocio para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Por esta sencilla razón es que acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario que le permita obtener la mercadería para luego ofertarla a sus clientes en su tramo y de esta manera continuar con el sustento de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing.

loans.name: Vang

texts.en:
Mrs. Vang N., 58, is a widow who lives in a small village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has seven children, five sons and two daughters. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home. One son is a construction worker, another one sells silk products, and the last one weaves silk at home.

Since she was young, Mrs. Vang has been a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

She is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Rehema S. is a twenty-eight-year-old married woman from Dar es Salaam. Rehema owns and operates a small stall, which she established six months ago, from which she sells roasted fish. She buys fresh fish daily from local fishermen as they come in with their morning catch. Rehema roasts and sells these fish either in the fish market or along the roads of Dar. Given its location along the Indian Ocean, fish is plentiful in the waters around Dar es Salaam and is a staple of the local Tanzanian diet. Rehema is an enterprising micro-entrepreneur who is taking advantage of a local need to make monthly profits of 120 USD. She is currently requesting a loan of 225 USD in order to purchase fish in larger quantities. In the future, Rehema plans to open another stall to sell her delectable treats.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of fish in bulk

loans.name: Mwanaid

texts.en:
Mwanaid is 29 years old and is married with 3 children between the ages of 9 and 2. She also cares for a 55 year old. She has been selling clothes since 1999. She works everyday from 8am to 3.30pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Mwanaid is now requesting a loan to improve her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To improve her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en: Wafaa lives in the area of Burj Al Barajneh in Suburban Beirut. A mother of four, she sells cosmetic products on a door-to-door basis. Pursuing this business since 2004, Wafaa has been able to improve her living standards by buying furniture for her home and providing her children with a better education. Today, two of her children are now married. She plans to borrow $1,000 to buy more products and continue on selling her products to her neighbors and friends.

loans.use: Wafaa would like to buy more inventory of cosmetics to continue her door-to-door sales business.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Amakuru (Greetings) from Ernest S. in Ruhengeri in the northern part of Rwanda! Ernest is 29 years old, married with 2 children.

Ernest owns a stock of sorghum. He buys the sorghum during the harvest time and keeps it in the store until the prices increase when it is in short supply and he can sell it to local breweries for making beer and to small local beer producers. The common local brew produced out of sorghum is Urwagwa, which is mostly drunk by local people in rural areas especially during wedding celebrations.

Besides the buying and selling of sorghum, Ernest also grows potatoes, which are commonly produced in the area where he lives because of the fertile volcanic soils in the region. He earns about US$ 140 every month from all his commercial activities. He employs 4 people in both his farm and in the selling of sorghum.

He is looking for a loan worth 515,000 Frws to buy more sorghum to increase his stock since he has the market to sell it to the local breweries, who otherwise make banana beer. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: To Increase his stocks of sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase trade area

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es comerciante, su esposo se dedica a la elaboración de muebles y ella se encarga de realizar los contratos y ofertar sus productos de carpintería a pedido.
Vive en la zona Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz como cuidadora, es decir vive en unas dos habitaciones sin pagar alquiler a cambio de cuidar esa vivienda. tiene tres hijos que están en edad escolar. El crédito que ahora solicita es para la compra de madera, venesta y barniz para continuar en el negocio de elaboración de muebles junto con su esposo.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Felipa is a storekeeper. Her husband makes furniture and she is in charge of making contracts and offering their products to the workshops that order them. She lives in the zone Irpavi II in the city of La Paz as a nanny. This means she lives in two houses without paying rent in exchange for taking care of the homes. She has three children that are of school age. The loan that she is requesting is for buying wood, plywood, and varnish in order to continue the business of making furniture with her husband. This is the second time she has requested a loan with Impro. Her credit history qualifies her for a client rating 1 with Impro, which means that she has an excellent repayment history of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Annie Sheng, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wood, plywood and varnish for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Nguon M., 30, is married and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She grows bananas and sells them in the village market, earning approximately US$3.50 each day. Her husband is a horse-cart driver who makes around US$11 each day. This couple has three children, one of whom attends school.

Mrs. Nguon M. would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to make two investments. She will use US$500 to buy a bigger and healthier horse for her husband, and she will use the rest to rent a banana farm.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and rent a banana farm.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu has owned a small charcoal store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for many years. She belongs to the Nia njema loan group, and currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her busines for 14 hours. She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more charcoal to sell to her customers. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her profits and grow her business.    

Tatu is 33 years old, married, and has three children ages 4, 7 and 13.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Tika Llajta Group

texts.es: El grupo " Tika Llajta " esta representado por la señora Margot y conformado por 13 miembros dedicados principalmente al comercio de productos como artesanías, atención en tiendas de barrio, comida, cosméticos, licores, comida y al transporte público. Pese a la competencia los socios (as) saben como salir adelante con su experiencia y con la voluntad de trabajar y esforzarse para sacar adelante a sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de materiales e insumos para incrementar sus negocios y mejorar su producto. Los socios (as) conocen del trabajo con grupos solidarios ya que trabajaron con instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento de la responsabilidad y el cumplimiento que necesitan para cumplir con sus obligaciones y crecer en sus negocios mejorando la calida de vida de sus familias. Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco entre la señora Silvia Janeth y el señor Jose luis ambos son hermanos pero con ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no existe riesgo en el grupo.
texts.en:
The group "Tika Llajta" is represented by Ms. Margot and is made of 13 members. They are principally involved in selling handicrafts, especially related to neighborhoods, food, cosmetics, liquor and public transportation. It is up to the members to know how to move forward with experience and keep working and move their families forward. This financing is for buying materials, increasing business and improving products. The members know form working in supportive groups and working with groups similar to Foundation Agrocapital how to work with lots of responsibility, fulfill their obligations, grow their business and improve the quality of life for their families. There is a relationship between Ms. Silvia Janeth and Mr. Jose Luis and the group (two siblings), but they have independent loans and because of this have no risk in the group.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for Operacions

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina R. is currently in the business of selling milk and is requesting a loan to buy more cows for milk production. Zeina is 40 years old and is married to her husband who is a cattle keeper. She has 4 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a paddock system for rearing animals.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more cows for milk production

loans.name: Pross' Group

texts.en: Z. Pross is a member of Tusuubira group in Lugazi. She is a hard working lady who has had a salon that she mans in Lugazi town for 8 years so far. She makes lady’s hair, plaits it using braids as well as applying chemicals to make it soft and manageable. She has been able to buy driers that she uses in her salon, combs plus other accessories and this enables her to attend to four customers at a time. Pross needs a loan to help with buying more chemicals and braids for her salon plus paying school fees for her five children and one dependent. Pross has future plans of buying another plot of land and building rental homes for increasing her revenue.

loans.use: To buy hair chemicals and braids for her salon.

loans.name: Mrs. Kheim Sout Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people living in Romon village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purpose.

Mrs. Kheim S. is the 37-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field of land to cultivate rice. She also breeds chickens in the house. Her husband, Mr. Duong Vanna, is a motor taxi driver. Although they try to work hard they still earn insufficient income to support their family living. Thus, Mrs. Kheim S. decided to ask for a loan to bU. more chickens and she would use the rest of the loan to bU. piglets for breeding. She has two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

Five members in this group are applying for end-of-term (EoT) loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those receiving EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and to buy piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Bravo Plus Group

texts.fr: Thérèse M. a une boutique d’articles divers et vend du bois. Elle a acheté avec le crédit reçu au mois de mai courant, 100 bottes de bois à revendre en vue d’accroitre son revenu. Elle a été initiée au commerce par sa grande sœur en 1975 à l’âge de 13 ans. C’est en 1984 qu’elle s’est engagée à vendre ses propres produits, un bassin de 50 pains avec un capital initial de $5. De 1984 – 1990, par un dur travail et une bonne gestion, elle est arrivée à diversifier son activité en y ajoutant du sucre, du pétrole etc… qui totalisaient un montant de $200. De 1990 – 2002, Thérèse a encore diversifié son affaire en y ajoutant des mèches qui ont augmenté son capital à $1150. De 2002 – 2006, Thérèse a rencontré des difficultés d’écoulement de ses produits dans son quartier à cause de la saturation.  Cela l’a amenée de 2006 jusqu’à ce jour, d’ouvert un autre point de vente en dehors de son quartier. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $220 par mois. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une pharmacie à cause de la demande qui est grande dans son milieu à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Thérèse a 47 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants âgés de 18 à 29 ans dont le plus âgé est indépendant et les trois autres étudient.
texts.en:
Thérèse M. has a shop for various goods, and she sells wood. She used the loan received in May to buy 100 bales of wood to resell with the goal of growing her revenues. She was introduced to commerce by her older sister in 1975 at the age of 13. It was in 1984 that she dedicated herself to selling her own merchandise, fifty loaves of bread in a basin, with $5 of initial capital. From 1984-1990, through hard work and good managing, she came to diversity her business by including sugar, kerosene, etc... which totaled $200. From 1990-2002, she diversified again by including hair extensions that increased her capital to $1,150. From 2002-2006, she ran into difficulties with the turnover of goods in her district due to saturation. What has carried her from 2006 to today was opening another sales outlet outside her district. Currently her business generates a monthly profit of $220. Her ambition is to open a pharmacy because of the demand, which is big in her area west of Kinshasa. Thérèse is 47 years old, married, and the mother of four children, ages 18 to 29. The eldest is on his own, and the other three are students.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 100 bales of wood for resale

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.en:
Zulfiniso is married with 8 children. She sells nice, quality fabrics for national dresses in a big local market. Her family is actively helping her with her business, which she started about 14 years ago. Zulfiniso would like to ask for a loan of 6000 Somoni to increase her inventory which will help supply her until the spring season. She believes this timely investment will help her generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Zulfiniso’s responsibility and strong character will assist her in the current loan repayment.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase of new fabrics to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine R. is 45 years old, married, and has seven children. She resides at Locsoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

Josephine’s loan is intended to purchase vitamins and feed for her hogs. She admitted that, with the help of PMPC Microfinance Program, her business has grown in such a way that she has a better income now than before.

Josephine’s husband works at corn planting and helps in raising the hogs. Through the help of each other, they make their activities easier and more comfortable. The family hopes to have a comfortable life someday and be able to send their children to school and have their own decent life in the future.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake is 37 years old and married with two children. She tailors beautiful clothes for men and women, and she also sells sarongs. Folake is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase a sewing and weaving machine. She says this will enable her to serve her customers better. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing and weaving machine

loans.name: Edamaria

texts.es:
La señora Edelmira M. P. reside en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega donde ha unido sus esfuerzos para lograr un sueño que por mucho tiempo ha tenido como lo es la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus cuatro hijos que requieren del apoyo de su madre.

Ella ha decidido invertir en la compra de los materiales de construcción y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar el crédito oportuno ya que le urge continuar con la obra de reconstrucción y al final ver logrado su sueño de beneficiar a sus pequeños en su nivel de vida y brindarles un techo digno donde habitar.
texts.en:
Señora Edelmira M. P. resides in the municipality of Somotillo of the city of Chinandega where she has focused all her efforts to achieve a dream that she has had for a long time, namely the reconstruction of her house. The purpose of the loan is to improve the living conditions of her four children that require the support of their mother. She has decided to invest in the purchase of the building materials and for this she has approached Ceprodel to request credit since she is hard-pressed to continue with the work of reconstruction. In the end she would like to see her dream achieved to benefit her small children in their standard of living and to offer them a worthy home to live in.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her home.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is a member of the Hadhina borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 43 years old woman,she is separated from her husband and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 21 and 18 years.

Prisca started her own food business selling tomatoes,potatoes,onions, 10 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Prisca`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000Tsh in order to buy more tomatoes,potatoes etc for sale .

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Prisca hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes,onions,potatoes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy farm supllies and equipment for market gardening

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: C. Virginie est née vers 1953 à Allada. Virginie veuve. Virginie a à sa charge cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre sont les tiens. Virginie réside depuis onze  ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Virginie les charges de sa famille. C’est des boissons liqueurs que Virginie vend. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Béatrice et à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin que Virginie achète ses produits et elle va à Comè, dans le Département du Mono pour les vendre. Virginie a déjà neuf ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Virginie a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Virginie demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de cartons de boissons liqueurs.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a 40 married with three children aged between 3 and 12 years. Her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Rehema resides and rents a one roomed house where she is staying with four people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala in Ndeeba zone. Rehema works seven days a week. She buys yellow bananas from the very place she works and doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping.  She doesn’t pay rent but pays monthly market dues.She sells to all categories of people both on retail and whole sale Rehema has been in this business for 12 years and with MCDT for five, servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bunches and clusters of yellow bananas and. Rehema is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start buying  directly from farmers

loans.use: to buy more yellow bananas

loans.name: Elizabeth Mbulwa

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married to Salim and they have two children: Antony and Carolyne, who are 15 and 7 years old respectively.

She was introduced to KADET through existing clients and has no previous credit history. Elizabeth has been in the embroidery business for six years. She will use her loan to start a cereal sales business (maize) in order to diversify her income.

She runs her business is in a slum that is highly populated. Elizabeth's clients are residents of the area. Elizabeth also supplies embroidery items to other towns. 

With the extra profits, she intends to buy more machines for embroidery. In the future, Elizabeth aspires to open an embroidery school. She describes herself as hardworking.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. For more information on KADET, visit www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Starting a cereal sales business to diversify her income

loans.name: C2584 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Laurent K. is 34 years old and is married with four children aged between 5 and 12 years. He lives in the Gasabo district near Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. He is the president of a group called Twitezimbere. This group has sold agricultural foodstuffs (sorghum, beans, etc.) for the past four years and it employs five people working from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m. every day. 

This group is now requesting its first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their business. They will use the loan to purchase additional and larger quantities of foodstuffs needed by a number of their customers.

With this loan, and assuming they are successful, they hope to get enough profit to allow them to buy their own warehouse and provide more food and a better standard of living for their families.

loans.use: To purchase additional and larger quantities of foodstuffs

loans.name: Beatrice Nyamboke

texts.en:
Beatrice is 56 years old and married with four children. She is building some rental houses to add to what she has in Mwiki center. She has been in the business for about one year and earns a profit of approximately $240 a month.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend after moving from another micro-finance agency. She wants to use this loan to finish the construction of her rental houses in order to meet her clients' demands. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To finish construction of rental houses for her rental business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 28 años de edad y es casada. Se dedica a la artesanía. 
La señora Lucia estudió secundaria completa y tiene 1 hijo.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año atrás.
Su primer préstamo fue de  S/.500.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la adquisiciòn de  materiales los que emplearà en sus artesanías.
Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.1700.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo invertirá en la compra  de lanas.
Su deseo para el futuro es tener su tienda de artesanías en Tacna y que su hijo sea profesional.
Lo que màs le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucia is a member of Community Bank “Manuelas de hoy II.” She lives in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 28 years old and is married. She is an artisan. Ms. Lucia finished secondary school and has one child. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year. Her first loan was for $175 (500 PEN) which she used to buy materials which she uses in her crafts. She is asking for a loan of $600 (1700 PEN) which she will use to buy wool. Her wish for the future is to have a craft store in Tacna and for her son to be a professional. What she likes the most about Community Bank are the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La señora Paulina se dedica a la crianza y venta de chanchos, desde hace un año, tambien trabaja en una Empresa procesadora de A., la señora tiene casa propia en la zona de el Abra, recibe la ayuda de su esposo que es chofer de transporte publico, tiene un hijo que le ayuda en la crianza de los animales, mientra ella esta trabajando.
texts.en:
Sra. Paulina started raising and selling pigs a year ago. She also works at a company that processes almonds. She has her own home in the district of El Abra and receives assistance from her husband, who is a public transportation driver. Paulina has a son who helps her with raising the animals while she is working.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs

loans.name: Fonofaavae

texts.en:
Fonofaavae A. is 32 and married with 4 children (ages 8 - 22years).  She owns a business venture, catching large fish.  Fonofaavae has 3 years of experience in this business.  Fonofaavae needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase fishing boat and a fishing net.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 tala or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Fonofaavae joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Fonofaavae's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Fonofaavae A. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing boat and a fishing net

loans.name: Samoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoeurn T. is 41 years old and she lives in Roneam Tnaot village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Sombo T., are farmers who own 3 hectares (7.5 acres) of field on which they cultivate rice.

However hard this couple tries to work, they still earn less income than needed to support their family. In order to improve their living standards, Mrs. Samoeurn T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a plowing machine for her husband. He would use the plowing machine to plow their field and it will be hired by the villagers.

Mrs. Samoeurn T. is the mother of two children who are both students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a plowing machine for her husband

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Doña Elena de 46 años de edad,  habita en la comarca El Caracol junto a su familia compuesta por su esposo el señor Armando Guerra y sus 6 hijos, el mayor de 26 años, otro de 22 años, de 19 años, de 16 años, de 13 años y el menor de 10 años, de estos solamente los 2 menores estan estudiando la primaria, los mayores apoyan con trabajo productivo de la finca. Esta solicitando su 3er credito esperando ser beneficiada con kiva para compra  de terneros de desarrollo, los cuales pretende engordar para comercializarlos cuando obtengan un buen peso, y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias que le permitan el sosten familiar. Doña Elena desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la actividad ganadera, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia, su voluntad y anhelo es aprovechar su propiedad, ya que con el poco ganado propio no le aprovecha a capacidad sus recursos de su finca
texts.en:
Elena is 46 years old, and lives in the El Caracol area together with her family, composed of her husband Armando Guerra and their 6 children. The oldest is 26, and the others are 22, 19, 16. 13 and 10. Of these, only the 2 youngest are studying at primary school - the older ones support the family by working on the farm. Elena is seeking her third loan, hoping to be favoured by Kiva to purchase calves to raise, which she will fatten to sell when they reach a good weight. In this way she will obtain better earnings that permit her to sustain her family. Since Elena was very young she has dedicated herself to farming activities, which have allowed her to improve her family's situation. Her will and yearning is to make the most of her property, as with the little she earns she doesn't make the most of the farm's resources.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Shanta

texts.en:
Mrs. Shanta T. lives in a single family with her husband and three children. Both Mrs. T. and Mr. T. are engaged in agriculture. They own their own land for farming. Mostly they grow green vegetables on their land. They sell their vegetables at the local market in the morning and evening daily. They meet all the needs of their family with the income from their farming. 

Mrs. Shanta T. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishepati. Sainbu-Bhaishepati is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. She has two daughters and one son. All of her children are now working.

Mrs. T. is requesting a 10,000 Nepalese rupee loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for the farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah has a wheelbarrow that she uses to hawk Nigerian cooked foods. Her customers love her cooked foods and she has high patronage. She loves her business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She is married with five children and she is 42 years old. Her husband is a civil servant and he supports their home. She hopes to grow her business. She is requesting a loan of N120,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Yoeuk

texts.en: The lady in the photo is Yoeuk K.. She is 38 years old and married Chan Hun, 43, many years ago. The couple has four school-aged children. They have a small fishing business in and around Tunle Sap River. By fishing, the couple is able to generate a small income of $5 USD each day, which they use to feed their family. Yoeuk K. is requesting a loan to purchase more fishing accessories for their fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sales of food items and basic needs items

loans.name: Ngoyangi Group

texts.en:
Korpo B. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Ngoyangi. She is 45 years old, single, and has two children aged 22 and 26. She also cares for other relatives living with her. Korpo did not have the opportunity to go to school.
For the last five years, Korpo has been selling charcoal at the Oldest Congo Town in Paynesville, Liberia. She started her business with 10,000 LRD as working capital but now has more than 20,000 LRD as working capital. She has a good stock in order to encourage customers to continue returning. Korpo sometimes faces problems with transporting goods from one place to another. Her goal and dream is to build a house in the near future. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to purchase more charcoal to improve her business.
In the photo that accompanies this profile, Korpo is holding the sign. Richard is inset lower right.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Por Una Vida Digna Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “Por una Vida Digna” se encuentra ubicada en la zona D. Santa Anita, departamento D. Lima, está conformado por 9 socios, trabajan con EDAPROSPO – prosperidad desD. hace 6 años. Sus miembros realizan diversas actividades D. producción, comercio y servicio.
Elsa quien a su vez asume el cargo D. tesorera, tiene 52 años, es casada, tiene 5 hijos D. los cuales uno esta en la Universidad, se dedica al alquiler D. vestuarios (danzas folklóricas), desD. hace 5 años, se inicio en esta actividad porque sus hijas son profesoras D. danzas, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria Elsa ha construido el tercer piso D. su vivienda. Su gran sueño es formar una agrupación que difunda el folklor a nivel nacional. El reciente préstamo lo utilizará en la compra D. vestuarios.  
Todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y están comprometidos a cumplir con los pagos según el cronograma otorgado por prosperidad. (En la foto niños hijos D. los socios).
texts.en:
The community bank “Por una Vida Digna” is located in Santa Anita in the departament of Lima. It is maD. up of nine members who have worked with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for six years. The members are involved in diverse production, commercial and service industries. Elsa is the group's treasurer. She is 52, married and has 5 children, one of whom studies at university. She has been renting out folk dance costumes for five years. She started this business because her daughters are dance teachers. As a result of her daily efforts, Elsa has added a third floor to her house. Her dream is to form a group that will take folklore to a national level. She will use this loan to buy costumes. All the group members are thankful for the support they receive and are committed to repaying their installments on time. The children featured in this photo are the children of the group members.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of costumes

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie V. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 49 years old. Arcelie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arcelie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Arcelie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Arcelie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Arcelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arcelie is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Arcelie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en:
Eliseo D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 45 years old. Eliseo is single. To make a living, Eliseo owns & operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Eliseo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Eliseo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliseo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Eliseo is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a set of tires for his motorcycle and for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle to continue his transport business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eliseo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and to repair and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 44-year-old lady who is married to a farmer. She sells scrap metals which are later recycled. In additon, she sells fruit to earn extra income. Regina is a mother of four, and she works hard to provide a quality education for her two children who are in school. For this reason, she wants to stabilize her business to increase her income so that she can afford school fees. She has been an active member of Ngumbau group in Faulu Kenya, whose members are responsible for any member who takes out a loan. She is requesting 25,000 KES through the group. She wants to use the loan to buy more oranges for resale. In ten years, she wants to own a truck to transport fruit to the market.

loans.use: To buy oranges for resale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 24 years old, married, and has one 6-month-old child. He is a farmer from the town of Litein in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for the last four years and has employed one farmhand. His main product is milk, which he sells to the local market, and tea which he sells to the tea estate. He also earns income from his pool table business in the same area.

Hassan's biggest challenge has been lack of enough animal feed and lack of enough knowledge on animal diseases and pest control.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this loan will increase his source of income through the sale of milk and this will help him meet the needs of his family.

He would like to improve his farming in the future by acquiring a high yielding dairy cow and build a dairy unit. He is grateful to Juhudi for their support and requests more funding in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en: Mary Cris V. is from the village of Centro Sur, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 40 years old. Mary Cris is married and has three young children. To make a living, Mary Cris sells home products. The main source of income for the business comes from selling kitchen supplies and home products to local community members. Mary Cris has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Mary Cris joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Cris is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary Cris from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda E. is from the town of Banga. She is 28 years old. Chanda is married and has a 5-year-old child. To make a living, Chanda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Chanda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years. Like most farmers in her town, she wants her farm to be productive.

Chanda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Chanda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Chanda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Chanda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Estrengel

texts.en:
Estrengel R.' main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. He is 30 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Calinaoan. Estrengel has been in his business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Estrengel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Estrengel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes

loans.name: Vannat

texts.en:
Mr. Vannat K. (pictured with his mother) is 25 years old and a widower. He lives with his widowed mother in a village along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Vannat has been a carver for two years. He does not have his own transportation, so traveling is a big expense for him. Therefore, Vannat is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Mahamadou Rahama

texts.fr: Mahamadou Rahama est un homme célibataire. il y a quelques années il a abandonné les études, afin de pouvoir se prendre en charge, il a ouvert une salle de jeux qu'il exploite pour son propre compte.  les jeunes de son quartier affluent tous les soirs et surtout les weekend dans sa salle de jeux; satisfaire tout le monde il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une télé et d'une console Playstation.
texts.en: Mahamadou Rahama is a bachelor. Several years ago he left his studies in order to provide for himself. He opened a games room which he operates himself. The youths in his quarter pour into the games room on evenings and weekends. In order to meet demand, he is requesting a loan from WAGES so he can purchase another television and Playstation console.

loans.use: achat d'une télé et d'une console playstation.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with one grown son. She sells women's clothing. Her business is located at a department store where she rents some space. Olga is able to make her business a success by offering a large assortment and excellent client service. 

Olga is requesting 10,000 Grivnas to purchase seasonal inventories. She hopes to increase her sales and make additional profits to take better care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more bags of sugar and onions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cutlasses, hinges, nails, hammers, knives, and shovels

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok N., age 51, is a mother blessed with three children. Two of the children are single, and one is married. One of her children is a worker who works in a bread shop, and has a regular salary about $25 per month. Sok N. currently generates an income of approximately $2.5 per day by selling Khmer cake. Sok N. has a life partner in her husband who is a local farmer in Kompong Cham Province. Presently, her selling business is running very well and she wishes to expand her business. So that Sok N. requests a loan as additional capital to buy raw material for making Khmer cake for selling. Sok N. and her husband are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making Khmer cake for selling.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac en la provincia y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria; La socia tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada, y tiene 6 hijos, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta D. artesanía, la socia elabora a mano trabajos D. arcilla con motivos andinos, los pinta y da todos los acabados finales, ella trabaja en el centro artesanal Inti Pakareq; La socia trabaja  con su esposo y parte D. sus hijos, este se convirtió en un negocio familiar los últimos dos años. La socia requiere el crédito para poder comprar mercadería y materia prima para la adquisición D. arcilla D. primera y pinturas vegetales. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. materia prima.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank “INTI QUILLA.”  The bank is located in the Huanchac District of the Province and Department of Cusco.

The member's name is Sra. Maria.  She is 56 years old, married and has 6 children.  She makes her living buying and selling handicrafts.  She makes hand-maD. Andean-style pottery, paints the pottery herself and adds all the finishing touches. She works in the artisan center of Inti Pakareq.  Sra. Maria works with her husband and some of her children; it became a family business in the last two years.  She needs the loan in order to purchase merchandise and raw materials like high-quality clay and vegetable-based paints.  She is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials.

Sra. Maria is happy with the loan that has been granted, and she promises to make her payments in accordance with the established re-payment schedule.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan in order to invest in the purchase of raw materials.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a thirty-seven-year-old married male with five children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a retail business for the last two years which he started with a capital of 1,000,000 UGX and increased to 5,000,000 UGX. His hardships include competition plus rising prices for goods. His vision is expanding his business to a supermarket plus educating his children. George needs the loan to buy soft drinks, bread, rice and sugar for resale.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks, bread, rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Vera Gema

texts.es:
En el Municipio de Niquinohomo del Departamento de Masaya la señora Vera Gema P. L., diariamente labora en la Alcaldía Municipal de esa localidad como Promotora Social en el que ya tiene seis años de antigüedad en su puesto. Es madre soltera a su cargo tiene dos niñas a quienes con el sudor de su frente las sustenta y les brinda de todo lo necesario para que tengan un crecimiento saludable.

Esta señora tiene un sueño que el de ir realizando mejora en su casa de habitación para brindarles las condiciones necesarias para sus menores, es por esta razón que ahora ella está visitando las oficinas de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito y realizar el mejoramiento de vivienda.

Ella quiere que sus niñas crezcan en un ambiente sano y saludable para que lleguen a ser personas de bien en el futuro.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Niquinohomo, in the department of Masaya, Mrs. Vera Gema Pavon Lopez works daily at the City Hall. She has worked as a social promoter for the past 6 years. She is a single mother with two daughters in her care. With a great deal of effort she supports them and provides them with all that they need to have a healthy childhood. 

Her dream is to progressively improve their house in order to provide her children with the necessary living conditions. For this reason she has approached Ceprodel and she requests a loan to carry out some hope improvements. 

She wants her daughters to grown up in a healthy and safe environment, so that they will grow up to be upstanding citizens in the future.

loans.use: To carry out some home improvements.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida lives in Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city and known for its textile industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Barkatpura. She moved here 10 years ago. She is 46 years old and is a widow who has a 21-year-old son who works in a private company for a reasonable income. 

After the death of her husband, Khalida had to work to support her family. She started a clothes-selling business. She takes orders from her neighborhood clients and fills them by purchasing the clothes from different shops in the city. Because Faisalabad is famous for its textiles, Khalida’s clothes-selling business is going very well. 

She is a very responsible person, and as a mother she is taking care of her family very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk which will allow her to offer more variety and to target a wider clientele. 

She has been operating this business for the past 5 years and hopes that the loan investment will bring positive changes to it and she will be able to save some profit from improved income for the marriage of her son in future. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with her hand raised is Khalida.

loans.use: To buy clothes for clothes-selling business

loans.name: Nazmia

texts.en: Nazmia is 40 years old, married and lives in the town of Chtoura with her husband and two children. She makes a living producing and selling curtains, furniture covers and blankets. Nazmia is applying for this loan from Al Majmoua to improve her business by buying more patterns. This is her fifth loan from Al Majmoua, and she has used all of the previous ones to improve her financial situation. She is also very good about making payments on time. Nazmia plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business and care for her family.

loans.use: To buy patterns for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Nhem S., 28, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family's expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 25 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a trailer to attach to the motorbike for her husband to provide transportation services. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to attach to the motorbike to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Chhuon

texts.en: Chhuon S. is a 27-year-old farmer who lives in Prey Chor commune, Kompong Cham province. Chhuon S. is married to Mr. Kong Kimsroun, age 27, who works with her in the farming business. This couple has years pf experience in the agriculture sector. They can grow their crops accordingly in the rainy season and dry season, and they mostly get great results from their crop-growing business. In addition, Chhuon S. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs to earn more income. Chhuon S. has requested a loan in order to buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and piglets to raise for sale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 30-year-old hardworking man living in a rented house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family rests solely with him, and he desires to have an educated family and to build a house.

Robert started a retail shop three years ago with capital of 100,000 shillings, an amount that has since grown to 800,000 shillings. He needs the loan to buy bread and rice for his shop and dreams of one day becoming a wholesaler. High taxes are his main challenge.

loans.use: to buy bread and rice to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
Teresita M. B. vive cerca de cimarrón de Cartago, ella vende ropa importada en su comunidad.
Desde hace poco tiempo ella encontró un contacto para importar ropa y venderla en su comunidad. Gracias a que el pueblo es lejano el negocio a sido todo un éxito sin embargo no ha podido crecer lo suficiente y la demanda es cada vez mayor. Por eso necesita un préstamo de ₡500 000 ( quinientos mil colones). Para invertir mas y mejorar sus ingresos, esto le permitirá mejorar su situación económica y el estudio de sus hijos.
Ella es socia  de la Empresa de Crédito comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Teresita M. B. lives near Cimarrón de Cartago.  She sells imported clothes in her community.

A short while ago she found a contact to import clothes and sell them in her community.  Thanks to the fact that the town is very far away, the business has been a total success.  Nevertheless, she has not been able to grow enough, and the demand is higher each day.

That is why she needs a loan for 500,000 colones.  She will use it to invest more in her business and improve her earnings.  This will allow her to improve her financial situation and her children’s education.

She is a member of the Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón community loan company which is one of the 110 member companies of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga, 35 years old, is a mother of three school-aged children. She is married to a farmer. She has a corn farm in her village and she earned PHP 20,000 at the last cropping. She has operated her business for almost four years. She decided to take a loan from KIVA of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional farm inputs for her corn farm. Her profits will be used to pay for the labor of some farmers who will help her till her farm.

loans.use: To purchase additional farm inputs

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 31 years old and married. She has two children aged seven and six. Joan and her husband are both farmers. They work together to keep their farm productive. Rice is the primary crop that they grow. Joan does her best to help provide for her family's needs. She also makes sure her kids eat well and are healthy.

Joan's loan will be used to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: 6 Tân Nam  Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Hạnh, the group leader of the 2.12.1.6 Nam Ngạn solidarity group, comprised of six members, is 44 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province.

Hạnh has been operating a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables for one year. Since her main business hardship is a lack of capital, she is requesting her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase more vegetables for her business.

In the future, Hạnh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, ensure her business success, and remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El señor Mario es chofer; es socio propietario en el sindicato Litoral y su esposa trabaja en una empresa privada. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción: cemento, arena, ladrillos y otros ya que construirá una habitación nueva. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Achachicala  de la ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. Esta es la tercera vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva
texts.en: Señor Mario es a driver; he is a member of the Litoral union and his wife works in a private company.  The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of construction materials: cement, sand, bricks and other items as he is building a new room.  He lives in his own house located in the Achachicala zone in La Paz city, and is married with four children.  This is the third time that his loan is being channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, to build a new room in his home.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar is a 44-year-old farmer who lives in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She has two children. In 1998, in order to support her family and cover all expenses, Nilufar decided to start her own land cultivating business. With a starting capital of 50,000 KGS, she managed to expand her business by engaging in cultivating cherries and crab cherries. With her business revenues, she was able to pay for education of her children. 

Nilufar plans to use this loan of 100,000 KGS to buy mineral fertilizers and package materials for harvest transportation. With the revenues from the loan, she plans further broadening of her business. 

About Bai-Tushum and Partners

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. It is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 24-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur.  He is not married and for the past five years has owned a general store selling rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

He will use this loan to purchase more goods to sell in his store so he can continue to generate more profits.  In the future, he plans to build a house for himself and dreams of having a larger store.

loans.use: to buy goods for sale such as cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years.  He is 28 years old, married to Ann and they have two school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of Kshs 25,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.  He hopes the income from selling milk will boost his farm income.

In future, Patrick hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zadock

texts.en:
Zadock is 32 years old and has been in farming in Kitale, Western Kenya, for 5 years with two farmhands. His farm produces maize, eggs, and vegetables. He is still single and earns additional income from pool table games in the town.

Zadock has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry birds. He says he has experience with the poultry business and that additional birds will ensure a better income. He hopes to grow his poultry business and venture into the dairy business. He says all of this will contribute to building a strong foundation for a future family.

Zadock says lack of financing is the greatest challenge to farmers. He adds that Juhudi Kilimo's loans are the best.

loans.use: To purchase birds for his poultry business

loans.name: Maria Bersabe

texts.es:
Doña María, vive con su esposo, tiene casa propia, se dedica a vender especias (condimentos), como achiote, pimienta, cominos en el mercado municipal.
Ella quiere diversificar su negocio y por eso está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para que le ayuD. a comprar especias, como pimienta, comino, laurel orégano.
Su objetivo atraer a nuevos clientes para el consumo D. sus productos, mejorando así el negocio, creciendo como comerciante.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband.  She has her own house, and sells spices (condiments), such as achiote (annatto seeds), pepper, and cumin in the municipal market. 

She wants to diversify her business, and that's why she is applying for another loan, to help her buy spices such as pepper, cumin, bay leaf, and oregano. Her aim is to attract new customers for her products, and in this way improve her business, growing as a merchant.

loans.use: To buy condiments: pepper, cumin, bay leaf, and oregano for her business.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un couturier. Elle a 02 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le premier a 20 ans et le dernier 18 ans.
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 11ans. Elle vend à toute personne dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Ablavi a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes et des habits. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’assurer l’épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 41 years old. She is married to a tailor. She has two children both of whom have had schooling. The eldest is 20 years old and the youngest is 18. Ablavi has been working as a retailer for the past 11 years. She sells to all persons who enter her shop. She buys her products in Lome.
Ablavi requested her first WAGES loan cycle to buy pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and other clothing.
In the coming years, Ablavi would like to expand her business. She said that with her profits, she plans to ensure her children's personal fulfillment.

loans.use: Buy pagnes and clothing

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married to an entrepreneur. Together they bring up three sons and a daughter. The older son studies at university and other children are in school. The family is engaged in wholesale trade of meat. They started this business is 1996 and since that time Damira together with her husband achieved good results. With the profits gained they were able to build a house. At the moment, Damira applies for the loan because she needs money to purchase two livestock animals for breeding, fattening and further resale. She also plans to purchase feed for livestock. In the future she wishes to purchase a piece of land near to Bishkek to start building a house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Nonghin Group

texts.fr:
Mme ZOENABOU est la représentante du groupe Nonghin. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. Trois(03) de ses enfants vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle vend de pagnes depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, hommes.

Elle veut ajouter de l’argent pour s’acheter une balle de pagnes.

Mme avec ses économies contribue à l’épanouissement de son foyer et épargne un peu. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin de pagnes et aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. ZOENABOU is the representative of Nonghin Group. She's married and the mother of three children. The oldest is 19, the youngest is 10. All three of them attend school. She has five persons to support.

She's been selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) for five years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market in town. Her customers are both women and men.

She would like to have additional money to buy one bale of pagnes. With her savings, she helps her household to thrive. She ambitions to open a large pagnes store and help her children to study.

loans.use: to buy one bale of pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Sonia Elba

texts.es: Sonia Elba D. cuarenta y cinco años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos.
