Ella posee una pupuseria que es muy conocida en la localidad, pues prepara unas pupusas exquisitas, revueltas, D. queso, chicharrón etc. Todo con material D. calidad y a un buen precio, además el lugar donD. las venD. es muy higiénico; Sonia es una mujer entregada a su trabajo siempre está dispuesta a aprovechar las oportunidades que se le presentan ella piensa que para triunfar hace falta solamente la voluntad D. llegar a la cima, y Sonia tiene la voluntad por delante, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar chicharrón, queso, frijoles, maíz, harina D. arroz, tomates etc. Sonia Elba tiene la confianza que con su esfuerzo lograra darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Sonia Elba is 45 years old and lives with her spouse and children.  She has a pupusa shop that’s very well known in her community because she prepares exquisite revueltas, cheese, pork, etc. pupusas. [The two most common pupusas are the pupusa D. queso (cheese) and more popular pupusa revuelta with mixed ingredients of queso (cheese), frijoles (beans),and chicharrón. Pupusas are typically served with curtido (lightly fermented cabbage slaw with red chilies and vinegar) and a watery tomato salsa.]  

All of her ingredients are good quality and her prices are affordable.  Besides, the place she sells them at is very hygienic.  Sonia is a woman who is dedicated to her work; she’s always ready to take advantage of opportunities that present themselves.  She thinks that to be successful all one needs is the will to reach the top and Sonia has will to spare.  This is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy pork, cheese, beans, corn, rice flour, tomatoes, etc.  Sonia Elba is confident that with her efforts she’ll be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy pork, cheese, beans, corn, rice flour and tomatoes.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a 44-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be neat and patient. She operates a grocery store where she sells kale, onions, tomatoes, cabbages and other green vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are restaurants. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 20,0000 Kenyan shilling loan to increase stock of vegetables. Her business goal is to grow it into a wholesale one within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will grow the business and construct a permanent premises where she will be able to run her business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Mairamkhan

texts.ru: Майрамхан целеустремленная и трудолюбивая женщина. Более 17 лет она занимается продажей продуктов питания. У неё широкий ассортимент товаров, разные виды сладостей, консервные продукты, сахар, мука, макароны и т.д. Она хочет расширить свой бизнес, и хочет открыт еще одну торговую точку в центре рынка, который позволит ей получать хорошую прибыль. С этой целью она запрашивает займ, и заранее благодарит вас всех за поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Mairamkhan is a goal-oriented and hardworking woman. For more then 17 years she has been managing a grocery stall. She has a wide range of goods for sale: sweets, canned food, sugar, flour, pasta and the like. She wants to expand her business and open a second stall at the center of the towns' market, which is sure to yield good profits. For this purpose Mairamkhan is requesting a loan and would like to thank in advance fo your support and help.

loans.use: to expand her business and open a new store in the center of the market

loans.name: Esther Alouch

texts.en:
Esther is 27 years old, married and has three children ranging from four to eleven years old. She describes herself as a humble, talkative and God-fearing woman. 
She has been selling clothes and vegetables for the last ten years. Her business is faced with the challenge of the increased price of goods. 
Esther will be using the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of vegetables and used clothes. In the future, Esther wants to run a boutique.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes and vegetables.

loans.name: Consolate

texts.en:
Consolate is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has five children. For the past ten years, Consolate has been working hard to manage her dairy farm, which sells milk produced by her cows. 

To help expand her business, Consolate has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cows to produce milk for resale and will help Consolate generate increased profits and buy food to feed her family. Consolate hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a large cattle ranch. 

Consolate is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Consolate who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cows to produce milk for resale.

loans.name: Luceta

texts.en:
Luceta is 65 years old, married, and has five children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Luceta is borrowing 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. 

Luceta has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from a sari sari (general) store. 

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 35 years old and married to Lucy. They have two children.

Elijah has been in his current business for the last ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000. He hopes to use these funds to buy more donkeys for water supply transport and to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more donkeys for water supply transport.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, 39, is a farmer as well as a Khmer noodle seller who carries her noodles and its soup with a yoke, going through the village every day. She typically earns an average of $5.00 per day to cover her daily expenses. She has been blessed with a single child, who is studying in grade 9 in a local public junior high school in the Baray district. 

In the past, she used to buy stocks of rice from local farmers after harvesting season to store it up for her future business. However, she won’t be able to keep this business running without sufficient capital. Thus, Mao would like to borrow some funds from HKL to purchase stocks of rice for future sale, when its market demand increases. In the future, she hopes to expand this business, and she wants to be the owner of a big stock of rice in the province.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of rice for future sale.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia, age 35, is the hard-working single mother of three children. She started as a local gin distiller and saved her money to build the houses that she now offers for rent. Her primary challenge is when tenants do not pay on time. 

Her family goal is to see her children educated, and her business goal is to expand her business to new markets. 

Olivia intends to use the loan to renovate her rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: Céline âgée de 49 ans,a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Céline est mariée à un entrepreneur du nom de Michel. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et trois à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Céline vend depuis vingt ans, des mèches dans sa boutique sise à son domicile. Parallèlement à son activité, Céline vend aussi divers produits. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Céline sollicite pour une sixième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés

loans.use: Acheter des mèches.

loans.name: Midemahoudo Group

texts.fr: MIDEMAHOUDO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Pascal (celui qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgé de 53 ans. Pascal est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Victoire. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Pascal  et sa femme. Pour cette raison, Pascal vend des fagots de bois depuis une dizaine d'année ; qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Parallèlement à son activité, Pascal vend aussi de l'huile de palme. Pascal s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pascal sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIDEMAHOUDO, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des fagots de bois et de l'huile de palme.

loans.name: Guadalupe Esperanza

texts.es:
Guadalupe es una mujer de 19 años, su estado civil es soltera, tiene un hijo y ella se dedica a la crianza de chanchos lo cual ese trabajo le ayudado a salir adelante junto a su hijo.
Esta actividad lo heredo de su madre quien le enseño y le motivo a trabajar desde muy temprana edad.
 El cliente solicito el crédito para incrementar chancheras.
El cliente tiene un alma de emprendedora ya que a su corta edad ella ya tiene algunos animales y en este mercado ya le conocen que vende y tiene sus propios clientes sin necesidad de salir a ofrecer a las ferias.
El propósito de la cliente es llegar a tener chanchos finos ya que obtendría mayores ingresos, en el sector donde reside la cliente tiene un clima templado y las costumbres de las personas es el comercio de animales y la agricultura.
Guadalupe está muy agradecida con KIVA quien le abrió las puertas para obtener su crédito.

loans.use: Para incrementar las chacheras e incrementar su negocio que es el sustento para ella y su hijo.

loans.name: Suepasi

texts.en: Suepasi is a married lady with 7 children, all attending district schools due to cheaper of school fees. With her first loan in January 2004, she has developed her taro plantation, which is their main source of income that is financing her children’s education. She can now also afford to bring her children to the National Hospital in town where her children are been given good medications that are not available in the village. Suepasi’s husband is her right hand with the business, he’s the one responsible for selling taro twice a week, mainly on Friday and Saturday.

loans.use:
Buy chemicals, weed killer and fertilizer.       
Home Improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his horticulture and trading business

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Mr. Yao A. was born on 19 December 1980 in Havé. Having become a mechanic after three years of apprenticeship, he married a dressmaker, with whom he has two children. Dynamic and a master of his job, he is a good entrepreneur and has managed his previous loans and repaid them without incident.

To be able to carry out his work efficiently and make it profitable, he is asking for a loan of $750 which will serve to buy wrenches and other work materials. This will allow him to increase his income in order to better support his family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Yao est né le 19 décembre 1980 à Havé. Devenu mécanicien après trois ans d’apprentissage, il s’est marié à une couturière avec qui il a fait deux enfants. Dynamique et maîtrisant son métier, il est un bon entrepreneur et a su gérer les crédits obtenus et les a remboursé sans aucun incident.

Pour pouvoir accomplir efficacement son travail et rentabiliser celui-ci, il sollicite un crédit de $750 qui servira à l’achat des clés et autres matériels de travail. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus afin de mieux entretenir sa famille.

loans.use: To buy wrenches and other work materials

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi is married with two children. She is a religious person who practices good morals in the community. She is very hardworking and has benefited a lot from our lady of unity women group. She has a small retail shop which is the only source of income. She started her business with the help of a small group loan. She is applying a loan to buy goods in order to meet her customer’s needs. She is willing to repay her loan on monthly basis.

loans.use: Naomi would like to buy house hold goods for her retail shop.

loans.name: Dilara

texts.en: Dilara A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in south-western Azerbaijan. She is an Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She is 47 years old, and married with 3 children. Dilara has worked as a chemist  for a long time. Now she rents a chemist's shop in Beylagan. She applied to Normicro for a loan of $700 to expand her business.

loans.use: To Expand Business

loans.name: Maleyka

texts.en: Maleyka G. is an Internally Displaced Person from Khojavend city in Azerbaijan. Now she is settled with her husband and two children in Beylagan, a small city in south western Azerbaijan. They are engaged in cattle-breeding. Maleyka wants to increase the number of her cows. She needs a $500 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sala

texts.en: Sala is a mother of 3 and is 41 years of age. She started the Levili Toefuataina centre. Her business is a flea market stall selling handicrafts and Samoan food just in front of her house. She earns more than $100.00- $200.00 WST ($40-80 USD) a week. Her husband works as one of the security guards in town but Sala never relies on his pay for her family remittances.

loans.use: To restock her flea market stall

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Mrs. Elsa belongs to the Nuevo Eden communal bank located in the district of Yarina Cocha in the neighborhood of Ucayal. She is 55 years old. She is mother of 9 children, 6 are adults and 3 still live with her. She is married and her husband is a chainsaw mechanic. With the first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles that she received she decided to invest in the sale of typical food of the region.

Presently she works for herself and operates a small restaurant out of her house. She has to wake up really early to go to the market and buy ingredients for the food that she prepares to sell in the afternoons.

With the loan of 1,500 Peruvian Soles, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will invest in some essential ingredients that she needs to make her business grow. She will purchase 1 large bag of rice, a large slab of meat, 10 kilograms of salted meat, 10 kilograms of sausage, fish, 1 large bag of charcoal, 3 boxes of eggs, 1 large bag of sugar and other necessary items.

Elsa is very happy. During the time that she has been working with Manuela Ramos she has done very well and she is very grateful to the organization for all of the support she has received.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Elsa pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en Jr. 7 de Junio 415, distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años, es madre de 9 hijos, 6 son mayores de edad y 3 tres aún viven con ella, es casada y su esposo es mecánico de motosierras. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la venta de comidas típicas de la región.

En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de comidas en su casa, para lo cual se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los insumos para la preparación de los platos y en la tarde sale a vender.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, carne de monte, 10 kilos de cecinas, 10 kilos de chorizo, pescados, 1 saco de carbón, 3 cajas de huevos, 1 saco de azúcar, etc.

Elsa se siente bien. Durante todo el tiempo que viene trabajando con Manuela Ramos le va muy bien y está muy agradecida de la Institución por el apoyo que recibe.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients (sugar, rice, meat, and other necessary items)

loans.name: Nhóm Chị Thư - Cụm Vọng Nguyệt - Tam Giang Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Thư 33 years old, has two children who are still going to school. She is breeding pigs. Besides that, she and her husband also work on the rice field, and make wine. Her family income is 4.5-5 USD/day. Other members of the group also have different ideas to use the borrowed money.
Mrs. Huệ buys chicken-feed and veterinary medicines for her chickens.
Mrs. Đảmbuys more merchandise for her general store.
Mrs. Giao buys more pigs.
Mrs. Hà buys chicken-feed for her chickens.
Mrs.Giang buys wasted-metal material and also makes tofu to sell.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Thư, 33 tuổi có 2 con đang đi học. Chị nuôi rất nhiều lợn thịt. Chị mua cám cho lợn ăn, N.ài chăn nuôi lợn, vợ chồng chị còn làm ruộng, nấu rượu. Thu nhập trung bình của gia đình chị khoảng 70 - 80 000 đồng/ngày. Các thành viên còn lại trong nhóm có mục đích sử dụng vốn rất đa dạng.
Chị Huệ thêm vốn mua cám, thuốc thu y cho gà đẻ của gia đình.
Chị Đảm thêm vốn mua hàng tạp hoá bán tại nhà.
Chị Giao thêm vốn mua lợn giống.
Chị Hà vay vốn để mua cám cho đàn gà đẻ.
Chị Giang vay vốn để đi chợ sắt vụn và làm đậu phụ bán.

loans.use: to buy pig mash, chicken-feed, veterinary medicine, merchandise for general store

loans.name: Mujeres Rukux Ulew Group

texts.en:
The Rukux Ulew trust bank is composed of 14 women, most of them mothers with young children. They all live in Aldea Saquitacaj, which is an isolated rural village deep in the department of Chimaltenango. Impressively, the majority can read and write. Together, they are more than just a “Banco Comunal,” but a tightly knit social group. They chat freely in both Spanish and their native tongue, Kaq’ichel. Hope for a better tomorrow is a common theme. It has united them.

Today is a day of excitement for this group of clients because they are going to receive their first loan at Friendship Bridge. Finally, the women of Rukux Ulew are going to have a chance to expand their business and, at least, attempt to have a sustainable source of income.

Almost all of the women have sustained themselves by raising animals and tending crops. These ladies believe that their 1350 Quetzales loan (an average of US $178), can launch them into the more lucrative business of Guatemalan weaving.

The loan would be used to buy fabric for their weaving. The women plan to do all the weaving themselves, and the finished fabrics would be sold in the nearby market in San Jose Poaquil.

It is impressive how most of these women have more than one business. Portfolio diversification is a strategy they are currently managing. This shows that, even though these women live in a remote area, they have managed to learn updated and sophisticated managerial skills.

These women hope that their future investment will increase their daily income and will help them achieve a better future, a future in which education for their kids is not just a dream, but a possibility.

loans.use: To buy thread and fabric to weave traditional Guatemalan blouses

loans.name: Francis Kwabena

texts.en:
A. Francis Kwabena is a successful carpenter. He is married and has 2 children. Business is good, but he needs additional capital to match his rising customer demand and high production costs.

He is asking for $525 to buy more raw materials for production.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for production.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa M., 26, is married and has four children. Currently, her husband does contract work and contributes money to the family every fortnight. Luisa has been in the business of making pancakes for the last year, and sells her cooking to locals who stop by her food stall on the road near her village six days a week. She has no previous loans from SPBD, but does bring in a weekly net cash flow of about $125. SPBD loans are Luisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy a gas oven, wok, bags of flour, a bag of sugar and oil

loans.name: Didi

texts.es:
Didi is 42 years old and the father of three small children. His kids are his inspiration for hard work. Didi owns a motor taxi business. He also works as a mechanic from his small shop when he has time between transporting passengers, or when he has requests. He used to work buying and selling wood before he started this business. He wants to continue to build his new business. He is requesting a loan to expand his shop and make necessary repairs to his motor taxi, so he can continue to grow his income and support his family.

El señor Didi de 42 años de edad, es padre de 03 pequeños, quienes son su inspiración para alcanzar el progreso, es propietario de un mototaxi y se dedica al transporte de pasajeros, también tiene un pequeño taller mecánico en donde en sus ratos libres o cuando le solicitan algún servicio apertura.Anteriormente se dedicaba a la compra y venta de madera. Se caracteriza por ser un padre emprendedor y decidido que quiere seguir creciendo sin embargo requiere de un préstamo para mandar a ampliar su taller y reparar su vehículo para no disminuir las ganancias de su labor tan útiles para su familia.

loans.use: TO MAKE REPAIRS TO HIS MOTOR TAXI AND EXPAND HIS AUTO MECHANIC BUSINESS.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is the wife of M. and lives in the city of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She has lived in a two-room brick house for the last 22 years, and is the mother of four sons. Her oldest son works in a factory. The next oldest son raises buffalos. Her younger children are enrolled in a local neighborhood school. Her husband is a land owner who farms for a living.

Naseem baji contributes to the family income by running a milk business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan) and is applying for a new loan to buy a buffalo to expand her small company. She is making this application with two other people. Sharifan baji also wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Yanet Rosa

texts.es:
Yanet is 33 years old and a single mother who lives with her four children: Mery, who is 12, Yeni, 10 years old, Esther, 4 years of age, and Albino, who is only one. Yanet was born in the Pusi district, but has lived in the city of Juliaca for four years now. She did not finish her education given that she had to start work at a young age to help out her family financially. Yanet has dedicated herself to a number of occupations which is how, two years ago, she began selling clothing door-to-door throughout Juliaca. She enjoys this business because the clothing is much sought-after by local residents. The most difficult part is moving her merchandise around to sell. Thanks to God, she counts on the support of her children who are always close to help her with her daily sales which she carries out all day. Yanet had to help her children get ahead single-handedly, and wants to bring them better opportunities as they grow and become men and women. With the money from her loan, she thinks she will purchase more merchandise so she can in that way increase her income. In addition, she would like to open a clothing store so she can feel successful as a person and to provide a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Yanet tiene 33 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus cuatro hijos; Mery de 12, Yeni de 10, Esther de 4 y Albino de 1 añito. Yanet nació en el distrito de Pusi, pero reside en la ciudad de Juliaca hace 4 años, no terminó sus estudios primarios debido a que se tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia con la economía. Yanet se ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes ocupaciones, es así, que hace dos años se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca, gustándole este negocio ya que la ropa es muy solicitada por la gente, lo más difícil es tener que trasladar la mercadería hasta el lugar de venta, gracias a Dios cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, los cuales siempre están cerca para ayudarla durante la venta que es todo el día. Yanet tuvo que sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos sola, ella quiere brindarles un mejor porvenir para que sean hombres y mujeres de provecho. Con el dinero del préstamo piensa adquirir mercadería y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos, además desea abrir una tienda de ropa, para sentirse exitosa como persona y para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell (clothing) and, later own, establish her own store.

loans.name: Mame Anta

texts.fr: Mame Anta N. est une femme mariée agée de 27 ans.elle habite à la cité lamy de thiés et gére une boutique depuis deux ans. elle sollicite ce pret pour le renforcement de sa boutique d'alimentation générale.
texts.en:
Mame Anta N. is a married 27-year-old woman. She lives in the Cité Lamy district of Thiés and has been managing a shop for two years. She is requesting this loan to bolster her shop selling food items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her shop

loans.name: Sabougnouman (Porte Bonheur) Group

texts.fr:
Sabougnouman est un regroupement de neuf (9) femmes (constitué de 3 veuves et de 6 mariés) ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames traditionnelles dans le quartier bamanan kin de kirango dans la sous préfecture de Markala (quatrième région administrative du Mali).
Appartenant toutes à la même association traditionnelle d’entraide et à la une même activité génératrice de revenu à savoir l’achat vente du poisson et des céréales, les femmes du groupe Sabougnouman décidèrent ensemble de rejoindre l’institution depuis maintenant deux ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés les deux prêts précédents, le groupe est à son troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Elles comptent utiliser ce nouveau prêt pour acheter, 50 paniers de poisson, 5 barres de glace, 12 sacs de mil, 4 sacs de riz et 2 sacs d’haricot. Tandis qu’elles s’approvisionnent en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger à l’entrée du barrage de Markala auprès des pêcheurs,  les céréales quant à elles au marché hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou les dimanches auprès des forains grossistes. Si une partie du poisson est vendue à l’état frais (à une clientèle féminine), l’autre partie est fumée à domicile sur des foyers traditionnels conçus spécialement pour cette activité, pour ensuite être vendus en détail parfois au marché journalier de Kirango Markala, à Ségou et à Bamako (capitale du Mali) à des grossistes. Les grains de céréales sont vendus au marché de Diamarabougou à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes et généralement en détail et au comptant.
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 32.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé pour la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants et aider les époux à subvenir aux charges familiales. Elles ont pour ambition d’acheter une maison à usage d’habitation surtout pour les orphelins.
texts.en:
Sabougnouman (meaning 'good luck charm') is a group of nine women (of whom three are widows and six are married). The group members average 41 years of age and five children. They live in traditional polygamous families in the Bamanan Kin district of Kirango, in the sub-prefecture of Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali). Each belonging to the same traditional mutual-aid association and doing the same income-generating work, namely buying and selling fish and grain, the women of the Sabougnouman group decided jointly to sign up with the institution two years ago. After having correctly repaid their two preceding loans, the group is on its third solidarity loan (group loan). They intend to use this new loan to buy: 50 baskets of fish, 5 slabs of ice, 12 sacks of millet, 4 sacks of rice, and 2 sacks of beans. While they get their supplies of fish from fishermen on the River Niger at the entrance of the Markala Dam, the grain is gotten from wholesale vendors at the weekly marketplace of Diamarabougou on Sundays. If a portion of the fish is sold fresh (to women customers), the rest is smoked at home over traditional hearths designed especially for this, in order to be sold retail to bulk merchants, sometimes at the daily marketplace of Kirango Markala, in Ségou and in Bamako (the capital of Mali). The grain is sold at the Diamarabougou marketplace to customers composed of women and men and generally in cash at the retail level. They each hope to realize an average profit of 32,000 francs CFA each month that will be used for covering the children's school fees and to help their husbands meet family expenses. Their ambition is to buy a house in which to live, especially for the orphans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and grain

loans.name: Helena Bernardo

texts.pt:
Helena Bernardo M. natural do distrito da manhiça um dos distritos nortenhos da província do Maputo, tem 54 anos de idade, mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre o primeiro tem 30 anos e o ultimo tem 25 anos. Para alem dos filhos vive com mais duas pessoas na sua casa que ela sustenta.

Helena estudou até 9ºclasse e parou por situações profissionais, dado que ela fez as ultimas classes enquanto trabalha. Helena vive de negocio que consiste na venda de carne qual compra o quilo por 80,00mt e vende por 95,00mt;   Amendoim que compra o saco por 900,00mt e vende por 1600,00mt. Tem um rendimento mensal de 28000,00mt.

Para Helena este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com este pretende aumentar a mercadoria para responder a demande na quadra festiva que se avizinha. Futuramente pretende melhorar as condições habitacionais.
texts.en:
Helena Bernardo M., originally from the district of Manhiça – one of the Northern districts of the province of Maputa – is 54 years old and has 3 children, the oldest of which is 30 and the youngest, 25. As well as her children, she also lives with another two people whom she supports.

Helena studied until the 9th grade, stopping for professional reasons and then finished the last few years whilst working at the same time. Helena lives off her business selling meat, which she buys for 80,00 MZN and sells for 95,00 MZN as well as peanuts, which she buys at 900,00 MZN per bag and sells at 1600,00 MZN per bag. She has a monthly income of 28000,00 MZN.

This is Helena’s first loan from Hluvuku and from Kiva. She intends to increase her stock in order to meet demand in the coming festive season. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.


Translated from Portuguese by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock of food for sale in festive season

loans.name: Nneka

texts.en: Nneka sells electrical materials such as fuses, switches, bulbs, wires and more. Nneka is 27 years old and married. Nneka lives in the state of Lagos, Nigeria. She needs a loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more electrical materials to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell Christmas trees

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Шомуродов Дильшод житель Гиссарского района. Возраст 27 лет, женат . Пока детей не имеет. По профессии шофер. Работает водителем маршрутного такси. Имеет автомашину марки "Газель".Его дело приносит неплохой доход , но в данный момент он должен произвести капитальный ремонт автомашины. Поэтому он решил получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilshod S. lives in the Gissar region. He is 27 years old, married and does not yet have any children. He works as a taxi driver and owns a 'Gazelle' make of car. His business makes a decent profit but at the moment he needs to have a big auto-service done on the car. He plans to use the loan for this service and to repay it in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car service and repair

loans.name: Tusichukiane Group

texts.en:
For the last three years Asha has owned a small store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar, where she sells firewood and various food items. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $310 by working 14 hours a day.  She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood to sell to her customers. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her profits and grow her business.  

Asha is 30 years old, married and has three children ages 8, 2 and 8 months. She also cares for three other dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, whose names are Mtumwa, Nizuma, Tatu and Sada. Each woman also runs a small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie T., 31 years old, is married and is blessed with four children. She lives in Poblacion, Mahinog, Camiguin Province in Southern Philippines. Three of her children are in school and the eldest is in fourth grade. Their main source of income is the tricycle that they own. Her husband is the tricycle driver. (Tricycles are the mode of transportation in their province.) 

Currently, their tricycle is not working due to problems with the wheels and some spare parts that are not functioning. Her husband has started an art and sign printing business to earn an income while the tricycle is not working. She wants to repair the tricycle, so she needs PHP 5,000 for repair and maintenance. This will be her first loan from HSPFI and if it is granted, they can have a good and comfortable living.

loans.use: To purchase wheels and spare parts for their tricycle

loans.name: Susana Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario tiene su domicilio en la comarca de Pacayita, del municipio de Masaya, los tres se dedican a la misma actividad de elaboración y venta de muebles,sus talleres están ubicados en los patios de sus casas y venden en los mercados del país, generalmente tienen clientes fijos que se llevan toda la producción, ellos compran los materiales juntos para que estos les salgan más baratos. Son muy unidos, solidarios y de buenas recomendaciones.


Doña Susana es artesana en madera desde muy joven, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres. Es madre soltera de dos niños de 4 y 6 años, esto le ha instado a salir adelante para lograr darles educación y sus manutención; trabaja con su hermano menor que también es soltero y se han organizado para manejar el negocio, tiene 4 trabajadores y las máquinas son de ella, tiene casa propia que poco a poco ha ido construyendo. Los productos que elaboran son puertas, juegos de muebles, mesas y comedores, en muchos casos los encargos son un poco extraños pero se aprenden a elaborarlos.
Espera seguir creciendo con Adim, se siente muy satisfecha de poder trabajar por sí sola y haber obtenido créditos en base a la confianza.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is located in the region of Pacayita in the Masaya municipality. The three members all work making and selling furniture. Their workshops are located in their home patios and they sell in the country markets. Generally, they have fixed customers who buy all of their products. They buy their materials together to get them cheaper. They are very united and have good recommendations. Susana has been a wood craftswoman since she was very young; she learned this activity from her parents. She is a single mother with a four-year-old and a six-year-old, which is what drives her to succeed so she can give them an education and provide for them. She works with her younger brother who is also single, and they have organized themselves to manage the business. They have four workers, and Susana owns the machinery. She has her own house, which she has been building little by little. The products they make are doors, furniture sets, tables and dining tables. In many cases, the orders are strange, but they learn to make them. She hopes to keep growing with Adim; she is very satisfied that she is able to work for herself and to have obtained credit based on trust.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 37 years old and married with a child. She sells cooked food and drinks. She requests a loan of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 26-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, in southern Lebanon. Hanan has owned a bakery for three years.

She makes “saj” and “mankoucheh.” The “saj” is a metA. oven where she makes saj bread. It is a traditionA. Lebanese cooking dome that is also used to make Markouk (“thinned”) bread and doughy confections, or Mankoucheh. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza, and the most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it any time of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning.

Hanan requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase merchandise and raw materials for her bakery. This is the first time that Hanan has requested a loan.

Hanan is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients and she is known for the good taste of her mankoucheh. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and tourists. When she first started, she didn’t have startup capitA.. Hanan decided on doing her business because she wanted to be independent and prove to herself that she was able to handle her work. She was also self-confident. In the future, she plans on expanding her business by purchasing a new machine to do French baguettes.

loans.use: Hanan will use the loan to purchase merchandise and raw materials for her bakery.

loans.name: Sétou

texts.fr:
Madame  Sétou D. est une   veuve  de 62 ans, qui vit en location avec ses 5 enfants  dans le quartier Bagadadji de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Technicienne de santé à la retraite, elle est venue au commerce grâce à sa mère qui vendait des céréales. Elle commença ses activités génératrices de revenus par le tricotage des habits  pour enfants, le commerce d’articles divers etc. Très vite elle opte pour la fabrication et la vente des jus de boissons locaux non alcoolisés et de la glace. Elle mène cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année et  jouit   d’une grande renommée  dans le quartier et même dans la ville de Ségou. 
Pour préparer des jus, elle utilise 2 kg de sucre,  4 sachets de poudre de jus  plus  6 sachets de sucre vanille et des arômes.  
Afin d’acheter un congélateur d’une grande capacité pour  satisfaire sa clientèle, elle  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso depuis 36 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel  tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter un congélateur sur place à Ségou auprès des commerçants qui se sont spécialisés  dans le domaine  de l’électroménager. Madame  Sétou D.  vend au comptant et à crédit chez elle à domicile et en ambulant à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants.   
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour épargner et subvenir à certaines dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Ms. Sétou D. is a 62-year-old widow who is renting her place with her five children in the Bagadadji district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A retired health technician, she came into commerce thanks to her mother, who used to sell grains. She started her income-generating business with the knitting of clothing for children, commerce in various goods, etc. She very soon opted for making and selling local non-alcoholic juice drinks and ice cream. She has been in this business for a dozen years and enjoys great fame in her area, and even in the city of Ségou. To make juices, she uses 2 kg of sugar, 4 bags of juice powder, 6 bags of vanilla sugar, and some flavorings. In order to buy a large-capacity freezer for satisfying her customers, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso 36 months ago. After four solidarity loans and an individual loan, all correctly repaid, she is now on her second individual loan. This loan will be used to buy a freezer, locally in Ségou, from merchants who specialize in household appliances. Ms. D. makes her sales out of her home and door-to-door, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men, women, and children. She intends to realize an average monthly profit of 37,000 francs CFA that will be put into savings and covering certain family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy  freezer

loans.name: Flordiliza

texts.en: Flordiliza is married to Danilo B. and they lived in the rural village of Buliwao Quezon Nueva Vicaya.  Farming is their major source of income in their village.  They help each generate a daily income to support the education of their children and for their daily living.  She is very eager to develop her business so she will able to earn a higher income. Flordiliza is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to acquire more products to sell.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Barfiyamo

texts.ru: Барфиямо Шодмонова проживает в Яванском районе. Возраст 42 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Барфиямо имеет арендованную, торговую точку на рынке, где торгует морожным, напитками и т.д. Муж находится в России на заработках. Клиент просит кредит, для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Barfiyamo S. lives in the Yavan district. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. Barfiyamo leases a retail stand at the market, where she sells ice-cream, drinks, etc. Her husband is working in Russia. Our client is requesting this loan for business expansion.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Jypar's Group

texts.en:
Jypar is the group’s leader. Jypar has one son and one daughter. Both of her children go to college and don’t work. At the age of 49, she works as a commander of the guard. She used to run a little farm. About a year ago she sold one calf and started selling summer hats. To spend $350 at once was a large sum for her, but she overcame her doubts and invested in hats. As a result, she earned around $200 and this allows her to pay for her children’s education.

Jypar has a desire to expand her business and to do that she needs a loan. With half of the loan she wants to buy men’s and women’s hats, and with the other half she wants to purchase children’s Panama hats. She plans to get a container and achieve $1,200 turnover. As her children grow, so do her expenses for their education. Owning and running her own container would let her meet her growing needs. 

The other members of the group are Guljamal, Jailobai and Tojihon. Guljamal is 42. She has been selling women’s clothes and has raised six children. Her spouse works as an unskilled laborer. Guljamal needs a loan to make a repair at her house, since summer is the best time to do this.

Jailobai, 38, is married. He is occupied with selling cosmetics, household goods, detergents and women’s hygienic cleansers. Four years ago he obtained a loan and started his business. So far he has bought a house and livestock. Now he needs another loan to buy different brands of detergents.

Tojihon is 29. Together with her husband, she sells men’s clothing, pants and jogging trousers. After nine years of hard work, they were able to buy a house. They want to purchase more items of clothing to attract more customers and eventually increase family income, since they intend to save funds for their sole daughter’s education.  But to do that they need to obtain a loan.


======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept:  People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase men's, women's and kids' hats for the store

loans.name: Heydi Lizeth

texts.es: La joven Heydi Liseth U. Álvarez , tiene la edad de 21 años , habita en el barrio Pilas Orientales , ubicado en Masaya , junto a su esposo el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace tres años ella  trabaja como agricultora , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , ella inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de su suegro . Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una buena producción y poder ofertar al mercado a buen precio.
texts.en:
The young Heydi Liseth U. Álvarez is 21 years old and lives in the neighborhood called Pilas Orientales, located in Masaya, along with her husband which she supports with the expenses of the home. She has two children in her care. The plans with regard to her family is to improve their living conditions. For three years she has worked as a farmer. The greatest difficulty that she is presented with is the lack of financing. She began this activity with the support of her father-in-law. With the loan she is going to buy fertilizers and supplies to obtain a good production and to be able to offer her crops to the market for a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sovann C. is a villager in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates both rice and vegetables. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile and she does not have enough money to pay for paddy farming. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides, gasoline, and to hire laborers to work on the field.

Mrs. Sovann C.’s husband, Mr. Art Sophal, is a construction worker. He is shown on the right in the photo. This couple has a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, gasoline, and to hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet   sells planks. She is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in the business for sometime now. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more planks to sells. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Agonhoue Lucie

texts.fr: F. Agonhoue Lucie est née le 01/01/1984 à Abomey. Lucie est mariée à EZIN Saturnin, un agent de l’Office des Poste et Télécommunication du Bénin. Ce couple a à sa charge cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont quatre sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis vingt deux ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari de Lucie qui assure les charges de la famille. Ceci permet à Lucie d’utiliser les revenus de son activité pour mieux développer celle-ci. Lucie vend des vivres (maïs, mil, sorgho, sucre en poudre, riz, farine de manioc, haricot, huile d’arachide, etc.) et du charbon de bois. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Béatrice achète ses produits. Lucie a déjà sept ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Lucie a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Lucie demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de sacs de maïs, de haricot, de riz et de bidons d’huile d’arachide.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en: Faustina is thirty-two years old. She is married and has two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Faustina is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies to other retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. Faustina hawks items in her community. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies in bulk

loans.name: Kayode

texts.en:
Kayode sells drinks of different kinds. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is 38 and married with seven children. Kayode has been in this business for over 16 years because he loves selling drinks. He assists his family with part of his profit. 

Kayode hopes for a loan of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks and a generator to cool drinks. With this, he will attract more customers and meet their demand. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and a generator for cool drinks

loans.name: Méta Niassé

texts.fr: Méta Niassé MANE est une femme de 44 ans; elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont elle a la charge. Depuis 7 ans et demi elle milite dans le Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO et y a fait des performances remarquables. Elle est vendeuse d'huile de palme et de cacahouètes, son crédit lui permettra de renforcer ses activités afin de se procurer des bénéfices afin de pouvoir participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Méta Niassé Mané, aged 44, is married and the mother of six children whom she supports. She has been an active member of the village bank Kandé Banéto with remarkable achievements for seven and a half years. Méta Niassé is active in the sale of palm oil and peanuts. This loan will enable her to strengthen her business. She will use her profit to be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen her business finances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted groceries in bulk

loans.name: Mariuxi Del Rocio

texts.es:
En el Banco Comunal Colón se reúne en la parroquia Colón perteneciente a la ciudad de Portoviejo, en este banco pudimos conversar con la señora 

Casada desde hace 14 años, tiene tres hijos ella nació en Colón, hace 5 años empezó con las ventas de Yanbal (Cosméticos vendidos por catalogo), a la señora Mariuxi siempre le han gustado los negocios antes ella tenia las ventas de artículos del hogar pero se le presentó la oportunidad de empezar algo nuevo y la hermana le ayuda a que ingrese en las ventas de los productos de Yanbal aprendió del negocio y después ella se puso lo propio continuando con las ventas de estos productos.

Todos los meses hace los pedidos según lo que los clientes deseen hay veces que tiene que invertir hasta 500  dólares en pedidos, ya tiene sus clientes fijos que son muy responsables  para esta época del año es cuando más vende.

Mariuxi es una mujer muy trabajadora no descansa con este préstamo que va a recibir de la fundación, invertirá en gran parte para los productos y la otra parte en el negocio de los boyo (Plátano verde con maní y carne) que es un plato típico de la zona de Manabí, ella junto a la tía del esposo ya tiene algún tiempo trabajando en la preparación de este delicioso plato, tiene sus pedidos que han llegado hasta preparar 1300 bollos en una semana, y es una manera de ayudarse con esta venta.
texts.en:
The communal group Colón meets in a church named Colon located in Portoviejo. It was here we could talk with the client.

She has been married for 14 years and has three children. She was born in Colón and 5 years ago started selling Yanbal cosmetics from a catalog. Señora Mariuxi always has liked this business. Before she sold household items. The opportunity presented itself to start something new and with the help of her sister, she started selling Yanbal products. She learned this business and after started selling these products alone.

Every month there are times when she must invest up to $500 in orders. Already she has regular clients who are very dependable in this part of the year with the most sales.

Mariuxi is a very hard working woman who won’t rest with this loan she is going to receive from the Foundacion. She is going to invest most of it in products and the other part in her boyo business (green bananas with noodles and beef) which is a typical dish from the Manabí zone. She, together with the aunt of her husband, have been working making this delicious dish for some time now. Her orders have reached 1300 bollos a week and this loan will help with these sales.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfumes, lip sticks and Yambal products

loans.name: Ñamba'apo Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
El comité Ñamba'apo Oñondivepa nace hace poco más de 1 año después que varias señoras que ya se tenían experiencia en trabajo en comité decidieron empezar de nuevo. 
Las mismas son del asentamiento Marquetalia, son bastante estrictas y rigurosas en cuanto al cumplimiento en el comité, gracias a ello han logrado cancelar de manera excelente todos sus créditos.   
En promedio reciben cada una  635,924 gs., el cual será invertido en la compra de artículos que serán vendidos en sus respectivas actividades comerciales.
Este es un asentamiento con familias muy pobres pero que a pesar de todo lograron sobre llevar toda las necesidades que cada familia pasa, mediante el esfuerzo especialmente de las madres que realizan cualquier trabajo para mantener y alimentar a sus hijos.
Así como Ña Mercedes existe mucho en el asentamiento ella es una señora madre soltera de tres hijos quien se dedica al reciclaje y actualmente con el crédito de la Fundación pudo poner un puesto de ventas de empanadas y gracias a eso ya no necesitan sacrificarse tanto y por ello agradece a la fundación.

texts.en:
The group Ñamba'apo Oñondivepa ("Let's work together" in Guarani) was born a year ago after some women who already had experience working in a group, decided to start anew. The women come from the hamlet of Marquetalia, and are strict about following the rules of the group, thanks to which they have been able to pay all of their loans with an excellent record. On average, each member receives Gs. 635,924 (approx. U$D 140) which will buy supplies and products that each member will sell in their respective business. The hamlet's families are very poor, but still they have continued to survive and fulfill the needs that every family has thanks to the effort of the women who will take on any job to support and feed their children. There are many women in this community like Mercedes, who is a single mother of three children. She currently collects materials to recycle, but with a loan from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya, she was able to start a business selling "empanadas" (turnovers) at a street vending stand. Thanks to her stand, she no longer needs to make so many sacrifices and for that, she is thankful to the Fundación. 1) Limpia G. - Snack bar 2) Maria F. - Clothing sales 3) Norma M. - Beverage and food sales 4) Teofila Avalo - Fruit and vegetable sales 5) Beatriz D. - Fruit and vegetable sales 6) Mercedes I. - "Empanada" sales 7) Sixta A. - Beverage sales 8) Expedita B. - Food sales 9) Mirian R. - Children clothing sales 10) Dolores B. - Food sales 11) Norma A. - Food sales 12) Evangelista Z. - Charcoal sales 13) Adelina Cañete - Sweets and candy sales 14) Liz Ocampos - Clothing sales 15) Teodosia C. - Perfume sales 16) Juana V. - Clothing sales 17) Mercedes Z. - Clothing sales

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products to increase their sales

loans.name: Feri

texts.en:
Feri L. is 22 and married with 2 children (ages 6 and 11).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Feri has 4 years of experience in this business.  Feri needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 230 tala or US $96 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Feri joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Feri's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Feri L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2.23 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Одинаева Латофат проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 36 лет. Разведена, имеет 4 детей. Одинаева Латофат арендует торговую точку. В области торговли работает более 6 лет. Одинаева Латофат продает детскую одежду. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Latofat O. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 36 years old, divorced and has 4 children. Latofat leases a retail outlet. She has been working in the retail sales field for over 6 years. Latofat sells children's clothing. She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Aidee  Ninfa Giménez quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La Sra. Maria D. la Cruz P. se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas al por mayor, logrando D. ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad D. bebidas frescas a sus clientes.

La Sra. Aidee Ninfa Giménez se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestibles, logrando obtener mayor variedad D. minutas  que ofrecer a su clientela.

La Sra. Juana D. la Cruz O. se dedica a la venta D. Frutas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. Frutas en general, obteniendo así mayor variedad D. frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes.

La Sra. Irma Concepción M. se dedica a la venta D. Producto D. Limpieza, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. insumo para la elaboración D. los productos D. limpieza, logrando D. ese modo ofrecer mayor  variedad D. productos D. limpieza a sus clientes.

La Sra. Gloria Ramona M. se dedica a la venta D. comestible, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestible, logrando ofrecer variedad y calidad D. minutas a sus clientes.

La Sra. Yenny Elizabeth B. se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. esos productos en general, logrando D. ese modo  ofrecer buena calidad y variedad D. cosméticos a su clientela.

La Sra. Izabel B. se dedica a la venta D. helados,  invirtió el dinero en la compra D. Helados al por mayor, logrando ofrecer  buenos y variados sabores D. helados a sus clientes.

La Sra. Angelica Maria I. se dedica a la venta D. gas, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. gas al por mayor, logrando ofrecer calidad D. gas a su clientela

La Sra. Gloria Graciela C. es costurera, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. materiales para su trabajo ( telas, hilos, tijeras, etc.) logrando ofrecer buena variedad D.  prendas  a sus clientes.

La Sra. Lucia B. se dedica ala venta D. bebidas en general,  invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas en general, logrando D. ese modo ofrecer mayor variedad D. bebidas frescas a sus clientes.

La Sra. Maria Lourdes B. se dedica a la venta D. Comestibles, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. ingredientes para la elaboración D. los comestibles, logrando D. eso modo ofrecer una buena variedad D. minutas a sus clientes.

La Sra. Aurora A. es costurera, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. elementos para su trabajo (telas, goma, hilos, accesorios, etc.) ofreciendo  calidad y variedad D. prendas a su clientela.

La Sra. Emilce Elizabeth S. posee una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. mercaderías en general ( embutidos, panificados, bebidas, lácteos, etc.),logrando ofrecer una  buena variedad D. mercaderías a sus clientes.

La Sra. Nancy Petrona B. se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir, invirtió el  dinero en la compra D. prendas D. vestir, logrando ofrecer D. ese modo buena variedad D. prendas D. vestir a sus clientes.

La Sra. Cristina Marisol N. se dedica a la venta D. bebidas              en general, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. bebidas en general, logrando así ofrecer una buena variedad D. bebidas frescas a sus clientes. 

La Sra. Verónica Aguilera D. O. posee un kiosco, invirtió el dinero en la compra D. mercadería en general (lácteos, comestibles, bebidas, panificados, etc.) logrando ofrecer una buena variedad D. mercaderías a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group started when Sra. Aidee Ninfa Giménez contacted her friends and invited them to organize a committee to join the Women’s Entrepreneurship Program.

Sra. Maria D. la Cruz P. sells beverages and will use her loan to buy more beverages in bulk so that she can offer a greater variety of cold drinks to her customers.

Sra. Aidee Ninfa Giménez sells prepared foods and will use her loan to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes and offering customers a wider variety of items on her menu.

Sra. Juana D. la Cruz O. sells fruit and will use her loan to buy more fruit and proviD. her customers with a wider variety.

Sra. Irma Concepción M. sells cleaning products and will use her loan to buy the supplies needed to make these products. She also hopes to offer her customers with a wider variety of cleaning products.

Sra. Gloria Ramona M. sells prepared foods and will use her loan to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes and offering customers a wider variety of items on her menu.

Sra. Yenny Elizabeth B. sells cosmetics and will use her loan to buy more of these products so that she offer her customers a wider variety of cosmetics that are of good quality.

Sra. Izabel B. sells ice cream and will use her loan to buy ice cream at wholesale with hopes of providing her customers a good product in a variety of flavors.

Sra. Angelica Maria I. sells gas and will use her loan to buy more gas at wholesale prices and continue offering this product to her customers.

Sra. Gloria Graciela C. is a seamstress and will use her loan to buy materials (fabric, thread, scissors, etc.) needed for her work. She hopes to offer her customers a variety of garments.

Sra. Lucia B. sells beverages and will use her loan to buy more of them so that she can offer her customers a variety of cold drinks.

Sra. Maria Lourdes B. sells prepared foods and will use her loan to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes and offering customers a wider variety of items on her menu.

Sra. Aurora A. is a seamstress and will use her loan to buy materials (fabric, elastic, thread, accessories, etc.) needed for her work. She hopes to offer her customers a variety of garments.

Sra. Emilce Elizabeth S. has a convenience store and will use her loan to buy general merchandise (sausages, baked goods, beverages, dairy products, etc.) so that she can offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

Sra. Nancy Petrona B. sells clothing and will user her loan to buy more inventory so that she can offer her customers a wider selection.

Sra. Cristina Marisol N. sells beverages and will use her loan to buy more of them so that she can offer her customers a variety of cold drinks.

Sra. Verónica Aguilera D. O. has a kiosk from which she sells general merchandise (dairy products, snacks, beverages, baked goods, etc.). She will use her loan to buy more of these products so that she can offer her customers a wider variety.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Obadiah

texts.en:
Obadiah is 31 years old and married and has one child who attends school. He has been running a textile business for eight years. Previously, he worked  for the G4S Security Group, but currently he has no extra source of income.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to expand his business and has become financially stable. He hopes to supply masses of clothes and other  textiles country-wide. He describes himself as hardworking and hopes to provide a better education to his children.

He has requested a loan of Kes 90,000 to add to his stock of children’s clothes.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Rustambek

texts.en:
Born in Istaravshan town in 1941, Rustambek now lives with his wife and their adult children. A teacher by profession, Rustambek is also a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Rustambek would like to expand his business into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of 10 000 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer to expand his crop. With part of the loan, he will buy young cattle. The income from it will help him cope with the needs of his large family. Rustambek is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle, seeds, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry C. is 56 years old and she is a villager who lives in Boeng Krum Leu village in Kandal province. She is a pig breeder who can earn a small income to support her family.  She needs a loan to buy pig food and to dig a well for selling water. Her husband, Mr. Son Chhim, is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice. 

This couple has six children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is staying at home and supports the parents' businesses while the other three are students in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: Pig feed and well digging

loans.name: Ndiamé

texts.fr: Ndiamé N. est âgée de 32 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 5 ans et demi et a reçu 11 fois de suite de crédit et en a fait toujours une bonne gestion et remboursé à temps. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle va acheter 10 moutons et les engraisser pendant 5 mois pour les revendre dans les marchés locaux. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndiamé N. is 32 years old, married and the mother of five children, all under her care. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” for 5 ½ years and has been granted 11 successive loans which she always managed well and reimbursed on time. She fattens sheep and will buy 10 sheep to fatten for five months, and resell them in local markets. She participates in the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her self-financing capability

loans.name: C5252 Seeds Of Vision Group

texts.en:
Adeline is 28 years old and is married with three children. She is the president of a team called “Seed Of Vision” and this group is commonly known in the business of selling a variety of goods such as drinks, foodstuffs, and some other goods usually sold in a shop.

Adeline and her team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business with the target of wholesaling to the retailers who operate the same business.

With this business expansion, Adeline and her team will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow each member of the group to start saving for a better future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods such as drinks, foodstuffs, and some other goods

loans.name: Francisco Wilberto

texts.es:
Francisco Wilberto L. H., es casado y con su mujer habita en el barrio Medardo Andino, su esposa se desempeña como conserje, apoyando con sus ingresos a la economía del hogar, ellos tienen 3 hijos adolecentes que cursan la escuela secundaria, Don Francisco se desempeña como Guarda de Seguridad, ellos son una familia de recursos limitados que ambicionan con la apertura de una pulpería y la mejora de la infraestructura del hogar.

Con el apoyo de Kiva el Señor L., espera mejorar las condiciones en las que su familia actualmente habita, razon por la cual solicita este prestamo para las reparaciones de la habitación donde moran, las paredes y el techo presentan una decadencia que amenaza la seguridad e los miembros de la familia, con el préstamo desea comprar los materiales de construcción y así mismo construir una habitación màs, con el fin para mejorar las comodidades y condiciones en las que habitan, este apoyo les apura puesto que se acercan las temporadas de lluvias y vientos fuertes que debilitan aun más la estabilidad en la infraestructura  del hogar.
texts.en:
Francisco Wilberto L. H. is married, and lives with his wife in the Medardo Andino neighborhood. His wife works as a janitor, helping out with the household expenses. They have 3 adolescent children who are in secondary school. Don Francisco works as a security guard. They are a family of limited means that aspires to open a grocery store and improve the infrastructure of their home. With the support of Kiva, Señor L. hopes to improve the conditions in which the family currently lives. For this reason he requests this loan to repair their dwelling. The walls and roof are deteriorated such that they threaten the security of the members of the family. With the loan he hopes to buy construction materials and also add another room, in order to improve the comfort and conditions of the home that they live in. They need this support quickly, since the season of rain and strong winds is approaching, which would further weaken the stability of the infrastructure of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal for roofing and cement

loans.name: Sok Khy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Khy C. is a 31-year-old married woman and a villager who lives in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Roeun Chom, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops. For this farm, Mrs. Sok Khy C. decided to ask for loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to support her crops.

Aside from farming, Mr. Roeun Chom is a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family. He is shown in the photo with his wife. This couple has three children: two are attending the local school while the youngest one is four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa N., a 52-year-old resident of Hinaplanon, Iligan City, is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan, her fourth, for 13000 PHP to be used for the same purpose. Elsa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 58 años, vive en su casa propia, con 2 de sus 4 hijos, pues lo mayores tienen sus propias familias y son independientes.Desde hace 15 años, se dedica a la venta de productos naturales en su  puesto ubicado en el mercado de la zona por donde vive, y por el  tiempo que tiene en este negocio tiene muchos clientes que la visitan frecuentemente. Su trabajo empieza desde muy temprano, todos los días, y se extiende hasta las 5 de la tarde. Aunque su negocio  la tiene muy satisfecha, lo que le disgusta son las largas horas que tiene que permanecer bajo los rayos del sol en el mercado; pero no se desanima y continúa trabajando duro. A pesar de que hace algunos años, enfrento una dura prueba, pues  su puesto se quemo y el hecho le causo algunas heridas, siente que tiene mucho por delante. Para el futuro tiene pensado mejorar su puesto para implementarlo mejor y además quiere renovar las maderas de su puesto, para presentar una mejor imagen ante su clientela.Es el onceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y siempre ha sido muy puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, porque tiene muchas ganas de continuar progresando.Julia tiene planeado invertir el  dinero solicitado en la compra  de mayor cantidad de productos naturales, con lo cual espera obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Julia, 58, lives in her own home with two of her four children because the oldest ones have their own families and are independent. For the past 15 years she has sold natural products in a sales stall she has in one of the markets near her home. Because of the long time she has been in business, she has quite a few regular customers that visit her frequently. She is open for business daily from very early in the morning until 5pm. Although her work is very satisfying what she dislikes about it is spending long hours under the relentless sun in the market. However, she doesn’t become discouraged and continues to work hard. Despite facing quite a hardship a few years ago when her stall burned down and she was injured in the fire she feels she still has much to look forward to. For the future, she plans to improve her stall both by stocking it better and by replacing the lumber in it in order to improve its appearance and make it more appealing to her customers. This is her 11th loan with MFP. She has always repaid on time because she wants to continue to make progress. Julia plans to use the funds to buy larger amounts of natural products hoping thereby to obtain increased earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural products for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Norm Ouch Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has 19 people who live in Trapeang Dang Tuek village in Takeo province. Mrs. Norm O. is 43 years old and is a village bank president. She was selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan in various ways. Mrs. O. is a pig breeder and a cake seller while her husband, Mr. Yav Born, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support his family. He is also a farming laborer. Since her business is going well she wants to expand. To improve her pig breeding, Mrs. Norm O. is requesting a loan to buy more piglets and to buy fertilizer.
