She is a mother of three children, who are studying in local public school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and fertilizer

loans.name: Rodelisa

texts.en:
Rodelisa S. is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. She is 48 years old. Rodelisa is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rodelisa owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rodelisa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rodelisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rodelisa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rodelisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil.

loans.name: Sem Pean's Group

texts.en:
There are four borrowers who are taking this loan together. The group's leader, Mrs. Sem P., is 55 years old, married and has two children. She has built a store in front of her house where she sells a few items such as cooked ingredients and sweets to the neighbors for a profit. Her husband, Pek Veth, manages their business as well as fishing at the river. Sem P. will be using her loan from Kiva to purchase extra grocery items to sell. This will allow her to accrue a profit to better meet her entire family’s daily expenses. The other borrowers include:
Mr. C., a fisherman, is asking for a loan to support his business.
Mrs. C. will be using her loan to buy nets and traps for fishing.
Mr. T., a fish catcher, is applying for a loan to buy more tools for fishing activities. (Mr. T. was not available when the photo was taken, so his wife is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To purchase extra grocery items to sell

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La Sra. Nicasia D. Leon  es cliente antigua  D. nuestra entidad, es casada y vive en casa propia. 
La titular cuenta con una mercería hace 7 años, contando con buena clientela formada a la fecha, dicho negocio se encuentra en su domicilio.
 Dicho préstamo la titular ha retirado para la compra D. juguetes, ropas y artículos D. librería. A la fecha la Sra. Nicasia ha retirado 6 prestamos desD. el año  2005.
Dicho préstamo la titular considera que le dejara un mejor margen D. ganancia a su negocio y a la vez le dará un  mejor nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nicasia D. Leon is a long-time client of ours, is married, and lives in her own home. She has had a dry-goods store for 7 years, and currently has a loyal customer base. She operates the business out of her home. She has requested this loan to purchase toys, clothing, and stationery items. Since 2005, she has taken out 6 loans. The borrower believes that this loan will allow her a wider profit margin for her business and also proviD. her with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercaderias ropas, juguetes, y articulos de libreria.

loans.name: Adela De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Adela de Los Ángeles H. O. de 34 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual se dedica a la carpintería para poder ganarse la vida. Ella vive sola en casa propia, en Jiquilisco, ubicado en el departamento de Usulután. Desde hace 4 años que Adela posee su propia carpintería en donde trabajo junto a un empleado, el cual es de gran ayuda para ella, ya que en muchas ocasiones el trabajo es bastante. A pesar de ser un oficio bastante duro, Adela ha sabido superar esto y desempeñar un buen papel como carpintera, trabajo en el cual posee varios clientes. Ella trabajo por pedidos previos, elaborando: muebles para la sala, roperos, chineros, sillas, mesas, y otros más. Adela solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de madera de muy buena calidad, así mismo comprar pegamento, serruchos y otras herramientas más.
texts.en:
Adela de Los Ángeles H. O. is 34 years old and is a very hardworking person who works in carpentry to make a living. She lives alone is her own house in Jiquilisco, located in the department of Usulután. For the past four years, Adela has had her own carpenter’s workshop where she works with an employee. He is a great help to her because many times, there is a lot of work. Despite it being difficult work, Adela has known how to overcome this and be a good carpenter, a business in which she has several customers. She works on orders made ahead of time such as living room furniture, closets, china cabinets, chairs, tables, and other items.

Adela is requesting a loan so that she can buy a larger quantity of good-quality wood, as well as glue, saws, and other tools.

loans.use: To purchase wood and raw material for making furniture.

loans.name: Four Roses Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cuatro Rosa está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es doña Sonia A. quien desde hace tiempo se dedica a la realización de sopas los fines de semana ya sea de hueso, de res, mondongo, de pollo, queso…etc. Ella con el crédito comprara carne, las verduras como yuca, quequisque, repollo, ayote, chayote, chilote, cebolla, etc. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Estela de Jesús D. se dedica al destace de cerdo desde hace 10 años el vende tanto la carne como realiza frito, nacatamales, chicharrón y moronga, y Manuela del Carmen O. vende manualidades especialmente Hamacas  desde hace 10 años.
texts.en:
The group named "Cuatro Rosa" is made up of three hard working women. One of them is Sonia A.. For some time she has been cooking soups on the weekends, either bone soup, beef soup, stew, chicken soup, cheese soup, etc. With her loan she will purchase meat and various vegetables.  

Another member of the group is Estela Jesus D. and she has been butchering pigs since she was 10 yeas old. She sells meat, but also prepared foods such as fried meat, tamales, pork rinds, and blood sausage.  Manuela del Carmen O. is also a member of the group and she has sold crafts, especially hammocks, since she was 10 years old.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer as well as covering part of the payment for a plot of land

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo vive en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz. 
Es artesano, realiza trabajos de artesanía en cotillones de cartulina, esponja, para acontecimientos sociales (en Bolivia denominamos cotillones a todos los productos como piñatas, mixturas, serpentinas, etc., que usan para adornar en los acontecimientos sociales).
Es viudo y todos sus hijos son independientes.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de, cartulina, esponja, cola, y papel para continuar su negocio. 
Es la décima primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, y la sexta vez que requiere el apoyo de Kiva. Su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Arturo lives in the zone of Alto San Pedro in the city of La Paz. He is an artisan. He makes party decorations for social events out of foam core and cardboard (in Bolivia parties include products such as piñatas, confetti, streamers, etc. that they use to decorate for social occasions). Arturo is a widower and all his sons are living on their own.
This loan will be used to buy cardboard, foam core, paste and paper in order to maintain his business.
This is his eleventh loan that he has requested from Impro and the sixth time he has asked for support from KIVA. His background qualifies him as a good borrower and he always pays his loans on time.

loans.use: He will buy cardboard, foam core, and paste for his business of making party decorations for social events.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cloth.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet P., from the village of Western, Wao, Lanao del Sur, is 49 years old, married and has five grown children. To make a living, Juliet owns and operates a mini-restaurant serving a variety of meals, including chicken pork adobo, in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 6500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant, she is requesting her second loan for 8000 PHP to purchase additional raw ingredients and use as working capital. Juliet plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the restaurant.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional raw ingredients & working capital

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Yang M., age 37, is a good mother to four children, and she always spends most of her time managing daily activities. Her daily duties include cooking meals, cleaning house, caring for her children, and controlling other property in and around her house. She has a life partner in her husband who works in the construction industry. She has one daughter who often generates income for Yang M. by working as a mobile hairdresser. Yang M.’s daughter wants to open a small shop to provide hairdressing services. Yang M. really wants to help her daughter but she doesn't have enough money to do so. Therefore, Yang M. is applying for a loan from Kiva to help her daughter open a small beauty salon.

loans.use: to help her daughter open a small shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an electric compressor engine

loans.name: Fredy Agustin

texts.es: Fredy tiene 34 años de edad, soltero, carpintero, solicita su primer prestamo en ASDIR para incrementar su capital de trabajo, especificamente compra de materiales como: tablas, reglas y material en general, para carpinteria, en la actividad tiene 10 años de experiencia, lo cual le ha ayudado salir adelante con sus necesidades basicas, su actividad lo inicio ayudando a sus padres quienes desde su niñez le enseñanron el manejo y desarrollo de la misma, en su comunidad es conocido como una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo.
texts.en: Fredy is 34 years old, single and a carpenter.  He is requesting his first loan from ASDIR since he is very committed to his work.  He needs this help to buy materials and thereby provide a better service.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para fabricar muebles

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a married woman who lives in Bantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by fishing and fish vending. Her husband Rogelio, who is 46 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are between 2 and 19 years old. 

Elsa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elsa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 23,000 to buy fishing gear and equipment so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and purchase additional fishing boats. Elsa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Adolphe Alphath

texts.fr:
Homme marié de 33ans et  père de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie de 02 à 18 ans et ayant 2 personnes à sa charge dont 2 enfants vont à l’école. Après la fin de sa formation d’une école de menuiserie, il se lance dans la menuiserie en 2003 avec un capital de 700.000frs et s’approvisionne dans le département de la Likouala. Ses ventes sont de 18.000frs par jour.

Avec le prêt, il compte acheter des planches qui été transformées en meubles, peinture.

Sa vision s’est de racheté sa propre machine qui lui a été pillée lors des événements derniers. Il aimera aussi devenir entrepreneur et avoir sa propre exposition.

Pour sa famille il souhaite léguer tout son héritage à ses enfants. Il jouit d’une bonne moralité.
texts.en:
A married man, 33 years old, he is the father of three children, from 2 to 18 years of age. He has two dependent children who go to school. After finishing his training as a carpenter, he has launched his own shop in 2003, with a starting capital of 700,000 West African francs. He stocks up in the Likouala Department. His daily receipts are about 18,000 francs.

With this loan, he plans to purchase wood planks to be used for making furniture as well as paint. His goal is to be able to buy a new woodworking machine, as his old one was looted during the recent events. He would like to become an entrepreneur and have his own showroom. As to his family, he would like to leave a good legacy to his children. He is of good moral character.

loans.use: Purchasing wood and paint

loans.name: Yung

texts.en:
Yung S. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. 

S. produces palm roof, earning an income of US $2.5 per day. Her husband is employed to cut wood at a furniture shop, earning an income of US $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $24 on food and US $50 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to start a new business as a motor-taxi driver. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a new business

loans.name: Mayra Segovia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA G. LABORA COMO ANALISTA COMERCIAL, TIENE SEIS PERSONA A SU CARGO, ES EL PRIMER CREDITO QUE CEPRODEL LE OTORGA, AGRADECE EL APOYO QUE LE BRINDA POR QUE CON ESTE DESEMBOLSO VA PODER RESOLVER GASTO DE CONSUMO  FAMILIA COMO PAGO DE ENERGIA Y OTROS
texts.en: Ms. Gonzales is a business analyst. She has six people in her care. This is the first loan she has been granted by CEPRODEL. She is thankful for the support provided because thanks to this credit she will be able to pay for family expenses such as electricity bill and others.

loans.use: To pay for family expenses.

loans.name: Audencia Zaqueu

texts.pt:
Audencia Zaqueu M. nasceu na cidade da Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique solteira e mãe de 2 filhos  de 22 e 25 anos de idade todos ainda vao a escola. Fez somente 6ª classe nao continuou porque os pais nao tinham condicoes financeiras para ela continuar. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e nao sustenta mais ninguem para alem da sua familia.

Nunca saiu de Maputo, tem um negocio proprio em sua casa e desenvolve ha mais de 6 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de  6.000.00mt a 7.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte mensalmente em sua conta bancaria.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seus amigos que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (Guarda fatos, mesa, cadeiras, estantes, comodas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock. O emprestimo anterior foi de 15.000.00 e foi aplicado para o comercio.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para construir um salao de cabeleirero e uma banca comercial.
texts.en:
Audencia Zaqueu M. was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique.  She is a single mother of two children ages 22 and 25, who are still in school.  She only completed school through the sixth grade because her parents did not have the financial resources for her to continue.  She lives in her own home with her family and does not support anyone else.  

She has never lived anywhere other than Maputo.  She has had her own business out of her home for more than 6 years.  She does not have any employees and she earns around 6.000.00mt to 7.000.00mt per month, which she uses for household expenses.  She also saves some of her monthly earnings in her bank account.  

Audencia has never had loans in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also clients.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, for 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase products (wardrobes, tables, chairs, shelves, dressers, etc.) to increase her inventory.  Her prior loan was for 15.000.00 and was used for her business. 

She promises to make her payments on time in order to have access to other loans in the future.  She plans to request new loans to build a hair salon and a bank.

loans.use: to purchase products (wardrobes, tables, chairs, shelves, dressers, etc.).

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana de 45 años, es una mujer muy influyente en su familia que ella trabaja de servicios domésticos en casa en casa.

Ella labora diariamente prestando sus servicios a personas que la necesitan y la conocen . Su esposo trabaja como guardia de seguridad. Tienen 4 hijos que cual ellos le dan de todo para ayudarlos. Con la ayuda del préstamo ella desea comprar materiales de construcción como cemento piedras arena. Ella anhela terminar su vivienda para tener una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 45 years old and is very influential in her family.  She works as a maid from house to house.

She works daily, providing her services to people who know her and need her.  Her husband works as a security guard.  They have four children to whom they give their all.  She wants to buy building materials such as with the help of this loan cement, stone, and sand with the help of this loan.  Her goal is to have a better home so that her family can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Ubaldo

texts.en:
Ubaldo, age 58, owns and operates a business offering motor transport services. Ubaldo has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. He and his wife have one grown child and live in the village of Poblacion 4, Clarin Misamis Occidental. 

Earlier this year, Ubaldo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Ubaldo is requesting his first loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Johnny

texts.en:
Johnny is 42 years old and is married with 2 children. He is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He has been growing rice for 25 years. Johnny earns about 5000 PHP per month from farming. Aside from rice farming, Johnny also raises pigs in his backyard. The family also has a sari-sari (variety) store that his wife manages.

Johnny's loan will be used to buy fertilizer, piglets and feed. He hopes for his businesses to prosper and for his family's living situation to improve.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, piglets and feed

loans.name: Ansam

texts.en:
Ansam is a 40-year-old woman from Tulkarem city in Palestine. Her youngest son had an accident when he was young and suffers from a disability in the lower part of his body. He is 12 years old now. 

Ansam took out a loan from FATEN to fix her son's wheelchair and install an electronic stick to help him control his movement independently. 

Ansam's husband can't afford to buy a new wheelchair or pay to repair the existing one as he works on a daily wage basis. 

Ansam appears in the picture here in FATEN's branch in Tulkarem.

loans.use: to repair and upgrade a wheelchair her son

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es: Nélida tiene 47 años, es madre soltera de una niña y vive en una propiedad que cuida en la que actualmente vive. Tiene 8 años de experiencia en la venta de cosméticos, y lo hace a domicilio, de esta manera todos los días sale a  ofrecer sus productos que muestra por catálogo. La marca que vende es de prestigio y eso la favorece en sus ventas, además su gran entusiasmo que tiene ha cumplido sus propias metas que la satisfacen personalmente y se propone tener ventas mayores para asegurarse en sus ganancias. Una de las ventajas que ha visto de su negocio es que recibe premios de la marca que vende por catálogo siempre y cuando supera la cantidad de productos, así puede incrementar sus ganancias. Son 4 ciclos de crédito que tiene con MFP de la cuales considera que es su mejor aliada para crecer y afrontar de manera oportuna su negocio, además cuando le ofrecen los cosméticos a un precio bajo por ello necesita ser comprada al contado. Por tanto espera el apoyo de todos ustedes. Con este dinero comprará más mercadería en cosméticos.
texts.en:
47 year-old Nélida is a single mother and has one daughter.  She lives in a property which she is looking after.  She has eight years experience selling cosmetics and makes her sales door to door.  Every day she goes out to sell the products that she shows her customers through her catalogs.  The brand she sells is a well known one and this favors her when it comes to making her sales.  Through her great enthusiasm, she has accomplished her own goals which makes her happy.  She plans to make more sales in order to safeguard her profits.

One of the advantages that Nélida has seen in this business is that she receives prizes from the brand that make the cosmetics she sells whenever she exceeds a certain quantity of products sold and this enables her to increase her profits.

Nélida has been working with MFP for four loan cycles.  She considers MFP to be her best ally in growing her business and responding to her customers in a timely manner.  When the company offers her cosmetics at a low price, she needs to pay for them in cash.  Nélida hopes to receive your support.  She will use this loan money to buy more cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Warsiti

texts.en: Warsiti is a soft drink agent. She began this business in 1998 and has had as many as 21 loan cycles with VFI. She started her business small and has become a big agent. As a result, she has been able to educate her children, buy a motorcycle, and even a house. Her current loan from VFI is being used to increase the stock of soft drinks, also for gas and equipping the inside of her shop. She has future plans to renovate her place of business. She is very happy with the VFI loan because of the easy access and loan processes.

loans.use: to pay for soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Johannes

texts.en: Johannes is 25 years old and single with no children. He runs a provision and beverage shop in Lumley – a neighborhood in Freetown. He has been in this business for three years and sells sugar, milk, bread, cigarettes and soft drinks at his store. His business is the main source of income he has. He says that the main challenge to his business is lack of sufficient financing for him to expand. He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provisions and soft drinks. Johannes says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to import goods from abroad.

loans.use: To purchase more milk, cigarettes, and soft drinks

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia has five children. All of the children are in school. She is a widow. She has been in this business for two years. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan to expand her business. The profit that she will earn from the business, she will use to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water and soda to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther  lives in  Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sister and her children).  Esther has a business of a food stall . She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Esther sells her products at the market. 

Esther has requested  for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, cassava and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Esther include seasonality, thieves and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to  sell at wholesale only and  to start going to villages for food staffs.    Esther lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, cassava and  Irish potatoes

loans.name: Francisca Elizabeth

texts.es:
Francisca, vive con su familia conformada por su esposo y cuatro hijos D. los cuales solo dos dependen D. sus ingresos, viven en una vivienda alquilada. Francisca se dedica a la venta D. productos lácteos, comenzó este negocio con el apoyo D. unas amistades,  actualmente tiene experiencia y desea invertir en el negocio.

Por segunda ocasión solicita un préstamo que le permita comprar leche para la producción D. queso, crema, cuajada.
Su objetivo es crecer, ampliar el negocio, comprar casa propia, para vivir más cómodamente con su familia.
texts.en: Francisca lives with her husband and four children in a rented home, and all depend on her support. Francisca sells dairy products, a business that she started with the help of friends; she has gained experience and now wants to invest in her business.   This is her second loan, which will allow her to buy milk to process into cheese, cream and curds.  Her goal is to grow and expand her business, and to buy her own house for her family to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy milk to process into cheese, cream and curds

loans.name: Julissa

texts.es:
Julissa nació en el departamento del Cusco al sur del Perú. Actualmente, Julissa tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos.

Actualmente, Julissa vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades, ella trabaja como empleada del hogar. En esta oportunidad Julissa requiere el préstamo para construir su casa. 

El Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Nieves” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Julissa was born in the Department of Cusco, in the South of Peru. Currently, Julissa is 35 years old.  She is single, and has no children as of yet.

Julissa lives today in the city where she was born, and this is where she works. She works as a housekeeper. On this occasion, Julissa is requesting the loan to build a house for herself.

The "Virgen de las Nieves" Communal Bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco (in Peru). Cusco is well-known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and also because it is the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to build a house for herself.

loans.name: Kelementina

texts.en:
Kelementina is a 50 year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are in the school. She has a business of selling simsim and beans in the Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for ten years.

Kelementina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions for sale. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more simsim, beans and onions for sale

loans.name: Leena

texts.en: Leena is a 30 year old young woman.  She is married with one son, and her husband is a doctor and has a medical laboratory.  The family also has another source of income from agriculture.  Leena wants to help her husband in purchasing some medical equipment for the laboratory, but the amount of money she has is not enough to pay for it.  So she needs to take a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN.  When Leena gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, that will enable her to help her husband get the medical equipment.  This equipment will help to expand and improve his work and increase his income which will help to provide better life conditions for the family.  Leena is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in his laboratory.

loans.use: To purchase laboratory medical equipment for the laboratory that her husband owns.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 58 years old and is married with six children.

Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

Myrna has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Myrna aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Solidario Victoria 3 Group

texts.es:
Solidario Victoria 3.
Este grupo esta Conformado por Tres Señoras muy trabajadoras y nuy luchadoras por tener un futuro mejor cada dia,una de ellas es la lider de este solidario quen es Victoria,de 35 años de edad y tiene 2 hijos ella se dedica a la confeccion de tejidos tipicos desde hace 10 años,ella nos cuenta que es una actividad que realisa dia a dia para asi obtener un ingreso que ayude a la mantencion de su hijos,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la confeccion de tejidos tipicos.al igual que las siguientes socias estan solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio,y asi continuar con un capital mas grande y obtener mejores ganacias.
texts.en:
Group Victoria 3
This group is made up of three very hard working women who have fought to have a better future every day. One of them, named Victoria, is the leader of the group.  She is 35 years old and has two children . She has worked for the past ten years making traditional fabrics.  She tells us that it is an activity completed day by day in order to obtain an income that will help in maintaining her children.  She is requesting a loan in order to buy raw materials used in making traditional fabrics.  In the same way, the other group members are asking for a loan in order to purchase products for their businesses, and thus continue with greater capital and obtain better earnings.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making traditional fabrics

loans.name: Quy

texts.en: Quy is 38 years old. She lives in Cho town, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh.  She is married and has two children who are going to school. She always wants to have a better standard of living and  to have her children have a better education. So she tries to work hard. She has a store where she sells cobbler. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND).  She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and always repaid punctually.  In this loan cycL. she would like to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other things to invest in her store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other things for her store.

loans.name: Jonita

texts.en:
Jonita is 39 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jonita has a tailoring shop that makes and repairs school and office uniforms, dresses and pillow cases. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 in order to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Jonita has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jonita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loans.name: Andrea Estefania

texts.es:
Andrea es madre soltera de 35 años. Ella tiene un hijo menor de edad, Andrea  se dedica a la venta de postres, ya que que su tía le enseño lo que es la elaboración de tortas , (empanadas, alfajores, etc) desde joven,  ella es una mujer responsable, honesta y con muchas de sacar adelante a su familia, empezó en este negocio desde hace 2 años y gana un promedio de S/. 200.00 soles semanales, con el crédito que le otorgará Kiva de S/. 2000,00 soles lo invertirá para la compra de  moldes, maquetas, . Uno de sus sueños sería tener su negocio en un sitio mejor ( donde no halla delincuencia), para que pudiera tener mas ingresos en su negocio y seguir cursos de repostería para que en un futuro no muy lejano tenga su propia empresa para que sea reconocida a a nivel nacional y que su familia pudiera tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Andrea vive y trabaja en Imperial (Cañete), commonly known simply as Cañete, Perú. Located about an hour and a half hours south of Lima, Cañete, with its sandy beaches, pre-Incan ruins, and production of Perú’s adored national liquor Pisco (a kind of grape brandy) has long been a tourist destination for wealthy Peruvians. But the real Cañete is a warm and peaceful town with a large Afro-Peruvian population, remnants of an indigenous path, and influences from the Spanish empire. The city, along with others near the Pacific coast, was damaged during the 2001 and 2007 Peru earthquakes, but has preserved as it has for much of its history.
texts.en:
Andrea, 35, is a single mother; she has a minor son.  Andrea sells desserts since her aunt taught her how to make baked goods (turnovers, sponge cake, etc.) since she was a young woman.  She is a responsible, honest woman who very much wants to get ahead with her family.  She started the business two years ago and earns approximately 200 soles per week.  She will use the 2000 sol loan from Kiva to buy cake molds.  One of her dreams is to have her business in a better location (where there is no crime) so that she can earn more income in her business and take pastry making courses so that in the not too distant future she can have her own firm and be known nationally so that her family can have a better quality of life.

Andrea lives and works in Imperial (Cañete), commonly known simply as Cañete, Perú. Located about an hour and a half hours south of Lima, Cañete, with its sandy beaches, pre-Incan ruins, and production of Perú’s adored national liquor Pisco (a kind of grape brandy) has long been a tourist destination for wealthy Peruvians. But the real Cañete is a warm and peaceful town with a large Afro-Peruvian population, remnants of an indigenous path, and influences from the Spanish empire. The city, along with others near the Pacific coast, was damaged during the 2001 and 2007 Peru earthquakes, but has preserved as it has for much of its history.

loans.use: to buy cake molds.

loans.name: Borik

texts.ru:
Борик родился 1952 г., окончил среднюю школу в деревне  Арцваник, после окончание школы поступил и окончил Капанский строительный техникум.
Борик женат и у него трое детей: две дочери и сын. Обе дочери замужем и живут отдельно от родителей, а сын Борика сейчас служит в армии. 
Борик занимается сельским хозяйством более 10 лет в деревне Чапни, Сьюникского региона. Он выращивает овощи и фрукты, а также занимается пчеловодством. Выращенные овощи и фрукты Борик реализует в городах Капане и Каджаране, но особенной популярностью пользуется его мед, так как он всегда высокого качества. Благодаря занятию сельским хозяйством, Борик имеет возможность содержать свою семью. 
Сумма кредита в размере 1.000.000 драм необходима Борику для приобретения нескольких новых ульев, парафина для рамок, а также для покупки самих рамок для меда. 
Данный кредит является третьим по счету, получаемым Бориком от организации Нор Оризон.
texts.en:
Borik was born in 1952.  He graduated from high school in the Artsvanik village.  Upon completing his studies, Borik entered the Kapansky Civil Engineering College where he got his degree.  

Borik is married and has three children – two daughters and one son.  His daughters are married and live away from the parental home.  Borik's son is currently serving in the Army.  

Borik has been farming for over 10 years in the Chapni village of the Syunik area.  He grows fruit and vegetables and is also a beekeeper.  Borik sells the fruit and vegetables that he grows in Kapan and Kadzharan, but it is his honey that is particularly sought after because of its consistently high quality.  His farming business allows Borik to provide for his family.  

Borik needs a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 AMD to buy some new beehives, wax for the frames and frames for the honey.  This will be the third loan granted to him by Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy some new beehives, wax and frames for his beekeeping business

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy is a tailor specializing in formal and traditional Khmer clothing for weddings and other occasions. However, she has neither her own sewing machine or tailoring shop but instead is hired for fees. Her husband, Vanthan, is a construction worker.

Residing in a Phnom Penh suburb, the couple has been married for seven years and have two daughters, one of whom attends school while the other is yet too young to attend. Navy is now requesting a loan of $1000 to assist her husband’s construction business through the purchase of construction materials.

loans.use: to assist her husband’s construction business through the purchase of construction materials.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea is 48 years old and is in the business of raising hogs in Baray district. She generates approximately $6.00 each day through the business. 

Mrs. Chea has been engaged in her business for more than 4 years. She has gained good experience from it and is able to manage her work well to keep her pigs from illness and to keep them clean.

Mrs. Chea has five children, two of whom are married, while the remaining three are now working. With the amount she has requested from HKL, she will use it to purchase a used motorbike for her three employed children to commute to their workplaces. For her business goal, she plans to expand her farmland and increase her output for both her own daily food use and for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorbike

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en: Choeurn, 34, is married. She resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker. Her husband has been involved in breeding pigs for over six years. He has extensive experience and is successful in his career. One of her children is a construction worker. In order to improve her family economy, Choeurn is requesting for a loan of USD 700 to purchase more sows to breed in order to produce more piglets to sell. By doing so, her family income will be increased. In the future, she would like to expand her husband's business, renew her house and support her children to study until they get Bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more sows to breed in order to produce piglets to sell.

loans.name: Agustine  Ochieng

texts.en:
Augustine was born in Kolwa west Kisumu District . He has been doing business using a rented motorcycle for  for two years. He is married with two children and he is happy to own his own bike. Augustine has committed to   provide transport to CHWs targeting the youth and prevention of drug abuse. He is also interested in supporting youth groups counseling on HIV/AIDs prevention. 

The motorcycle will enable Augustine provide for his family and support the community as well, He hopes to encourage other motorcycle taxi drivers enroll in the CHW support programme in order to adequately cover all remote locations of Kisumu county.

Augustine is an experienced motorcycle taxi trader and he hopes to make money and buy another motorcycle in 10 months and support two CHWs.

loans.use: To pay for Motorcycle for Community Health work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Elias David

texts.en:
David is 48 years old and lives in the municipality of Sahagun. He has a son who helps him a lot in his work and to provide for the family, so he feels very proud of him. 2 years ago he started a stationery where he sells a great amount of products, something he learned from his brother in law.

The inputs can be really expensive and he wants to invest in his business, but right now he doesn’t have the money to do this. He expects that the investment will help him improve the conditions of the stationery and make it sustainable. He’s asking for a loan so he can make some adjustments to the stationery and to pay for some work force. 

David wants also to improve his house, something he hopes the business will let him do. Help David now with the loan he needs.

loans.use: make some adjustments to the stationery and to pay for some work force

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy one-day old chicks, their feeds and medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and prepare his land for commercial farming

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina has a small truck which her husband drives. They use it to buy and sell sand and stone and also have a moving business. They live in the Irpavil II neighborhood in La Paz. This is the fourth loan she has requested from IMPRO. She has been a first-class borrower, meaning that she has a good history of repayment. This loan will pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy new tires and coverings for the seats. Her work experience and borrowing record recommend her for this loan and her cash flow will be adequate to repay it.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Justina tiene una volqueta (es un pequeño camión) que su esposo maneja. Su negocio es usar la volqueta para la compra y venta de arena, piedra, y mudanzas de clientes que contratan sus servicios. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz y es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito con IMPRO. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para el mantenimiento de su volqueta y la compra de llantas y tapizado de asientos. Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio y el análisis de su flujo de caja muestra resultados satisfactorios para el cumplimiento de su obligación financiera.

loans.use: To maintain a truck and purchase tires.

loans.name: Bébé

texts.fr:
Bébé A. was born in 1977 in Yohono. She is very hard-working and has ten years of experience selling farm implements such as hoes, machetes and shears which her husband makes. Demand for these tools now outstrips her husband's production so Bébé has started buying from other craftsmen as well to maintain her stocks. This year she is asking for a loan of $800 to restock her business and increase her sales.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Madame A. Bébé est née en 1977 à Yohono u. Très dévouée, elle s’est donnée au commerce des outils agricole (houe, coupe-coupe, couteaux) et autres fabriqués par son mari. C’est un commerce qu’elle exerce il y a maintenant 10 ans, ce qui lui confère une grande expérience en la matière. La production de son mari étant très insuffisante pour satisfaire la demande sans cesse croissante, elle est obligée d’acheter auprès d’autres fabricants. Elle fait généralement des stocks de ces outils avant de les revendre. Cette année, elle demande un crédit de $800 afin de pouvoir redynamiser son commerce et améliorer son revenu.

loans.use: To buy farm inplements for resale.

loans.name: Ali Rashid

texts.en:
The R. family lives in Khudat town, in the Khachmaz region. Ali is 50 years old, married and has five children. Four  years ago he started his own business.   He has a lot of regular clients. All come to his café to forget their problems.
He is requesting a loan of $825  to buy  glasses and other necessary things for his cafe.

loans.use: To buy  glasses and other necessary things for his cafe

loans.name: Twiga Group

texts.en:
Prosper P., age 55, is married with 7 children (ages 30, 25, 20, 17, 15, 10 and 7). Prosper has been working as a part-time construction mason for over 35 years. From this job, he earns around $320-360 per month. He and his wife also run a fruit and vegetable stand, which they started 7 years ago. This business makes about $18 a day. The stand, opened from 7am to 8pm, attracts around 60 customers a day.

Prosper is the leader of the loan group “Twiga” (Swahili for “giraffe”), which has 16 members. The other members of his group have businesses dealing with sales of food, table tops, clothing, wood work, cattle, fish, and charcoal. Prosper knows every member of his group personA., since they are all neighbors and have businesses in the same locality. This group borrowed a previous loan together (minus 8 members who were replaced after the loan was repaid), and was able to pay it back successfully. They now hope for a new loan.

Prosper used the previous loan to buy fruits and vegetables for his stand. With the new loan, he hopes to purchase more stock and also enlarge his stall.

loans.use: To expand businesses

loans.name: Moega

texts.en: Moega is a 49-year-old mother from the Vavau village. She has two children and she is one of the old members of the centre. Her first loan she used to buy materials for her taro plantation. She is now applying for another loan to fix the wall of her house and to help out with her plantation.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies for her plantation and for home improvements

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Señora Sonia belongs to the community bank called 'Banco Comunal Cesar Vallejo' which is located in Calleria, Ucayali. She is 46 years old. She has 2 children who still depend on her financially. She's married and her husband is a salesman. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small business of selling and buying metals.

She currently runs her business of selling and buying all types of metals. She also raises chickens and she also rents rooms. She gets up at 5:00 in the morning to feed her chickens, she then prepares breakfast for her family and lastly she attends to her business of selling and buying metals which she runs from home.

With this loan, which she will repay in 5 months, she would like to purchase metals such as copper, bronze and aluminium. She will also fix up the rooms that she rents, and she will purchase more food for her chickens.

Sonia thinks of herself as an entrepreneur because she started all of these businesses and she administrates them on her own. This is why she's very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all the support she's giving her.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Cesar Vallejo, ubicado en Jr Maya D. Brito 673, distrito D. Calleria, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 46 años, es madre D. 2 hijos que aún dependen D. ella, es casada y su esposo es comerciante. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300 que recibió D. Manuela Ramos deciD. invertir en un negocio D. compra y venta D. metales. En la actualidad cuenta con un negocio D. compra y venta D. todo tipo D. metales, además posee un galpón D. pollos y con un negocio D. alquiler D. habitaciones. Se levanta a las 5 D. la mañana para colocarles agua y comida a sus pollos, luego prepara el desayuno D. su esposo y el D. sus hijos y por último se dedica a atender su negocio D. compra y venta D. metales en su casa. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,500, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra D. metales tales como cobre, bronce, aluminio; también invertirá en la refacción D. las habitaciones que alquila y en la compra D. comida para sus pollos. Sonia se considera una mujer emprendedora porque posee varios negocios que ella misma los administra, es por ello que está muy agradecida por todo el apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase metals such as copper, bronze, aluminium and to fix up her rentals

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a 32-year-old mother of 3, and a resident of Tandika. She sells wood and carpentry materials for construction purposes. She orders it from the Morogoro region and the Rufigi area. Recently, the forest authority has restricted deforestation, and this has affected her business. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business into other areas.

loans.use: Expand her construction business

loans.name: Mercedes Lilian

texts.en:
She lives in the The Liberty with her family that is composed of four people who depend on her financially. She is dedicated to the making of typical food such as tamales (stuffed corn breads), and others that she distributes to her neighbors and plant workers. It is near her home and has been running for five years. Her clients know the restaurant and search it out. The income she earns from this works provides her children with an education and helps to get more products to prepare and sell. This is her first loan with the institution, and it will help her to be able to buy materials to diversify the range of products she offers her clients. Investments like this have helped her in the past and will give her what is necessary to help her continue.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Actualmente vive en La libertad su grupo familiar lo componen cuatro personas que dependen económicamente de la solicitante, la señora se dedica a la elaboración de comida típica tales como tamales pasteles y otros que distribuye con vecinos y trabajadores de una planta asfáltica que esta pegado a su vivienda tiene aproximadamente cinco años de dedicarse al negocio, su clientes ya la conocen y la buscan, el negocio le a aportado los ingresos necesarios para poder dar educación a sus hijas que son dos ellas le ayudan en la preparación de materiales y la venta de los mismos , este es su primer crédito con la institución , el crédito le ayudara a poder comprar mas materia prima y poder surtir a la misma vez con otros productos que vende tales como ropa para dama y caballeros, estas inversiones son las que le han ayudado durante estos años atrás y le darán lo necesario para seguir adelante.

loans.use: Credit to buy raw materials to make tamales (corn bread stuffed with meat)

loans.name: Khadija's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Khadija is 34 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, ages 14, 12, 5 and 3 years old. She and her husband also take care of 1 other child, 13 years old. Khadija owns a small shop, which she started in 2002. Every day, she works from 6 am to 10 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (juice, soda, maize flour and rice) for her shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mary, who has a business dealing in food sales to the market.

loans.use: To buy more items (juice, soda, maize flour, and rice) for her shop

loans.name: Mach

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach C. and her husband, Mr. Vichet Saroeyn were married in 2006. They have one daughter. The couple lives with their parents about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Mach and her husband work for a company. Besides their full time work, both husband and wife also raise pigs at home. Now Mrs. Mach is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase piglets and feed for raising pigs.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed for raising pigs.

loans.name: Dewa Ayu Rai Arti

texts.id:
Dewa Ayu Rai Arto is a housewife that also operates a small kiosk at her home. To supplement her income, Dewa Ayu Rai tried to farm pigs with financial and technical help from DINARI. She bought one breeding pig and feeds with her first loan. That pig gave birth to 10 piglets in 6 months. She sold those 10 piglets for $27 total. Dewa Ayu RAi earned $44 more than she used to. So she decided to seek second loan from DINARI. This second loan will be used to purchase another breeder pig., so her farm will produce more piglets that she can sell. With training and guidance from DINARI, Dewa Ayu Rai hopes to earn higher income than before.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Dewa Ayu Rai Arti adalah seorang Ibu rumah tangga yang sehari-hari berjualan di warung miliknya di rumah. Untuk menambah penghasilan warungnya Dewa Ayu Rai mencoba beternak babi dengan meminjam ke DINARI. Dari pinjaman periode pertama dibelikannya seekor induk babi beserta pakannya kemudian dipelihara selama 6 bulan dan melahirkan 10 ekor anak babi. Setelah penjualan 10 anak babi tersebut dimana per ekor laku dijual sebesar Rp.250.000,- Dewa Ayu Rai memperoleh peningkatan pendapatan sebesar Rp. 400.000,-. Sehingga Dewa Ayu Rai memutuskan untuk melanjutkan pinjaman ke DINARI untuk periode kedua dengan jumlah pinjaman yang sama. Pinjaman kedua ini nantinya akan dibelikan seekor induk babi lagi sehingga akan terjadi penambahan jumlah anak babi yang dilahirkan. Dengan bimbingan dan pelatihan dari DINARI nantinya Dewa Ayu Rai berharap akan mendapatkan hasil yang lebih tinggi lagi dari sebelumnya.

loans.use: Purchase feeds and breeding pig

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly is a good client, very hard-working.  She has three children to support; her husband is a driver.  She works from very early in the morning until very late at night, in different parts of the city of El Alto.  She's an unassuming woman and very commited to working because she wants her children to know that with a little sacrifice one can get ahead in life in an honest way.
Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer
Es una buena cliente es muy trabajadora ella tiene tres niños que mantiene, su esposo se dedica a 

manejar una movilidad, trabaja desde muy temprano hasta muy altas horas de la noche en distintas 

zonas de la Ciudad de el Alto es de clase sencilla y muy responsable en su trabajo, ya que quiere 

demostrar a sus hijos que con un poco de sacrificio se puede salir en la vida en una forma honesta.

loans.use: Increase working capital.

loans.name: Isabel Violeta

texts.es:
Isabel is 23 years old and lives with her brother and father. Half a year ago, she opened her phone shop realizing that there was an opportunity in her area for phone service as well as internet access. She runs her shop from Monday to Friday, resting on the weekends as she is pregnant. Her brother takes care of the shop on Saturdays and Sundays. isabel likes the business which allows her to take care of her family. As the baby's father is irresponsible, she will have to take care of her baby on her own. In the future she would like to open more locations for her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase phone cards, as well as apply for the licensing she needs from her municipality.

Isabel tiene 23 años, vive con su hermana y su padre, ella está actualmente embarazada. En sus enormes deseos de superación decide abrir su locutorio hace mas de medio año, invirtiendo así, adecuadamente su capital, con buen ojo se percató que ese servicio era lo que necesitaba su localidad.También agregó cabinas de Internet, atiende de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana descansa dejando a su hermana en el cuidado y atención, Isabel está satisfecha de este trabajo que le permite el sustento de su familia y con el que podrá mantener a su bebe, ya que se valdrá sola, debido a la irresponsabilidad del que fue su pareja. En el futuro quiere tener varios establecimientos, y adicionalmente una botica. Isabel solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas, recargas virtuales y también realizar el trámite para la licencia de funcionamiento municipal.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE PHONE CARDS FOR HER BUSINESS, AS WELL AS PAY FOR THE APPLICATION TO OBTAIN A LICENSE FOR HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D. est une femme mariée agée de 52 ans.elle fait du petit commerce de tissus, parfums,huile de palme etc depuis quinze ans
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatou D. is 52 years old and married. She has kept up a small business selling fabrics, perfumes palm oil etc for fifteen years.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of fabrics

loans.name: Sihaba

texts.en: Sihaba has had a shop selling dresses, charcoal, and bananas in Zanzibar since 2004. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 10. She works daily from 7:00am to 6:00pm which allows her to earn a profit of approximately $65 each month. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to expand her business and increase her profit.

loans.use: Sihaba would like to buy more products for her business.

loans.name: Zuhur

texts.en:
Zuhur M. is 33 years old, married and has three children. Zuhur has a middle special education in engineering but he earns his living in agriculture. He earns a small salary used to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. Zuhur works hard to cultivate his products such as apples, pear, and grapes. He works from early morning until late at night hoping to have a rich harvest. Zuhur sells his harvest in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His works fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and to grow his business. 

 Zuhur is requesting a loan of $750 USD for the term of 12 months to buy necessary materials for storing his products so that he can sell them at a later date when the price for them will increase.

loans.use: Purchasing necessary materials for storing his products

loans.name: Nobar

texts.en:
Nobar I., who lives with her husband and four children, manages the shop she opened three years ago selling home supplies to contribute to her family's income and standard of living. Her husband works as a labourer in their village.

She now sees the potential for a significant business expansion by purchasing additional inventories of kitchen supplies and so is requesting a loan of $1200. The resulting increase in profits will allow her to start saving money for her children's education. Nobar thanks you for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her store.

loans.name: Nelson Franklin

texts.es:
Nelson se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y  la producción de legumbres, cereales y flores cuya producción  lo comercializa en uno de los mercados mas populares de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Palomar de la Provincia Murillo del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su madre, la cual posee una carnicería en el pueblo con lo que colabora a los ingresos de la familia. Quien por descuido y la falta de atención medica se fue agravando una infección en el ojo, pero con la ayuda de médicos cubanos que generalmente hacen su recorrido por las comunidades le hicieron una operación gratuita y ya se encuentra en proceso de recuperación
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera de  mediana calidad y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Nelson raises dairy cattle and also grows vegetables, grains and flowers which he sells in one of the most popular markets of the city of La Paz. He lives in the Palomar community of the province of Murillo of the department of La Paz, which is located two hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his mother, who has a meat market in the town which adds to the income of the family. Due to carelessness and lack of medical care, his mother had an eye infection that was getting progressively worse. With the help of Cuban doctors, who travel through the communities, she had a free operation and is in the process of recuperating. The loan will be used for the purchase of a dairy cow of average quality. This will increase the milk production and therefore his income. This is the first loan with Impro. The credit evaluation qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Babirye Sumayiya's Group

texts.en:
Sumayiya is the leader of a five member group. She is 35 years old and married with four children, who are between the ages of 2 and 12. Two of her children go to school. She also takes care of her old parents. She resides in a rented three-roomed house in which eight people stay. They have electricity but no piped water at home. The family gets two meals a day.

Sumayiya works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. She sells charcoal from her home in Mengo Mackay, which is one of the city suburbs. She works seven days a week and doesn’t have any transport costs. She sells to an average of 20 customers a day and to all categories of people. She is faced with the challenge of the rainy season and defaulting of her would-be customers.

Sumayiya has been in this business for the last seven years and in MCDT for one and half years. She is servicing her second loan, working all along with the same groupmates. Sumayiya‘s monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family. She wants to use this loan to buy a more sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long K. is 34 years old and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make US$ 2 a day. Long has one child and so far she is still living with her elderly mother. Lately, she has requested a loan to purchase a grinding machine. This mill will be a service to the local farmers to take off the rice husk and an income-generating business for Long. (Long's husband is pictured at their home.)

loans.use: To purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhen L. (took a picture with her daughter), 62, was married in 1966 and has six children: four sons and two daughters. Two of them were married and live outside the family house, two daughters are silk weavers and one son works in a garment factory that produce jean. Besides her children Chhen also has two sons in-law and two grandchildren are living with her. The family lives on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 
 
Chhen has been a silk weaver since she was sixteen years old. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Chhen hopes to continue her weaving business, it’s a main business for her to earn income to support her family that why she is applying for her first loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for her purpose.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.en:
Since she was very young, Marta has worked alongside her family in the production of candles. In addition she makes and sells clothes such as güipiles (traditional Guatemalan weavings) with specific designs from the area of San Pedro. 

She originally started making and selling candles in San Pedro, where she lives, but then began to sell them in nearby towns like Chimaltenango, Pachalum, and San Antonio Aguas Calientes. When she has time, she always weaves at home. 

As her business has grown, Marta sees the potential that more capital can offer. In spite of the economic situation, she has continued working hard and struggling, although her candle workshop still lacks many things. With her loan she will invest in purchasing materials such as wax, the basic material used to make the candles. 

In addition, the cost of the thread that she uses to make the güipiles has risen. She would like to use part of her loan to purchase thread in bulk so that she has enough materials to meet the demands of her clients who continue to place orders. Her goal is to continue moving forward so that she can provide for her children and improve their situation day by day. 

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow


Doña Marta desde muy pequeña junto a su familia se dedican a la elaboración de candelas y veladoras también a la venta y elaboración de tejidos como güipiles San Pedranos. El tejido siempre lo hace en casa. El negocio elaborar y vender las candelas lo inicio en el pueblo de San Pedro donde ella vive, pero luego empezó en otros pueblos como Chimaltenango, Pachalum, y San Antonio Aguas Calientes. Por tal motivo ve la necesidad de mas capital, a pesar de la situación económica siguen luchando pero faltan muchas cosas aun para invertir en el taller donde fabrican las candelas y veladores, necesita mas capital para comprar parafina que es el material básico para las candelas. También el hilo para los güipiles ha subido por tal motivo desea comprar mas ya que siempre sus manos no han descansado en hacerlos ya que tiene clientes que le hacen pedidos a quienes entrega lo que piden. Su meta es salir adelante para que sus hijos tengan lo necesario y que pueda mejorar cada día.

loans.use: Materials for candle-making and weaving

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 49 years old and a resident of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela. She is married to Romeo D. V., and they are blessed with four children: Joseph, 28; Romnick, 25; Junmark, 23; and Jordan, 21. They were not able to pursue their college education but still she is thankful that they grew up as responsible individuals.

She runs a sari-sari store (community-based store) business in their village. She is glad that she can earn a daily income of 300 PHP. To meet the needs of her customers and increase her income, she is requesting a loan for $225 (10,000 PHP) that she can use as additional capital for her store. They sometimes experience financial difficulties in the family, but through their joint efforts, her husband and children were able to surpass the crisis. She wants to be more productive and to become successful in her field of endeavor. She wants to have her business grow so she can help her family.

loans.use: Purchase more goods to sell in sari-sari store

loans.name: Rahmatboy

texts.ru:
Рахматбой Тураев  уже около 11 лет занимается животноводством.
 Место его деятельности, его дом. Помогают ему в откорме скота и переработке молока его дети и жена. Рахматбой хочет получить займ 1200 сомони на 6 месяцев, для того чтобы использовать его в животноводстве.
 Он проживает в Ганчинском районе вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en:
Rahmatboy T. has raised livestock for nearly 11 years, and works out of his home. His wife and children help him to feed the cattle and process the milk. Rahmatboy wants to take out a six-month loan in the amount of 1200 somoni to use for livestock. He lives together with his family in the Ganchin district.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cattle and selling dairy products

loans.name: Sharaf

texts.ru: Азизов Шараф житель района Варзоб. Возраст 29 лет, холост. Живет  с родителями и семьей брата. Работает на Врзобской гидроэлектростанции охранником. Кроме того в свободное он занимается животноводством.Имеет небольшое хозяйство. Планирует получить кредит на который хочет купить дойную корову.Ухаживать за коровой будет его мать. Молоко , которое будут получать смогут использовать в хозяйстве , а часть даже смогут продавать.
texts.en:
Sharaf A. lives in the Varzob district. He is 29 years old and a bachelor. He lives with his parents and brother's family, and works as a security guard at the Vrzobskaya hydroelectric station. In his free time he also raises livestock on a small scale. He would like to use a loan to buy a dairy cow, which his mother will care for. Milk from the cow will be used by the family, and maybe part will even be sold.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand number of livestock

loans.name: Sherimar

texts.en:
Sherimar is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 from Kiva that she will utilize in maintaining her direct-selling business of Avon, Natasha and MSE products. She would like to grow her business to be able to continue to support her family.

Sherimar generates an income of at least PHP 4,000 monthly and, according to her, it is really a great help to her family. She also manufactures homemade peanut butter as another source of income. Her brothers and sisters are still studying and she works hard to give them the support they expect from her. She hopes not to disappoint them on that matter and she believes that, “If there’s a will, there’s a way”.

Sherimar is 27 years old and is a resident of Barangay San Manuel of Naguilian, Isabela. She is still single and is the eldest child of her parents and graduated from high school. She once worked in Taiwan as a domestic helper for six months and in Jordan for three years. She is a very responsible child to her parents and a good sister to her siblings. She supports her parents and seven sisters and brothers in their schooling through investing her saved income and from the revenue from her businesses.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah A. is a widow with two children. She has received no formal education. Hannah sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen and sends to her home to process before selling it at the market. She does her business at Kormantse near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1985.

Hannah uses her income to pay for her grandchildren’s education. Hannah will use the loan to buy more fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Hannah plans to further expand her fish-selling business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Lưu's Group

texts.en:
H. Lưu Thị is a 27-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a six-member group through SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phù Lưu 06.


H. is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, H. owns and operates a general store.  While not the onL. means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primariL. from selling daiL. use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximateL. 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfulL. repaid a previous loan of 3,186,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her famiL.'s income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. is a 25-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T.nh is a 23-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. is a 33-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector running a food stall.


4.  Trần Thị T. is a 36-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector running a general store.


5.  Nguyễn Thị D. is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costL., Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H. Lưu Thị là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  H. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phù Lưu 06 (6).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2008, H. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.186.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị L. là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


2.  Nguyễn Thị T.nh là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


4.  Trần Thị T. là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


5.  Nguyễn Thị D. là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dioselina

texts.es:
Dioselina es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
Dioselina es soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Dioselina vende productos de limpieza y ferretería, sus ventas son al por mayor y los realiza a las diferentes tiendas y ferreterías de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Andahuaylas. Además Dioselina vende artículos de electricidad en diferente ferias de la región.
Diocelina necesita un préstamo de 3500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de escobas.
Diocelina sueña con tener distribuidoras en otros departamentos y tener una tienda mayorista de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Dioselina is a member of Buena Suerte Communal Bank (Buena Suerte translates to "Good luck"). Dioselina is single, twenty-seven years old, and the mother one. Dioselina sells cleaning products and hardware,in wholesale, to different shops and hardware stores in Ayacucho, Andahuaylas. In addition, Dioselina sells electronics at different fairs in the area. Diocelina needs a loan of S./ 3500, which she will use to buy brooms. Diocelina dreams of having doing wholesale in other areas, and of having a wholesale grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing brooms

loans.name: Koem En

texts.en:
Mrs. Koem En P. lives in Poun village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to plow the rice field and to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Koem En P. is 26 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Sam Sopheak, is a motorbike taxi driver and he is shown with her in the photo.
