loans.use: To pay for plowing the rice field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Gie Mayor Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes venus pour demander le renouvellement du prêt numéro 25243, dont nous avons fini le remboursement depuis fort longtemps. Nous attendions le moment propice pour nous remettre au travail que nous avions suspendu pour faire les travaux champêtres, qui se font traditionnellement pendant l'hivernage dans notre pays.maintenant, nous voulons reprendre les activité pour lesquelles vous nous avez donné un premier financement(réf:25243). il faut dire au passage, que nous sommes très satisfaites du premier prêt qui nous à aider à pouvoir faire face aux difficultés liées à l'hivernage. Maintenant que nous sommes plus expérimentés, nous allons acheter des produits dont les populations ont vraiment besoins, puisque maintenant nous connaissons leurs besoins.
texts.en:
We came to request for renewal of loan number 25243 of which we finished repayment a long time ago. We have been waiting for the right moment to go back to work that we suspended in order to do our farm work which is done traditionally during the raining season in our country. We now want to resume the business for which you gave us the first financing (ref: 25243). It must be said, by the way, that we are pleased with the first loan which helped us to be able to meet the difficulties associated with the farming season . Now that we are more experienced, we will purchase items that the people really want, since we know their needs

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of domeatic products and foodstuffs

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: K. Loice has a Mimi super market in Nateete area. She is a dynamic lady of twenty-nine years old. She is married with one child. She has been doing this business for four years. She is using the loan to purchase variety of supermarket items such as kitchen stuffs, utensils, food, cereals, fruits, drinks, to mention but a few to expand the business for more customers. Her aim is to educate her child in good schools up to university level.

loans.use: To purchase varienty supermarket items such as kitchen stuffs, utensils, food, cereals, fruits, drinks, to mention but a few to expand the business for more customers.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en:
Randa is a 49 year old woman who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with her husband and their child. Randa has been sewing and selling clothes from her house since 2000. She mainly sells women and lingerie. Randa requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase new clothes to sell. This is her second cycle and she has paid her first loan back on time. 
Randa is special in her work because she sells good quality of clothes, as well as she keeps current styles. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she didn’t have a lot of cash to expand her stock but worked hard to succeed. Randa decided on doing her business because she has a large network. In the future, she plans to keep on working hard and becoming financially successful.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sim Chhit Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank loA. consists of sixteen people and they all live in Phngeas village in Takeo province. Sim C., a village chief, is president and was selected by the members. His wife, Nat Nhorn is a rice farmer who owns a plot of land. She faces a problem because her field is infertile. Sim C. decided to ask for a loA. to buy fertilizers to renew the field.

Chanthorn U., who is sharing in the loA. is not present in the photo.  Her husband is pictured.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer to support the field to make a crop more productive.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
For about a year, Fatima Q. has prepared and sold fried yam with fried fish and pepper sauce at Elmina near Atabadzi. Fatima has two children. She has received a junior high education. Fatima uses her income toward the payment of apartment rent and utility bills.

Fatima will use the loan to purchase more yams for use in her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Fatima plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more yams for use in her food business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria D. is 43 years old, and has been married to Isacio Santacruz, who is 45 years old, for 19 years. They have two children, 17 and 8 years old, who are both in school.

Maria started her business 22 years ago, before she was married. She has built up a loyal clientele for her business, working with colleges, schools, companies, making uniforms and shirts with their logos. Her husband works in agriculture and has a truck that he uses to transport his produce from his farm to a local factory.

Maria will use this loan to buy more fabric, which she needs to satisfy all her orders this year.

loans.use: To buy fabric and materials.

loans.name: Giovani

texts.es:
Giovani  es una socia  emprendedora y muy dinámica; vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Tiene 33 años, madre de 2 hijos adolescentes y se dedica a la venta de ladrillos al por mayor y menor; cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en una fàbrica de ladrillos.
Siente que su negocio ha mejorado ya que sus ventas son mayores.
Giovany es una de las integrantes del Banco Comunal “Las Lomas de Yarina” desde hace siete años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuewos soles, que le permitieron invertir en la compra de polos para vender a sus conocidos. 
Ahora Giovanni necesita un crédito de 3,000.00 soles, que serán utilizados para comprar seis millares de ladrillos para vender. 
La meta de Giovany es tener una tienda de prendas de vestir y accesoR. para damas.
texts.en:
Giovani is one our enterprising and dynamic members. She lives in the District of Yarina Cocha, Ucayali region. Giovani is 33 years old and the mother of two teenage children.

She sells bricks wholesale and retail. Giovani has the support of her husband, who works at a brick factory. She has been a member of the Communal Bank “Las Lomas de Yarina” for seven years. The first loan she received was in the amount of 300 soles, which allowed her to purchase polo shirts to sell to acquaintances. Giovani is now requesting a loan of 3000 soles to purchase 6000 bricks to sell.

Her goal is open a store where she can sell women’s clothing and accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 6000 bricks to sell
